ce9bfee5-b108-4396-b7d6-8d988ea53f32.summary: Rejecting the principle that freedom requires the ability to do otherwise
ce9bfee5-b108-4396-b7d6-8d988ea53f32.content: {It is false that freedom requires the ability to do otherwise}, {Autonomy is about acting in accordance with one's own values and reasoning, not about having multiple possible actions}, {An individual can be free in the sense of autonomy even if their actions are determined, as long as they are self-governing}

9f2b44bb-6073-4797-bcc2-c7f7d0d63dfc.summary: Supplementing with a compatibilist understanding of freedom
9f2b44bb-6073-4797-bcc2-c7f7d0d63dfc.content: {Compatibilism is the view that freedom is compatible with determinism}, {Freedom as autonomy can be understood in a compatibilist sense, where self-governance is possible even in a determined world}, {An individual can be autonomous if they act according to their own values and reasoning, regardless of whether their actions are determined}

cb432ad7-bab7-48e8-a200-5aa2c150abcd.content: {Freedom is the ability to express oneself}, {Autonomy involves making decisions that reflect one's true self}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act in ways that express their identity}

c5cf63f5-0fac-4f61-866f-ab6b31591ee6.content: {Freedom is the ability to be true to oneself}, {Autonomy involves making decisions that align with one's authentic desires}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act according to their genuine inclinations}

6d9675ac-8a21-4e94-b1a3-57bd07909870.content: {Freedom is the ability to determine one's own path}, {Autonomy involves making decisions that are self-directed}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can pursue their own goals without external interference}

34e4aa23-93da-4de9-b605-415de6ea5e22.content: {Freedom is the ability to empower oneself}, {Autonomy involves making decisions that enhance one's power and capabilities}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act in ways that increase their agency}

090ebb28-9234-4ce5-be18-e1e8de729365.content: {Freedom is the ability to create oneself}, {Autonomy involves making decisions that shape one's identity}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act in ways that contribute to their self-creation}

2edc78e0-9be5-46e1-9587-005a42dc6959.content: {Freedom is the ability to act as a moral agent}, {Autonomy involves making decisions that reflect moral considerations}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act according to their moral judgments}

fe8257b3-02c5-42cb-b9c9-89c522fbf442.content: {There is a distinction between autonomy and rationality}, {Autonomy is about self-governance, not necessarily rational decision-making}, {A person can be autonomous even if their decisions are based on irrational impulses}, {The intuition that autonomy requires rationality can be explained by conflating autonomy with rational decision-making}

5ba88250-0795-48b3-b1c0-da31483aed0c.summary: Rejecting the necessity of rationality for autonomy
5ba88250-0795-48b3-b1c0-da31483aed0c.content: {It is false that autonomy requires decisions to be based on rational reasoning}, {Autonomy involves acting according to one's own will, regardless of the rationality of the decision}, {The appearance that autonomy requires rationality is due to a misunderstanding of what it means to govern oneself}

e94a2e96-bcf5-4dfb-a35e-f825ea7df574.summary: Supplementing autonomy with a broader understanding of self-governance
e94a2e96-bcf5-4dfb-a35e-f825ea7df574.content: {Self-governance can include decisions based on irrational impulses if they align with one's values}, {Autonomy is achieved when individuals act according to their own will, even if the reasoning is not rational}, {The objection loses its force when autonomy is understood as broader than rational decision-making}

6b0a4981-9429-442c-8b4b-65de63f70382.content: {Freedom is the ability to govern oneself}, {Self-determination involves making decisions based on one's own values and reasoning}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act according to their own will within a framework that they have a role in shaping}

e9231e08-8161-4198-9d1e-eedc46777851.content: {Freedom is the ability to govern oneself}, {Autonomy involves making decisions based on one's own values and reasoning}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act according to their own will and participate in the creation of the laws that govern them}

ac6971d2-6073-44a9-a376-1c77efb7cadc.content: {Freedom is the ability to govern oneself}, {Autonomy involves making decisions based on one's own values and reasoning}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act according to their own will and reflectively endorse the laws under which they live}

ad0009ce-eaa1-4623-8f61-08fcf334148e.content: {Freedom is the ability to govern oneself}, {Autonomy involves making decisions based on one's own values and reasoning}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act according to their own will and the laws are coherent with their values and reasoning}

2570fe15-d9dd-4e81-94a3-cb70535997b4.content: {Freedom is the ability to govern oneself}, {Autonomy involves making decisions based on one's own values and reasoning}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act according to their own will and the laws are consistent with their deeply held values}

b77fde35-b073-4ba2-b04c-ae07b292a493.content: {Freedom is the ability to govern oneself}, {Autonomy involves making decisions based on one's own values and reasoning}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act according to their own will and the laws are the result of rational deliberation}

d376d1c1-49bb-4b2d-bd6d-fb5f5bd8e327.content: {Freedom is the ability to govern oneself}, {Autonomy involves making decisions based on one's own values and reasoning}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act according to their own will and engage in dialogue about the laws that affect them}

e4154b53-1936-4826-80d9-23c06d6c7513.content: {Freedom is the ability to govern oneself}, {Autonomy involves making decisions based on one's own values and reasoning}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act according to their own will and the laws are sensitive to the context of their lives}

3ce23235-cef9-4915-8288-4b91442e6127.content: {Freedom is the ability to govern oneself}, {Autonomy involves making decisions based on one's own values and reasoning}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act according to their own will and the laws are integrated with their personal and social identities}

c0af45af-8454-4aee-b399-b3fb9a7d2f45.content: {Freedom is the ability to govern oneself}, {Autonomy involves making decisions based on one's own values and reasoning}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act according to their own will and are empowered to influence the laws that govern them}

e2bd514b-39e0-487d-91f0-3bd232574e5f.summary: Distinguishing between internal and external constraints
e2bd514b-39e0-487d-91f0-3bd232574e5f.content: {There is a distinction between internal constraints, which are self-imposed, and external constraints, which are imposed by others.}, {Freedom as autonomy primarily concerns internal constraints, focusing on self-governance and decision-making based on personal values.}, {Restrictive laws are external constraints, but they do not necessarily undermine autonomy if individuals can still make decisions based on their own values within those laws.}, {The intuition that restrictive laws negate liberty can be explained by conflating autonomy with the absence of all external constraints.}

c1e4f11d-b5a3-47a1-8745-b259bfaa0443.summary: Rejecting the principle that liberty requires absence of restrictive laws
c1e4f11d-b5a3-47a1-8745-b259bfaa0443.content: {It is false that liberty requires the complete absence of restrictive laws.}, {Liberty as autonomy is about the ability to act according to one's own will, which can be maintained even within a framework of laws.}, {Restrictive laws can coexist with autonomy if they do not prevent individuals from making decisions based on their own values and reasoning.}

620a38ad-6cb5-4ae8-9b94-d31352739c1b.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of rational acceptance of laws
620a38ad-6cb5-4ae8-9b94-d31352739c1b.content: {Individuals can rationally accept certain restrictive laws as part of a social contract.}, {Autonomy involves making decisions based on one's own values, which can include valuing social order and cooperation.}, {Liberty is not undermined if individuals autonomously choose to accept and abide by laws they deem rational and beneficial.}

1664ac5b-3b1b-420e-bd85-d615702e09cc.summary: Freedom as Autonomy with Sufficient Choices
1664ac5b-3b1b-420e-bd85-d615702e09cc.content: {Freedom is the ability to govern oneself}, {Autonomy involves making decisions based on one's own values and reasoning}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act according to their own will}, {Freedom requires a sufficient range of choices to be meaningful}

1bf7f16b-70c0-4aa1-93d6-9000002f62bb.summary: Freedom as Autonomy with Potential Choices
1bf7f16b-70c0-4aa1-93d6-9000002f62bb.content: {Freedom is the ability to govern oneself}, {Autonomy involves making decisions based on one's own values and reasoning}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act according to their own will}, {Freedom is maintained if there is a potential for a wide range of choices, even if not all are currently available}

0085b41c-9a26-4847-aa10-682d2f5f03d8.summary: Freedom as Autonomy with Internal Choice
0085b41c-9a26-4847-aa10-682d2f5f03d8.content: {Freedom is the ability to govern oneself}, {Autonomy involves making decisions based on one's own values and reasoning}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act according to their own will}, {Freedom is primarily about internal choice and self-determination rather than external options}

6981ee1a-b3f9-4804-90ad-afa4cc7b0301.summary: Freedom as Autonomy with Adaptive Preferences
6981ee1a-b3f9-4804-90ad-afa4cc7b0301.content: {Freedom is the ability to govern oneself}, {Autonomy involves making decisions based on one's own values and reasoning}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act according to their own will}, {Freedom includes the ability to adapt preferences to available choices}

b0d420f2-c535-4f8a-8f42-f6728f86be87.summary: Freedom as Autonomy with Contextual Choice
b0d420f2-c535-4f8a-8f42-f6728f86be87.content: {Freedom is the ability to govern oneself}, {Autonomy involves making decisions based on one's own values and reasoning}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act according to their own will}, {Freedom is context-dependent and can be achieved with limited choices if they align with one's values}

738d1fc9-a2ea-4e4a-a6ee-dca18e652ee6.summary: Distinguishing between autonomy and range of choices
738d1fc9-a2ea-4e4a-a6ee-dca18e652ee6.content: {There is a distinction between autonomy and the range of choices available}, {Freedom as autonomy is concerned with the ability to make decisions based on one's own values and reasoning, not the number of choices}, {An individual can be autonomous even with a limited set of choices if those choices align with their values and reasoning}, {The intuition that limited choices undermine freedom can be explained by conflating autonomy with the availability of options}

8f34a503-8d29-477d-ba9b-f201def8844f.summary: Rejecting the principle that freedom requires a wide range of choices
8f34a503-8d29-477d-ba9b-f201def8844f.content: {It is false that freedom requires a wide range of choices}, {Freedom as autonomy is about self-governance and decision-making based on personal values, not the quantity of choices}, {An individual can achieve autonomy even with limited choices if they can act according to their own will and values}

a784958a-ce88-40eb-a73f-c0714a220a6a.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of meaningful choices
a784958a-ce88-40eb-a73f-c0714a220a6a.content: {Freedom as autonomy can be supplemented with the assumption that meaningful choices are available}, {Meaningful choices are those that allow individuals to express their values and reasoning}, {Even with a limited set of choices, if those choices are meaningful, autonomy and thus freedom can be achieved}, {The objection loses its force if we assume that the available choices are meaningful and aligned with personal values}

396c7636-a647-4007-b66f-3f02e579497a.content: {Freedom is the ability to govern oneself}, {Autonomy involves making decisions that one reflectively endorses as one's own}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act according to their own reflectively endorsed values}

700345e3-5b40-473d-b4b3-0116ff923210.content: {Freedom is the ability to govern oneself}, {Autonomy involves making decisions that are authentic to one's true self}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act according to their authentic desires and values}

f011c938-678a-421f-b16b-93fa32091593.content: {Freedom is the ability to govern oneself}, {Autonomy involves making decisions through rational deliberation}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act according to decisions made through rational deliberation}

7b88eace-3a36-43ef-a7f3-8c6941eab5a7.content: {Freedom is the ability to govern oneself}, {Autonomy involves making decisions that are coherently integrated with one's overall set of values and beliefs}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act according to a coherently integrated set of values and beliefs}

ac74cd05-0d5d-478c-8c50-f4d738d2a921.content: {Freedom is the ability to govern oneself}, {Autonomy involves making decisions after critical reflection on one's values and beliefs}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act according to values and beliefs that have been critically reflected upon}

cba7ef04-4665-459f-93fe-06d32a796daf.content: {Freedom is the ability to govern oneself}, {Autonomy involves making decisions that align with one's deeply held values}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act according to their deeply held values}

67f9fee9-eacf-4192-8df4-f83d34134c93.content: {Freedom is the ability to govern oneself}, {Autonomy involves making decisions that are determined by oneself rather than external forces}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act according to self-determined decisions}

df09537b-17b4-47f0-92da-63371a37d941.content: {Freedom is the ability to govern oneself}, {Autonomy involves making decisions that maintain personal integrity}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act in ways that maintain their personal integrity}

bb819f40-e306-4852-b67c-87c431064861.content: {Freedom is the ability to govern oneself}, {Autonomy involves making decisions based on informed choices}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act according to informed choices}

7cfd99d3-48cf-44fd-9c68-961f1d47d206.content: {Freedom is the ability to govern oneself}, {Autonomy involves making decisions that express one's true self}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act in ways that express their true self}

7268c1e9-4ef3-4a5a-ac09-bf2b349c6ca3.summary: Distinguishing between internal and external autonomy
7268c1e9-4ef3-4a5a-ac09-bf2b349c6ca3.content: {There is a distinction between internal autonomy and external autonomy}, {Internal autonomy involves making decisions based on one's own values and reasoning, regardless of social norms}, {External autonomy involves the ability to act independently of external influences, including social norms}, {Freedom as autonomy is primarily concerned with internal autonomy, not external autonomy}, {A person can be internally autonomous even if their decisions align with social norms, as long as those decisions are based on their own values}

16cce57c-87bb-44dc-95c1-28fd2cdfd300.summary: Rejecting the necessity of independence from social norms
16cce57c-87bb-44dc-95c1-28fd2cdfd300.content: {It is false that autonomy requires complete independence from social norms}, {Autonomy involves making decisions based on one's own values, which can include social norms if they are genuinely endorsed}, {A person can be autonomous even if their decisions are influenced by social norms, provided those norms are integrated into their own value system}, {The intuition that autonomy requires independence from social norms is mistaken if it overlooks the role of personal endorsement}

48659fef-56f7-4738-a623-04135578380a.summary: Supplementing with the concept of reflective endorsement
48659fef-56f7-4738-a623-04135578380a.content: {Reflective endorsement is the process of critically evaluating and accepting certain values or norms as one's own}, {Autonomy requires reflective endorsement of values, not independence from social norms}, {A person can be autonomous if they have reflectively endorsed social norms as part of their value system}, {The objection loses its force when autonomy is understood as involving reflective endorsement rather than mere independence}

ecfb137f-901d-48c6-bf34-83848fed29c0.content: {Freedom is the ability to govern oneself}, {Autonomy involves making decisions based on one's own values and reasoning}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act according to their own will with knowledge of relevant facts}

18030563-106e-4ea6-a3b7-51d16d213f94.content: {Freedom is the ability to govern oneself}, {Autonomy involves making decisions based on one's own values and reasoning}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act according to their own will with awareness of the context}

6cb899d4-eb7f-4c3e-9ddc-36475516f154.content: {Freedom is the ability to govern oneself}, {Autonomy involves making decisions based on one's own values and reasoning}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act according to their own will with enlightenment about their situation}

9cc97da9-acdc-4da1-bcf9-dbf99f3d8023.content: {Freedom is the ability to govern oneself}, {Autonomy involves making decisions based on one's own values and reasoning}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act according to their own will with comprehensive knowledge}

aebaf1a5-58ca-4e04-8e4d-4eca6d513a88.content: {Freedom is the ability to govern oneself}, {Autonomy involves making decisions based on one's own values and reasoning}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act according to their own will with an educated understanding}

cd3fd3c1-eb02-4857-aa7d-8a19500d01eb.content: {Freedom is the ability to govern oneself}, {Autonomy involves making decisions based on one's own values and reasoning}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act according to their own will with insight into relevant facts}

71a4dcbb-d9ee-4ee5-87b6-233b1ab32028.content: {Freedom is the ability to govern oneself}, {Autonomy involves making decisions based on one's own values and reasoning}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act according to their own will with discernment of important information}

355db47c-f546-49a5-b388-9d90aec540e6.summary: Distinguishing between autonomy and informed autonomy
355db47c-f546-49a5-b388-9d90aec540e6.content: {There is a distinction between autonomy and informed autonomy}, {Freedom as autonomy is a theory about the ability to govern oneself, not necessarily with full information}, {Liberty as acting according to one's own will does not require complete knowledge of all relevant facts}, {The intuition that liberty requires knowledge can be explained as a confusion between autonomy and informed autonomy}

98552bf3-bc4a-4389-909f-29a333bb5b00.summary: Rejecting the principle that liberty requires knowledge
98552bf3-bc4a-4389-909f-29a333bb5b00.content: {It is false that liberty requires knowledge of all relevant facts}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act according to their own will, regardless of their state of knowledge}, {The appearance that liberty is compromised by ignorance is mistaken, as autonomy is about self-governance, not informed decision-making}

b471a094-c35b-4cd5-8df7-0dc3562bede1.summary: Supplementing autonomy with a knowledge condition
b471a094-c35b-4cd5-8df7-0dc3562bede1.content: {Autonomy can be supplemented with a condition that requires a basic level of knowledge for true liberty}, {This supplementary assumption ensures that individuals are not acting under significant ignorance}, {With this assumption, liberty as acting according to one's own will is preserved while addressing the concern about ignorance}

6a85e9ff-3c12-4ad5-a5a9-962142ed94f3.content: {Freedom is the absence of interference with one's actions}, {Interference involves the actual prevention of someone's choices}, {Liberty is present when no one actually interferes with one's actions}

7d26d2b5-6481-472b-8309-6db7d168dbc7.content: {Freedom is the ability to determine one's own actions}, {Self-determination involves making choices based on one's own values and reasons}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act according to their own will without external constraints}

a3139377-e749-49d6-9b84-6892edd950e9.content: {Freedom is the capacity for autonomous decision-making}, {Autonomy involves acting according to one's own principles and reasoning}, {Liberty is present when individuals can govern themselves without external imposition}

a2151997-de45-4b57-bf12-89677290caa9.content: {Freedom is the absence of subjugation by others}, {Subjugation involves being under the control or authority of another}, {Liberty is present when individuals are not subject to the will of others}

bc8cf0c4-75e5-49b6-bdc9-84be5ad5b1b4.content: {Freedom is the ability to control one's actions through rational deliberation}, {Rational control involves making decisions based on reason and reflection}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act according to rational deliberation without external coercion}

0b3745e5-36bc-46cd-aae5-bd64febfe923.content: {Freedom is the mutual recognition of individuals as equals}, {Mutual recognition involves acknowledging others as having equal moral status}, {Liberty is present when individuals respect each other's autonomy and rights}

10d69f50-05f0-4fb5-8a49-0726a6b80cf9.content: {Freedom is the ability to participate in democratic decision-making}, {Participatory democracy involves collective decision-making processes}, {Liberty is present when individuals have a say in the rules and policies that govern them}

b5d07d4a-bd96-47b9-8db7-5627d874dc73.content: {Freedom is the absence of coercion in one's actions}, {Coercion involves forcing someone to act against their will}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act without being forced by others}

cdaba31e-54d3-4570-aaa2-aa400cb6cba9.content: {Freedom is the capability to achieve valuable outcomes}, {Capability involves having the means and opportunities to pursue one's goals}, {Liberty is present when individuals have the resources and opportunities to fulfill their potential}

1813273c-9d82-4451-a1de-75da636502d9.content: {Freedom is the empowerment to pursue one's goals}, {Empowerment involves having the skills and resources to act effectively}, {Liberty is present when individuals are equipped to pursue their aspirations without undue hindrance}

b00f9278-dd8f-4914-a109-9a33596a8cdb.summary: Distinguishing between arbitrary and non-arbitrary interference
b00f9278-dd8f-4914-a109-9a33596a8cdb.content: {There is a distinction between arbitrary and non-arbitrary interference}, {Freedom as non-domination concerns arbitrary interference, not all forms of interference}, {Authority structures can exist without being arbitrary if they are subject to checks and balances}, {Non-arbitrary interference does not constitute domination and thus does not undermine freedom}

40d36626-3aa9-42d7-a61d-75e1c17eed21.summary: Rejecting the necessity of arbitrary interference in authority structures
40d36626-3aa9-42d7-a61d-75e1c17eed21.content: {It is false that necessary authority structures inherently involve arbitrary interference}, {Authority can be structured in a way that limits arbitrary power through democratic processes and accountability}, {The presence of authority does not necessarily entail domination if it is constrained and justified}

8954afc5-5a32-4530-8ce1-865865c18870.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of procedural fairness
8954afc5-5a32-4530-8ce1-865865c18870.content: {Procedural fairness can ensure that authority structures do not result in domination}, {Freedom as non-domination can coexist with authority if decisions are made through fair and transparent procedures}, {The objection loses its force if authority is exercised in a way that respects procedural fairness}

27ca8feb-7638-4b33-bf7b-ffadf6b3d4d1.summary: Freedom as Non-Interference with Justified Constraints
27ca8feb-7638-4b33-bf7b-ffadf6b3d4d1.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination by others}, {Domination involves the capacity to interfere with someone's choices without justification}, {Liberty is present when no one has the power to interfere with one's actions without justification}

ce35e4c5-b045-4207-bc50-2b0d5d682d3e.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination by others}, {Domination involves the capacity to interfere with someone's choices arbitrarily}, {Liberty is present when no one has the power to interfere with one's actions arbitrarily}

ffd78d0d-9e31-4408-a6b2-3c23eb488dca.summary: Freedom as Non-Domination with Legitimate Authority
ffd78d0d-9e31-4408-a6b2-3c23eb488dca.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination by others}, {Domination involves the capacity to interfere with someone's choices without legitimate authority}, {Liberty is present when no one has the power to interfere with one's actions without legitimate authority}

a5c8cba2-e4f2-498c-9c14-3c8d1c84ec23.summary: Freedom as Non-Domination with Public Justification
a5c8cba2-e4f2-498c-9c14-3c8d1c84ec23.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination by others}, {Domination involves the capacity to interfere with someone's choices without public justification}, {Liberty is present when no one has the power to interfere with one's actions without public justification}

b156f2ec-663f-427f-ac65-ff43ccfa33d2.summary: Freedom as Non-Domination with Democratic Oversight
b156f2ec-663f-427f-ac65-ff43ccfa33d2.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination by others}, {Domination involves the capacity to interfere with someone's choices without democratic oversight}, {Liberty is present when no one has the power to interfere with one's actions without democratic oversight}

4ee36447-0dec-462c-bff6-e004057585bf.summary: Distinguishing between arbitrary and justified interference
4ee36447-0dec-462c-bff6-e004057585bf.content: {There is a distinction between arbitrary interference and justified interference}, {Freedom as non-domination is concerned with arbitrary interference, not justified interference}, {Interference by a government to protect citizens is not arbitrary if it is justified and necessary}, {The presence of justified interference does not undermine the concept of freedom as non-domination}

7e575ad9-548e-498b-9417-79a441ce9ef2.summary: Rejecting the intuition that all interference is domination
7e575ad9-548e-498b-9417-79a441ce9ef2.content: {It is mistaken to assume that all interference constitutes domination}, {Domination specifically involves the capacity for arbitrary interference, not all forms of interference}, {Government actions that are justified and necessary do not qualify as domination}, {The intuition that justified interference is domination is incorrect}

e8690278-0c2f-479a-894f-bddf20802680.summary: Supplementing with a principle of legitimate authority
e8690278-0c2f-479a-894f-bddf20802680.content: {A supplementary principle of legitimate authority can be introduced}, {Legitimate authority involves interference that is justified and necessary for the common good}, {Freedom as non-domination allows for interference by legitimate authorities without constituting domination}, {The objection loses its force when considering the role of legitimate authority}

197e781f-3557-4e36-94e7-10ba8d1b7866.content: {Freedom is the absence of actual interference by others}, {Interference involves the actual prevention of someone's choices}, {Liberty is present when no one actually interferes with one's actions}

a25e1e79-6b2b-47e2-8de4-838251c71bb1.content: {Freedom is the absence of subjugation by others}, {Subjugation involves being under the control or authority of another}, {Liberty is present when one is not under the control or authority of another}

7d2356c9-5407-4588-80c6-2bb46890e0fa.content: {Freedom is the presence of the capacity to make autonomous choices}, {Empowerment involves having the resources and abilities to make choices}, {Liberty is present when one has the resources and abilities to make autonomous choices}

2b6e16e7-3559-4b2a-8133-5840c0d6784d.content: {Freedom is the mutual recognition of individuals as autonomous agents}, {Recognition involves acknowledging others as capable of making their own choices}, {Liberty is present when individuals recognize each other as autonomous agents}

1c7e6d85-07f1-4a7b-88de-d04556f57166.content: {Freedom is the absence of dependence on the arbitrary will of others}, {Dependence involves relying on others who can arbitrarily change one's circumstances}, {Liberty is present when one is not reliant on others who can arbitrarily change one's circumstances}

72168703-4638-490e-8042-f4f3b71a2cd0.summary: Distinguishing between actual and potential interference
72168703-4638-490e-8042-f4f3b71a2cd0.content: {There is a distinction between actual interference and potential interference.}, {Freedom as non-domination is concerned with the absence of actual domination rather than potential domination.}, {An individual's unawareness of potential interference does not negate their freedom if no actual interference occurs.}, {The intuition that someone is free despite potential interference can be explained by focusing on the absence of actual interference.}

060b5761-e4d6-449a-84e5-c92745b9ddc7.summary: Rejecting the intuition that unawareness implies freedom
060b5761-e4d6-449a-84e5-c92745b9ddc7.content: {It is mistaken to believe that unawareness of potential interference implies freedom.}, {Freedom as non-domination requires the absence of arbitrary power, not just the absence of awareness of such power.}, {An individual is not truly free if there exists a capacity for arbitrary interference, regardless of their awareness.}

5910027c-a4c5-4345-b17a-2018eaa5222d.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of structural constraints
5910027c-a4c5-4345-b17a-2018eaa5222d.content: {Freedom as non-domination can be supplemented with the assumption that structural constraints prevent arbitrary interference.}, {Even if an individual is unaware of potential interference, structural constraints ensure that such interference cannot occur.}, {The presence of these constraints maintains the individual's freedom by preventing the exercise of arbitrary power.}

a4dcf145-ee6f-4057-ae87-14e9b2f1b265.content: {Freedom is the absence of actual interference by others}, {Interference involves the actual prevention of someone's choices}, {Liberty is present when no one actually interferes with one's actions}

31e21d5b-636c-4377-9ee1-17d8e4c3f1b5.content: {Freedom is the absence of subjugation by others}, {Subjugation involves being under the control or authority of another}, {Liberty is present when one is not under the control or authority of another}

bb4d7e1d-1ddd-4f7b-a949-0d72b080c76f.content: {Freedom is the absence of constraints on one's actions}, {Constraints involve limitations imposed on one's ability to act}, {Liberty is present when there are no limitations on one's ability to act}

226d1f34-956f-47aa-9309-3cf51bb9cbf0.content: {Freedom is the absence of dependence on others}, {Dependence involves relying on others for the ability to act}, {Liberty is present when one does not rely on others for the ability to act}

abaac443-a4d3-492b-99d7-c0f4d7776427.content: {Freedom is the absence of coercion by others}, {Coercion involves forcing someone to act against their will}, {Liberty is present when no one forces another to act against their will}

a5a1908a-0a79-45d0-a829-9cc9090691ef.summary: Distinguishing between potential and actual interference
a5a1908a-0a79-45d0-a829-9cc9090691ef.content: {There is a distinction between potential interference and actual interference.}, {Freedom as non-domination is concerned with the absence of actual interference rather than potential interference.}, {The potential for interference does not constitute domination if it is never realized.}, {A person is free as long as no one exercises the power to interfere with their actions.}

43b65f32-299a-4bdf-ac1d-33f40ab89af5.summary: Rejecting the claim that potential interference undermines freedom
43b65f32-299a-4bdf-ac1d-33f40ab89af5.content: {It is false that the mere potential for interference undermines freedom.}, {Freedom is compromised only when there is actual interference or the exercise of power.}, {The potential for interference without its realization does not affect one's liberty.}

9b75eb2c-0d8a-4cb1-968e-ee5ed473f1b7.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of non-arbitrary power
9b75eb2c-0d8a-4cb1-968e-ee5ed473f1b7.content: {Non-domination involves the absence of arbitrary power, not just any power.}, {The potential for interference does not undermine freedom if the power is not arbitrary.}, {Liberty is maintained when power is constrained by laws or norms that prevent arbitrary interference.}

a29d22ee-ce18-46f9-b0cc-48dc63535a32.content: {Freedom is the absence of interference by others}, {Interference involves the actual prevention of someone's choices}, {Liberty is present when no one actually interferes with one's actions}

86e4efbf-dbe9-42b6-86ab-253ea7957833.content: {Freedom is the presence of capabilities to achieve one's goals}, {Capabilities involve having the real opportunity to pursue and achieve valued outcomes}, {Liberty is present when individuals have the genuine ability to pursue their chosen paths}

4c1bed84-a013-40c0-b0b7-8c61b4be34b5.content: {Freedom is the capacity for self-determination}, {Self-determination involves making choices based on one's own values and reasoning}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make decisions independently of external pressures}

24865d4c-3f5a-4d3b-904e-578947d8a7f0.content: {Freedom is the ability to act in accordance with one's true self}, {Acting in accordance with one's true self involves aligning actions with one's authentic desires and values}, {Liberty is present when individuals can fulfill their potential and live authentically}

5d3b646c-0d2f-4971-b158-99ace09a9c57.content: {Freedom is the availability of a range of options to choose from}, {Having options involves access to diverse and meaningful choices}, {Liberty is present when individuals have a wide array of opportunities to pursue}

56ea06a5-500e-4d88-b69d-6b62ae036a70.content: {Freedom is the empowerment to shape one's life}, {Empowerment involves having control over one's circumstances and environment}, {Liberty is present when individuals have the power to influence their own life conditions}

5bf8751c-ef9c-483d-a418-e2a17a411872.content: {Freedom is the absence of constraints on action}, {Constraints involve limitations imposed by external factors}, {Liberty is present when individuals face no significant barriers to their actions}

cc2b1aa5-47bb-4ebb-bae2-4cf4563f1c07.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's potential}, {Self-realization involves achieving personal growth and fulfillment}, {Liberty is present when individuals can develop and express their unique capabilities}

30f42cab-9d03-488d-ab6c-d2ca2812f682.content: {Freedom is the absence of coercion by others}, {Coercion involves being forced to act against one's will}, {Liberty is present when individuals are not compelled to act by external forces}

1b98c99c-bcf2-4f24-b7e7-6186008156dc.content: {Freedom is the absence of subjugation to others}, {Subjugation involves being under the control or authority of another}, {Liberty is present when individuals are not subject to the will of others}

b7546dd5-2d86-4baf-82cd-ebc29031526c.summary: Distinguishing between domination and other constraints
b7546dd5-2d86-4baf-82cd-ebc29031526c.content: {There is a distinction between domination and other forms of constraints such as social and economic limitations}, {Freedom as non-domination specifically addresses the absence of arbitrary interference by others, not all forms of constraints}, {Social and economic constraints do not constitute domination if they do not involve arbitrary interference by others}, {The intuition that someone is not free due to social and economic constraints can be explained by conflating these with domination}

ea5f6168-e2a5-40b2-80c9-1c048a65c5e9.summary: Rejecting the intuition that non-domination is insufficient for liberty
ea5f6168-e2a5-40b2-80c9-1c048a65c5e9.content: {It is mistaken to think that non-domination is insufficient for liberty}, {True liberty is defined by the absence of arbitrary interference, not by the absence of all constraints}, {The feeling of not being free due to social and economic constraints does not undermine the presence of liberty as non-domination}

ac8a590d-38e7-4492-be90-81d31f328b42.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of non-arbitrary social structures
ac8a590d-38e7-4492-be90-81d31f328b42.content: {Assume that social and economic structures can be non-arbitrary and still impose constraints}, {Non-arbitrary constraints do not equate to domination if they are justified and not subject to arbitrary interference}, {The presence of non-arbitrary social and economic constraints does not negate the presence of liberty as non-domination}

2c9ba726-cc54-4f51-9851-dc1a1cde6d3f.content: {Freedom is the absence of actual interference by others}, {Domination involves actual interference with someone's choices}, {Liberty is present when no one actually interferes with one's actions}

7486b776-f130-436b-ab15-9a8c53195515.content: {Freedom is the absence of subjugation by others}, {Subjugation involves the capacity to impose one's will over another}, {Liberty is present when no one has the power to impose their will on one's actions}

4c19ed3c-e578-4456-bf0c-e653dd3130a3.content: {Freedom is the absence of constraints on one's choices}, {Constraints involve limitations imposed by others on one's ability to choose}, {Liberty is present when no one imposes limitations on one's choices}

a390156b-017d-40fd-9e83-0c9136fc790a.content: {Freedom is the absence of intimidation by others}, {Intimidation involves the capacity to create fear of interference}, {Liberty is present when no one creates fear of interference with one's actions}

c0020a36-8016-4ae9-b0b8-bfa714b215e1.content: {Freedom is the absence of dependence on others}, {Dependence involves reliance on others who have the capacity to interfere}, {Liberty is present when one is not reliant on others who can interfere with one's actions}

a4c952f0-87e5-4555-ab26-6ca5fb43f488.summary: Distinguishing between potential and actual interference
a4c952f0-87e5-4555-ab26-6ca5fb43f488.content: {There is a distinction between potential interference and actual interference}, {Freedom as non-domination is concerned with the absence of the capacity for arbitrary interference, not the actual exercise of interference}, {The presence of a capacity to interfere does not constitute domination if it is never exercised}, {The intuition that domination exists without interference can be explained by confusing potential interference with actual interference}

7a3da592-4c52-4325-85f1-66d8828aa53a.summary: Rejecting the intuition that capacity alone constitutes domination
7a3da592-4c52-4325-85f1-66d8828aa53a.content: {It is false that the mere capacity to interfere constitutes domination}, {Domination requires the exercise or threat of arbitrary interference, not just the capacity}, {The intuition that domination exists without interference is mistaken because it overlooks the necessity of actual or threatened interference for domination}

10f3529d-ac5a-45e2-80ed-49c8f8d6ae50.summary: Explaining the intuition through psychological impact
10f3529d-ac5a-45e2-80ed-49c8f8d6ae50.content: {The awareness of a capacity to interfere can have a psychological impact on behavior}, {This psychological impact does not equate to actual domination unless it involves the exercise or threat of interference}, {The intuition of domination without interference is explained by the psychological impact, not by the presence of actual domination}

6d0e83e8-1dae-4a38-b6d5-1a0f3e211019.content: {Freedom is the absence of interference by others}, {Interference involves actual actions that prevent someone from making choices}, {Liberty is present when no one actually interferes with one's actions}

ccaa1db1-ab48-453d-ae0b-546bfb1b1a4f.content: {Freedom is the ability to realize one's true self}, {Realizing one's true self involves pursuing one's authentic goals and values}, {Liberty is present when one can pursue personal development without external constraints}

0b41fe95-29f2-441e-805b-024624d599ea.content: {Freedom is the capacity for self-governance}, {Self-governance involves making decisions based on one's own reasoning and values}, {Liberty is present when one can act according to one's own principles without coercion}

b057615f-7ec3-44ec-9678-74338591e898.content: {Freedom is the ability to act according to rational deliberation}, {Rational deliberation involves making choices based on reason and evidence}, {Liberty is present when one's actions are guided by rational decision-making}

20d4a058-826b-4005-bf0f-ee3dc7b94d2d.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act according to moral principles}, {Moral principles involve ethical guidelines that one chooses to follow}, {Liberty is present when one can act in accordance with one's moral beliefs without external pressure}

4173f968-5933-4b35-a06a-2e552c568b24.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve one's potential}, {Achieving one's potential involves having the resources and opportunities to pursue one's goals}, {Liberty is present when one has the means to pursue personal and professional growth}

952ed6e5-6c65-4bbd-953b-71ccd96e8369.content: {Freedom is the absence of subjugation by others}, {Subjugation involves being under the control or authority of another}, {Liberty is present when one is not subject to the will of another}

d630e0df-69f5-4b4f-ad7b-115d26c5e68c.content: {Freedom is having a range of options to choose from}, {Having options involves the availability of different paths and choices}, {Liberty is present when one has access to diverse opportunities and can select among them}

c625b66e-eafc-494e-be33-1338315e574d.content: {Freedom is the capacity to achieve valuable outcomes}, {Valuable outcomes involve goals and achievements that one considers important}, {Liberty is present when one has the capability to pursue and attain desired ends}

c60baa12-571e-4323-b3e6-d6eab3f57c12.content: {Freedom is acting with informed consent}, {Informed consent involves understanding and agreeing to the conditions of one's actions}, {Liberty is present when one consents to the terms of engagement in relationships and activities}

ae3ead9c-c415-4f07-941c-75b4126656f2.summary: Distinguishing between domination and legitimate authority
ae3ead9c-c415-4f07-941c-75b4126656f2.content: {There is a distinction between domination and legitimate authority}, {Domination involves arbitrary interference, while legitimate authority operates within agreed-upon rules and norms}, {Hierarchical relationships can exist without domination if they are based on mutual consent and accountability}, {Freedom as non-domination is concerned with preventing arbitrary interference, not with eliminating all forms of influence or control}

2a7fcbe8-c363-4144-b255-3c5a349942ea.summary: Rejecting the claim that all hierarchical relationships limit freedom
2a7fcbe8-c363-4144-b255-3c5a349942ea.content: {It is false that all hierarchical relationships inherently limit freedom}, {Hierarchical relationships can enhance freedom by providing structure and stability}, {The presence of hierarchy does not necessarily entail domination if the power is exercised non-arbitrarily}, {Freedom as non-domination allows for hierarchical relationships that are justified and constrained by norms}

41b22c2d-f67f-4872-9a58-899318a06997.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of procedural fairness
41b22c2d-f67f-4872-9a58-899318a06997.content: {Procedural fairness ensures that power in hierarchical relationships is exercised non-arbitrarily}, {Freedom as non-domination can be maintained if hierarchical power is subject to fair procedures and checks}, {The objection loses its force if hierarchical relationships are governed by transparent and accountable processes}, {Procedural fairness aligns with the absence of domination by preventing arbitrary interference}

78c174ed-e394-4be7-a94a-91e2c5cf54dc.summary: Freedom as Non-Interference with Internal and External Constraints
78c174ed-e394-4be7-a94a-91e2c5cf54dc.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination by others}, {Domination involves the capacity to arbitrarily interfere with someone's choices}, {Liberty is present when no one has the power to interfere with one's actions at will}, {Freedom requires the absence of significant internal constraints such as addiction or mental illness}

2e831165-aebc-457a-a4d0-3dd2e3105f35.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination by others}, {Domination involves the capacity to arbitrarily interfere with someone's choices}, {Liberty is present when no one has the power to interfere with one's actions at will}, {Freedom requires the capacity for autonomous decision-making, free from internal constraints}

a7fbfd9a-c47c-42e7-984f-14c3a9494d5a.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination by others}, {Domination involves the capacity to arbitrarily interfere with someone's choices}, {Liberty is present when no one has the power to interfere with one's actions at will}, {Freedom includes the absence of both external and internal interferences that affect decision-making}

dcf2fb49-78f1-4837-ad84-1d835818fc3c.summary: Freedom as Non-Domination and Psychological Independence
dcf2fb49-78f1-4837-ad84-1d835818fc3c.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination by others}, {Domination involves the capacity to arbitrarily interfere with someone's choices}, {Liberty is present when no one has the power to interfere with one's actions at will}, {Freedom requires psychological independence from internal constraints}

ac000cc0-44fc-4828-8cb5-793dd3989e17.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination by others}, {Domination involves the capacity to arbitrarily interfere with someone's choices}, {Liberty is present when no one has the power to interfere with one's actions at will}, {Freedom requires self-mastery over internal constraints such as addiction}

6897aa02-cb85-4fe5-9baa-5d62d6832061.summary: Distinguishing between external and internal constraints
6897aa02-cb85-4fe5-9baa-5d62d6832061.content: {There is a distinction between external constraints, such as domination by others, and internal constraints, such as addiction or mental illness}, {Freedom as non-domination is a theory specifically about external constraints rather than internal ones}, {The presence of internal constraints does not negate the absence of external domination}, {The concept of non-domination does not claim to address all forms of unfreedom, only those related to external interference}

1ed94af3-92ca-4f64-bd12-cf186d4e3a05.summary: Rejecting the necessity of addressing internal constraints
1ed94af3-92ca-4f64-bd12-cf186d4e3a05.content: {It is not necessary for a theory of freedom as non-domination to address internal constraints}, {The focus of non-domination is on preventing arbitrary interference by others, which is a distinct issue from internal constraints}, {Internal constraints are a separate matter that may require different solutions, unrelated to the concept of non-domination}

401f033f-1346-4a2a-8024-47b4cd6acb83.summary: Supplementing with a broader understanding of freedom
401f033f-1346-4a2a-8024-47b4cd6acb83.content: {A supplementary assumption is that freedom can be understood in multiple dimensions, including both non-domination and internal autonomy}, {Freedom as non-domination addresses the social and political dimension of freedom}, {Internal constraints can be addressed by a complementary theory of personal autonomy}, {Together, these dimensions provide a more comprehensive understanding of freedom}

47ed707e-c294-4efc-9237-c81f24797b9c.content: {Freedom is the absence of interference by others}, {Interference involves actions that prevent someone from making their own choices}, {Liberty is present when no one actually interferes with one's actions}

5d6a5488-5808-40d0-9ec5-aae5f355c7d9.content: {Freedom is the ability to govern oneself according to one's own values}, {Self-mastery involves aligning one's actions with one's rational desires}, {Liberty is present when one acts in accordance with one's true self}

a1ce5749-d11d-49d9-a698-fa00fc89e87d.content: {It is mistaken to think that voluntary submission inherently undermines freedom.}, {Voluntary submission can enhance autonomy if it is based on informed and uncoerced choice.}, {The presence of freedom is determined by the absence of arbitrary interference, not by the presence of submission.}

ec7aeb69-6988-4ca0-99b3-cf196d97fedc.content: {There is a distinction between internal freedom and external freedom}, {Freedom as self-realization is a theory about internal freedom rather than external freedom}, {Self-realization can occur under external constraints without negating internal freedom}, {The intuition that someone is not free in prison can be explained as confusion between internal and external freedom}

180468ee-fa2e-41f5-b0c2-a1f9de29400a.content: {There is a distinction between positive self-realization and negative self-realization}, {Freedom as self-realization is concerned with positive self-realization, which aligns with moral and ethical development}, {A person who realizes their potential as a manipulator is engaging in negative self-realization, which does not constitute true freedom}, {The intuition that harmful self-realization constitutes freedom is a misunderstanding of the concept of positive self-realization}

2b595c76-2219-46cf-ad0b-306cc7fbde2d.content: {Implicit self-realization involves fulfilling one's potential without explicit self-awareness}, {A person can achieve self-realization implicitly by engaging in activities that naturally align with their capabilities}, {The objection loses its force when considering that self-realization can be implicit and does not require conscious self-awareness}

1ef3991e-443c-477c-b194-8ce94b709518.content: {Freedom is the capacity to make one's own choices}, {Autonomy involves self-governance and independence from external control}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can make decisions free from coercion}

d7691c1f-f617-4270-8978-03246aa7ddf0.content: {Freedom is the development of one's moral character}, {Moral development involves cultivating virtues and ethical understanding}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can pursue moral growth and virtuous living}

e73a1b31-0dfd-4907-be79-6ac3d0ad89d5.content: {Freedom is the ability to govern oneself through reason}, {Rational self-governance involves making decisions based on rational deliberation}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act according to reasoned judgment}

e7192c22-b3ca-47bf-8493-607ec09c74e1.content: {Freedom is the achievement of human flourishing}, {Flourishing involves living a life of well-being and fulfillment}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can pursue a life that promotes their well-being}

90f69fa4-9041-467f-a294-f3384513b0e0.content: {Freedom is the process of personal growth and development}, {Personal growth involves expanding one's abilities and understanding}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can engage in activities that promote their personal development}

88a51fc1-5d29-4d06-aa84-39d3dfe00ea4.content: {Freedom is the power to determine one's own path}, {Self-determination involves making choices that shape one's life}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can pursue their own goals without external interference}

fc78d259-a799-4471-b590-fbfd91d55eab.content: {Freedom is the ability to express oneself creatively}, {Creative expression involves using one's talents and imagination}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can engage in creative activities that reflect their individuality}

1fb8f6c7-a4a5-4ef2-aa8a-7a257663bb01.content: {Freedom is the attainment of inner harmony}, {Inner harmony involves aligning one's desires and actions with one's values}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can live in accordance with their inner sense of peace}

c39a70b7-14e9-4975-b00b-2af5cf82d31b.content: {Freedom is the maintenance of self-respect}, {Self-respect involves valuing oneself and one's dignity}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act in ways that uphold their self-worth}

cb986f51-e52c-46b2-8d6b-6ee97373c541.summary: Distinguishing between beneficial and harmful self-realization
cb986f51-e52c-46b2-8d6b-6ee97373c541.content: {There is a distinction between beneficial and harmful self-realization}, {Freedom as self-realization is concerned with beneficial self-realization that aligns with moral and social values}, {Realizing a true self that thrives in conflict is not considered beneficial self-realization}, {The objection confuses self-realization with mere self-discovery, which may not always be beneficial}

d560aa7c-8a5e-456b-8ad8-d33e78941a8a.summary: Rejecting the intuition that all self-realization is beneficial
d560aa7c-8a5e-456b-8ad8-d33e78941a8a.content: {It is false that all forms of self-realization are beneficial}, {Freedom as self-realization does not imply that every aspect of one's true self should be realized}, {The concept of freedom involves a normative dimension that excludes harmful self-realization}, {The intuition that harmful self-realization is part of freedom is mistaken}

a21fb424-12c6-4319-9d9f-e875d174b76e.content: {Freedom as self-realization requires a supplementary moral framework to guide which aspects of the self should be realized}, {A moral framework can distinguish between self-realization that is beneficial and that which is harmful}, {With a moral framework, the realization of a true self that thrives in conflict is not considered part of freedom}, {The objection loses its force when self-realization is guided by moral considerations}

aecf047b-12b7-4ec5-8aa8-38ecaf89d2d7.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's true self}, {Self-realization involves fulfilling one's potential and capabilities}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals autonomously pursue their own development and goals}

71913c8b-b46b-443a-a63b-4dbc241631ea.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's true self}, {Self-realization involves fulfilling one's potential and capabilities}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals reflectively endorse their own development and goals}

94ef60e8-5c8c-42b4-92a0-46c54dcb6639.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's true self}, {Self-realization involves fulfilling one's potential and capabilities}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals make informed decisions about their own development and goals}

13cbc4d8-39fb-4d6b-8ece-3168021fd4c0.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's true self}, {Self-realization involves fulfilling one's potential and capabilities}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals experience personal growth through their own choices}

0c7e417c-0112-4b55-9036-5e9aef43cf6d.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's true self}, {Self-realization involves fulfilling one's potential and capabilities}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals flourish through self-directed actions}

4d3a3591-5f09-4096-8f8c-38d09c7d4e59.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's true self}, {Self-realization involves fulfilling one's potential and capabilities}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals volitionally pursue their own development and goals}

164b17e1-aa43-410c-b460-aa2921a68b32.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's true self}, {Self-realization involves fulfilling one's potential and capabilities}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals autonomously express their own development and goals}

6f428e63-518d-4062-bec0-7da223ca51dd.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's true self}, {Self-realization involves fulfilling one's potential and capabilities}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals actualize their potential through self-guidance}

c4faf9ad-f8ec-4a60-bd23-7c069bcfb1c2.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's true self}, {Self-realization involves fulfilling one's potential and capabilities}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals independently develop their own goals}

9717e95b-f864-4747-bee9-1ff4a8c4a745.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's true self}, {Self-realization involves fulfilling one's potential and capabilities}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals determine their own potential and goals}

21b5b570-9364-45a2-8bb3-dbf024c7e96a.summary: Distinguishing between internal and external guidance
21b5b570-9364-45a2-8bb3-dbf024c7e96a.content: {There is a distinction between internal motivation and external guidance in the process of self-realization}, {Freedom as self-realization focuses on the internal motivation of the individual rather than the source of guidance}, {External guidance does not negate self-realization if the individual internally endorses the path}, {The intuition that externally guided self-realization is not genuine can be explained by confusion between internal motivation and external guidance}

22cab26a-c27a-451d-87c3-20a48486c896.summary: Rejecting the necessity of autonomy in self-realization
22cab26a-c27a-451d-87c3-20a48486c896.content: {It is false that self-realization must be entirely autonomous to be genuine}, {External influences can contribute to self-realization without undermining its authenticity}, {The appearance of contradiction in externally guided self-realization can be explained by misunderstanding the role of external influences}

ee0b90bb-10c5-40f3-9f4e-0ff1f232e15e.content: {Autonomy in self-realization can be understood as the internal endorsement of one's path}, {An individual can achieve self-realization even if the path is externally suggested, provided they internally endorse it}, {The appearance of lack of autonomy in externally guided self-realization is explained by the absence of internal endorsement}

55621758-fdf4-4f17-894a-93ec2ab9904e.content: {Freedom is the expression of one's authentic self}, {Authenticity involves aligning one's actions with one's true values and beliefs}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can live in accordance with their authentic selves}

0627b60d-fe65-4259-9a1d-5b0a0676dce2.content: {Freedom is the capacity to make one's own choices}, {Autonomy involves making decisions based on one's own reasoning and values}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act according to their own will without external coercion}

e6ec43be-b1ec-4acd-ad50-2a8e0654472d.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable outcomes}, {Capability involves having the means and opportunities to pursue one's goals}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals have the resources and opportunities to fulfill their potential}

414bdd07-74ef-4695-aaa0-98cf5b0ef93a.content: {Freedom is the state of living a flourishing life}, {Flourishing involves achieving well-being and personal growth}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can pursue a life of well-being and fulfillment}

3cb8ff78-74bd-429b-a9e9-19f672356ab2.content: {Freedom is the power to determine one's own path}, {Self-determination involves having control over one's life choices}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can make decisions about their own lives without undue influence}

30d51111-8551-4c01-bec6-862d7ac41c8f.content: {Freedom is the process of personal growth and development}, {Personal growth involves expanding one's abilities and understanding}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can engage in continuous self-improvement}

d01d80af-7b7f-40c6-a966-4df0e00667b3.content: {Freedom is the state of inner harmony and peace}, {Inner harmony involves aligning one's desires and actions with one's values}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can live in a state of internal peace and coherence}

23f21ae0-d07b-4f84-bb9f-13ca73e8b941.content: {Freedom is the ability to express one's true self}, {Self-expression involves communicating one's thoughts, feelings, and identity}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can freely express their identity and beliefs}

a8a82c8f-199b-4762-80ba-7b99e2703c06.content: {Freedom is the mastery over one's own desires and impulses}, {Self-mastery involves controlling one's actions and emotions}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can govern themselves without being ruled by external forces}

82ce197c-e11e-4700-af35-393dcce8fe15.content: {Freedom is the ownership of one's own life and body}, {Self-ownership involves having rights over one's own actions and decisions}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals have full control over their own lives and bodies}

7141d603-33d0-49b4-86ce-4d7777030b88.summary: Distinguishing between self-realization and subjective fulfillment
7141d603-33d0-49b4-86ce-4d7777030b88.content: {There is a distinction between self-realization and subjective feelings of fulfillment}, {Freedom as self-realization is concerned with the objective realization of one's potential, not subjective feelings of satisfaction}, {A person can achieve self-realization without necessarily feeling fulfilled or satisfied}, {The intuition that development should guarantee fulfillment is based on a conflation of objective and subjective aspects of freedom}

5c655fa1-b06b-4886-8984-9f371e4aeedc.summary: Rejecting the intuition that fulfillment must accompany self-realization
5c655fa1-b06b-4886-8984-9f371e4aeedc.content: {It is mistaken to assume that self-realization must lead to subjective fulfillment}, {The pursuit of development can be valuable even if it does not result in feelings of satisfaction}, {The value of self-realization lies in the objective achievement of one's potential, not in subjective emotional states}

d3bc3d71-f616-4a84-8c40-53f5828e206f.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of external factors affecting fulfillment
d3bc3d71-f616-4a84-8c40-53f5828e206f.content: {External factors such as social environment and personal relationships can influence feelings of fulfillment}, {The pursuit of self-realization may not guarantee fulfillment if external conditions are unfavorable}, {Freedom as self-realization can accommodate the lack of fulfillment by recognizing the role of external influences}

4263a4a6-9d3b-413a-9888-f8701e2e05b6.content: {Freedom is having the opportunity to achieve one's goals}, {Opportunities are the available options and resources to pursue one's aims}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have a wide range of opportunities to choose from}, {Freedom requires the capacity to make autonomous choices}, {Autonomous choices are decisions made without external control}

62634a1b-a4e4-440c-acfb-ad4cc8b38f0d.summary: Freedom as Opportunity and Absence of Coercion
62634a1b-a4e4-440c-acfb-ad4cc8b38f0d.content: {Freedom is having the opportunity to achieve one's goals}, {Opportunities are the available options and resources to pursue one's aims}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have a wide range of opportunities to choose from}, {Freedom requires the absence of coercion}, {Coercion is the use of force or intimidation to influence someone's decisions}

23bd057f-4eb5-48b1-abe7-7ec143a034fb.summary: Freedom as Opportunity and Internal Control
23bd057f-4eb5-48b1-abe7-7ec143a034fb.content: {Freedom is having the opportunity to achieve one's goals}, {Opportunities are the available options and resources to pursue one's aims}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have a wide range of opportunities to choose from}, {Freedom requires internal control over one's decisions}, {Internal control is the ability to govern one's own actions and choices}

b974a69d-b9c2-4788-81ba-f432213ebf33.summary: Freedom as Opportunity and Rational Deliberation
b974a69d-b9c2-4788-81ba-f432213ebf33.content: {Freedom is having the opportunity to achieve one's goals}, {Opportunities are the available options and resources to pursue one's aims}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have a wide range of opportunities to choose from}, {Freedom requires the capacity for rational deliberation}, {Rational deliberation is the process of carefully considering options before making a decision}

e6ab2f6d-430b-4611-ab9a-5613b590eb76.content: {Freedom is having the opportunity to achieve one's goals}, {Opportunities are the available options and resources to pursue one's aims}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have a wide range of opportunities to choose from}, {Freedom requires self-determination}, {Self-determination is the ability to control one's own life and make independent choices}

cb5cac34-1ecb-4261-ae82-a1a7bf1349bf.content: {There is a distinction between having opportunities and having autonomy}, {Freedom as opportunity is a theory about the availability of options, not about the capacity to choose autonomously}, {A person under external control may lack autonomy but still have opportunities in the relevant sense}, {The intuition that someone under control is not free can be explained as a confusion between opportunities and autonomy}

0d8530c0-03ad-42f3-9f8e-42fc1ffdbe93.summary: Rejecting the necessity of autonomous choice for freedom
0d8530c0-03ad-42f3-9f8e-42fc1ffdbe93.content: {It is false that freedom necessarily requires the capacity for autonomous choice}, {Freedom can be understood as the presence of opportunities regardless of the ability to make autonomous decisions}, {The appearance that autonomy is required for freedom can be explained by the value we place on autonomy, not by its necessity for freedom}

43ed54e7-88a2-47e5-8e15-6d1487cfc83d.summary: Supplementing with a notion of effective freedom
43ed54e7-88a2-47e5-8e15-6d1487cfc83d.content: {Effective freedom involves both opportunities and the capacity to make autonomous choices}, {Freedom as opportunity can be supplemented with the notion of effective freedom to address the objection}, {With the addition of effective freedom, the objection loses its force as it accounts for both opportunities and autonomy}

956063f7-54a0-4cd1-883a-2255140c8e1c.content: {Freedom is having the opportunity to achieve one's goals}, {Opportunities are the available options and resources to pursue one's aims}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have a wide range of effective opportunities to choose from}, {An opportunity is effective if it leads to genuinely different outcomes}

f15e18ce-a2ef-4bab-9277-c105323f1511.content: {Freedom is having the opportunity to achieve one's goals}, {Opportunities are the available options and resources to pursue one's aims}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have a wide range of opportunities to choose from}, {Individuals must be aware of hidden constraints for opportunities to contribute to freedom}

1bbeae90-224b-44f9-b82a-c46ea72a4909.summary: Freedom as Opportunity with Genuine Choice
1bbeae90-224b-44f9-b82a-c46ea72a4909.content: {Freedom is having the opportunity to achieve one's goals}, {Opportunities are the available options and resources to pursue one's aims}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have a wide range of opportunities to choose from}, {Opportunities must allow for genuine choice among different outcomes}

412e71a4-23c1-4dc7-82cd-ad818fd990e6.summary: Freedom as Opportunity with Constraint Awareness
412e71a4-23c1-4dc7-82cd-ad818fd990e6.content: {Freedom is having the opportunity to achieve one's goals}, {Opportunities are the available options and resources to pursue one's aims}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have a wide range of opportunities to choose from}, {Freedom requires awareness of constraints that affect the outcomes of opportunities}

c2685556-f2fe-4407-b644-7ed899528d14.summary: Freedom as Opportunity with Outcome Diversity
c2685556-f2fe-4407-b644-7ed899528d14.content: {Freedom is having the opportunity to achieve one's goals}, {Opportunities are the available options and resources to pursue one's aims}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have a wide range of opportunities to choose from}, {Opportunities must lead to a diversity of outcomes to constitute freedom}

92fccaf9-1599-4d57-b6e2-88f6531faee5.summary: Freedom as Opportunity with Real Options
92fccaf9-1599-4d57-b6e2-88f6531faee5.content: {Freedom is having the opportunity to achieve one's goals}, {Opportunities are the available options and resources to pursue one's aims}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have a wide range of opportunities to choose from}, {Opportunities must be real and not illusory to contribute to freedom}

bd8a24e8-1d4a-4089-9868-554fcc4ee1ee.summary: Freedom as Opportunity with Unconstrained Outcomes
bd8a24e8-1d4a-4089-9868-554fcc4ee1ee.content: {Freedom is having the opportunity to achieve one's goals}, {Opportunities are the available options and resources to pursue one's aims}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have a wide range of opportunities to choose from}, {Opportunities must not be subject to hidden constraints that lead to the same outcome}

0ff318e1-0341-403f-90a9-3c81b232d28b.summary: Freedom as Opportunity with Informed Choice
0ff318e1-0341-403f-90a9-3c81b232d28b.content: {Freedom is having the opportunity to achieve one's goals}, {Opportunities are the available options and resources to pursue one's aims}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have a wide range of opportunities to choose from}, {Individuals must be informed about the potential outcomes of their opportunities}

5341343c-775b-4eed-beb0-4596d76756e6.summary: Distinguishing between apparent and genuine opportunities
5341343c-775b-4eed-beb0-4596d76756e6.content: {There is a distinction between apparent opportunities and genuine opportunities}, {Freedom as opportunity is concerned with genuine opportunities rather than merely apparent ones}, {An opportunity is genuine only if it leads to a variety of different possible outcomes}, {Hidden constraints that make all opportunities lead to the same outcome indicate a lack of genuine opportunities}, {The intuition that someone is not free despite having many opportunities can be explained by the presence of hidden constraints that negate genuine opportunities}

66e97f03-a197-484c-9fe0-7f2eeb1be2f3.summary: Rejecting the intuition that hidden constraints negate freedom
66e97f03-a197-484c-9fe0-7f2eeb1be2f3.content: {It is false that hidden constraints necessarily negate freedom}, {Freedom as opportunity focuses on the availability of options and resources, not on the outcomes of those options}, {The presence of hidden constraints does not diminish the range of opportunities available}, {The intuition that hidden constraints negate freedom is mistaken because it conflates freedom with the predictability of outcomes}

6e9ff30b-ebac-495e-a59f-cdc15f70b6f1.summary: Supplementing with a requirement for outcome diversity
6e9ff30b-ebac-495e-a59f-cdc15f70b6f1.content: {Freedom as opportunity can be supplemented with a requirement for outcome diversity}, {An opportunity is only meaningful if it can lead to diverse outcomes}, {Hidden constraints that make all opportunities lead to the same outcome violate the requirement for outcome diversity}, {With the requirement for outcome diversity, the objection loses its force because it ensures that opportunities are not misleading indicators of freedom}

bdbbe881-fdc7-44b6-b553-23c9064bd21c.content: {Freedom is having the ability to make choices based on one's own authentic desires}, {Authentic desires are those that are not manipulated by external forces}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals can pursue their goals based on authentic desires}

cf30e558-2b58-42df-8e79-225f67c37b64.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination by others}, {Domination occurs when one is subject to the arbitrary will of another}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals are not subject to arbitrary interference}

a1b92be6-399a-46ea-94a9-f710346e524c.content: {Freedom is the capacity to determine one's own life path}, {Self-determination requires that one's choices are not controlled by external manipulation}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals can pursue their life path without external control}

490058b5-19cf-4d0f-845e-3ab16a671f3a.content: {Freedom is the ability to act according to reason}, {Rational agency requires that one's decisions are not influenced by manipulation}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals can act based on rational deliberation}

d2c07aed-e60c-461b-8ada-9dea811b7467.content: {Freedom is the capacity to be morally responsible for one's actions}, {Moral responsibility requires that one's choices are not manipulated by external forces}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals can be held accountable for their actions}

b4346a28-a1c4-496a-8541-8c5e27ce056d.content: {Freedom is the ability to make choices that reflect one's true self}, {Authentic choice requires that one's preferences are not manipulated}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals can make choices that are true to themselves}

69fc8103-f1f2-4587-b4d0-7d76aaeed3c6.content: {Freedom is the absence of interference from others}, {Non-interference requires that one's choices are not manipulated by others}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals can act without interference}

79cb3cdc-973c-4392-8dd1-808d1d7e95c2.content: {Freedom is the ability to realize one's potential}, {Self-realization requires that one's path is not manipulated by external forces}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals can achieve their potential without manipulation}

a411ed50-d908-4776-a596-e5e5bc8b158d.content: {Freedom is having the power to act on one's own behalf}, {Empowerment requires that one's power is not undermined by manipulation}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have the power to act independently}

b2200249-a504-401d-96d0-ff68a38e924f.content: {Freedom is the ability to make informed choices}, {Informed choice requires that one's information is not manipulated}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals can make decisions based on accurate information}

042cca77-4fb5-4d99-bb3c-987a57735679.summary: Distinguishing between genuine and manipulated opportunities
042cca77-4fb5-4d99-bb3c-987a57735679.content: {There is a distinction between genuine opportunities and manipulated opportunities}, {Freedom as opportunity is concerned with genuine opportunities rather than manipulated ones}, {Manipulation undermines the authenticity of opportunities, thus affecting genuine freedom}, {A person whose preferences are manipulated does not have genuine opportunities, even if they appear to have many options}

39adacc7-8255-473d-b357-1ebee6b8e545.summary: Rejecting the intuition that manipulation negates freedom
39adacc7-8255-473d-b357-1ebee6b8e545.content: {It is false that manipulation necessarily negates freedom}, {Freedom as opportunity focuses on the availability of options, not the origin of preferences}, {A person with manipulated preferences can still be free if they have a wide range of opportunities to achieve their goals}, {The intuition that manipulation negates freedom can be explained by conflating freedom with autonomy}

3fa1e4a7-43d6-4588-9dd8-08dd46be4dca.summary: Supplementing with a condition of authenticity
3fa1e4a7-43d6-4588-9dd8-08dd46be4dca.content: {Freedom as opportunity can include a condition of authenticity for preferences}, {Authenticity requires that preferences are formed without undue external manipulation}, {With the authenticity condition, manipulated preferences do not count towards genuine freedom}, {This supplementary condition ensures that freedom as opportunity remains intact even in the presence of manipulation}

9395a829-324a-4b78-ae97-fb979440c1b7.content: {Freedom is having the opportunity to achieve one's goals}, {Opportunities are the available options and resources to pursue one's aims}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have a wide range of meaningful opportunities to choose from}

91084989-f462-40fc-85d0-1fa9c83b133f.content: {Freedom is having the opportunity to achieve one's goals}, {Opportunities are the available options and resources to pursue one's aims}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have a wide range of opportunities to choose from}, {Individuals must have the agency to make significant choices among their opportunities}

2cfd0e62-bded-4f7e-b3a8-cca436cae82e.content: {Freedom is having the opportunity to achieve one's goals}, {Opportunities are the available options and resources to pursue one's aims}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have a wide range of opportunities to choose from}, {Opportunities must be significant to the individual's life to enhance freedom}

cacab341-bee5-466d-9f93-7a2ed9af1053.content: {Freedom is having the opportunity to achieve one's goals}, {Opportunities are the available options and resources to pursue one's aims}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have a wide range of opportunities to choose from}, {Individuals must autonomously choose among their opportunities for freedom to be meaningful}

b2ed01df-bfd1-4e24-8ce8-c4f96ae37715.content: {Freedom is having the opportunity to achieve one's goals}, {Opportunities are the available options and resources to pursue one's aims}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have a wide range of opportunities to choose from}, {Individuals must be empowered to make choices that affect their lives significantly}

d17c1802-5acc-44c2-ab06-062e63166510.summary: Distinguishing between trivial and significant opportunities
d17c1802-5acc-44c2-ab06-062e63166510.content: {There is a distinction between trivial opportunities and significant opportunities}, {Freedom as opportunity is concerned with significant opportunities rather than trivial ones}, {Trivial or inconsequential options do not enhance freedom in the relevant sense}, {The principle that meaningful freedom requires significant choices is consistent with the view that liberty is maximized by significant opportunities}

624d59a6-f9a3-4300-8dd5-ea3c6d9f307b.summary: Rejecting the necessity of significant choices for freedom
624d59a6-f9a3-4300-8dd5-ea3c6d9f307b.content: {It is false that meaningful freedom requires the ability to make significant choices}, {Opportunities themselves, regardless of their perceived significance, contribute to freedom}, {The presence of a wide range of opportunities, even if some are trivial, enhances liberty by providing more options}

8b81660f-ca56-4b37-9404-ff0c03fbcfdb.summary: Supplementing with a focus on personal value
8b81660f-ca56-4b37-9404-ff0c03fbcfdb.content: {Opportunities are meaningful when they align with personal values and goals}, {Freedom as opportunity can include a supplementary assumption that opportunities must be personally valuable to enhance freedom}, {The principle that meaningful freedom requires significant choices is addressed by considering personal value in the assessment of opportunities}
