b6051148-054f-4bb5-ae74-6e895e724d41.content: {Freedom is having the autonomy to make one's own choices}, {Autonomy involves the ability to reflect on and endorse one's desires}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals can act according to their authentic desires}

6eaf9e20-8daf-4750-b483-a81158f25b7a.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination by others}, {Domination occurs when one is subject to arbitrary interference}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals are protected from arbitrary interference}

69f42df5-5efd-4b0d-aff5-63c9297e0d4b.content: {Freedom is the ability to realize one's true self}, {Self-realization involves understanding and pursuing one's true interests}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals can pursue their true interests without external constraints}

726e10e8-b67b-4994-b278-852de7b29d3d.content: {Freedom is having rational control over one's actions}, {Rational control involves making decisions based on reason rather than external pressures}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals can act according to reason}

435af408-32f8-4413-9ce9-c798295b1b84.content: {Freedom is the absence of coercion in decision-making}, {Coercion involves being forced to act against one's will}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals are free from coercion}

b9d9e699-cbbf-4b72-b0e4-9291eb67e508.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act as an effective agent}, {Effective agency involves having the skills and knowledge to pursue one's goals}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have the capacity to effectively pursue their goals}

2f023145-19a0-4215-b916-4ee7c593a8d1.content: {Freedom is having moral independence in one's choices}, {Moral independence involves making choices based on one's own moral framework}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals can act according to their own moral beliefs}

c21cd2de-9238-4cb0-bd56-cf6186b73eed.content: {Freedom is having the capability to achieve valuable outcomes}, {Capabilities are the real opportunities to achieve what one values}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have the capabilities to achieve valuable outcomes}

6b0cc9e2-6ceb-443b-bb87-3362d8515458.summary: Distinguishing between opportunities and effective opportunities
6b0cc9e2-6ceb-443b-bb87-3362d8515458.content: {There is a distinction between mere opportunities and effective opportunities}, {Freedom as opportunity is concerned with effective opportunities, which are those that can be realistically pursued given external conditions}, {Societal pressures can limit effective opportunities without reducing the number of mere opportunities}, {A person is free when they have effective opportunities, not just any opportunities}

f2fdfd27-5028-44ed-847b-74ba49eb5ccb.summary: Rejecting the intuition that societal pressures negate freedom
f2fdfd27-5028-44ed-847b-74ba49eb5ccb.content: {It is mistaken to claim that societal pressures inherently negate freedom}, {Societal pressures do not eliminate opportunities but influence the desirability of certain choices}, {Freedom as opportunity remains intact as long as individuals can still choose among a range of options, even if some are less appealing due to societal norms}

d96753c6-c1a4-411f-b54f-a0ea490e41e4.summary: Incorporating the role of internal deliberation
d96753c6-c1a4-411f-b54f-a0ea490e41e4.content: {Freedom as opportunity includes the capacity for internal deliberation about one's choices}, {Societal pressures are part of the context in which individuals deliberate}, {True freedom involves the ability to reflect on and potentially resist societal pressures when making choices}, {Opportunities are meaningful when individuals can engage in such deliberation}

ab262ed9-fec0-474c-97c6-219b1fd293ed.content: {Freedom is having the ability to make effective choices}, {Effective choices are those that align with one's values and goals}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals can make choices that are both meaningful and manageable}

3392246d-6b53-45f9-9970-569b155ef308.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act according to one's own will}, {Autonomy involves making decisions based on personal values and reasoning}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have the autonomy to pursue their own life plans}

0e1808a4-e7c4-40e6-892c-5734c771b6a6.content: {Freedom is having a balanced set of opportunities}, {Balanced opportunities are those that provide variety without overwhelming complexity}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have a manageable range of meaningful opportunities}

51049a5a-4380-45b9-90da-859bbecde3b1.content: {Freedom is the ability to make rational choices}, {Rational choices are those that are informed and deliberate}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have the capacity to make well-considered decisions}

04e49a90-0d52-4996-8387-d89a95caa0fd.content: {Freedom is the power to determine one's own actions}, {Self-determination involves setting and pursuing one's own goals}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have control over their own life paths}

564cbb05-1fc6-4760-b800-a28782c01c3b.content: {Freedom is the ability to engage meaningfully with one's environment}, {Meaningful engagement involves pursuing activities that are fulfilling and significant}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals can engage in pursuits that resonate with their personal values}

18c06fb2-a633-4c4b-9276-7389d3ac03dd.content: {Freedom is having the power to make choices that matter}, {Empowered choices are those that have a significant impact on one's life}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have the resources and support to make impactful decisions}

184a69e1-fcd2-41a2-8fc6-cf2585a0f364.content: {Freedom is having opportunities that are relevant to one's context}, {Contextual opportunities are those that fit one's circumstances and needs}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have opportunities that are appropriate to their personal situations}

6fec45c5-b5f3-4e3b-a548-f99f50c2de97.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act as an agent in the world}, {Practical agency involves having the skills and means to pursue one's goals}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals can effectively navigate and influence their environment}

bb7b9f79-1d1f-4f6f-9b85-a92ca618ceb5.content: {Freedom is the ability to make choices with a clear purpose}, {Choices with purpose are those that are directed towards meaningful ends}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals can pursue goals that are significant and intentional}

df4ce91a-b63e-4984-a207-b8aae38c2290.summary: Distinguishing between beneficial and overwhelming opportunities
df4ce91a-b63e-4984-a207-b8aae38c2290.content: {There is a distinction between beneficial opportunities and overwhelming opportunities}, {Freedom as opportunity is concerned with beneficial opportunities rather than overwhelming ones}, {An overwhelming number of opportunities can lead to decision paralysis, which is not conducive to freedom}, {The intuition that too many options can hinder freedom is explained by the distinction between beneficial and overwhelming opportunities}

fb873a2c-5d92-4bd3-84b7-f3dedb146e99.summary: Rejecting the intuition that more opportunities always hinder freedom
fb873a2c-5d92-4bd3-84b7-f3dedb146e99.content: {It is false that having more opportunities inherently leads to decision paralysis}, {Decision paralysis is a psychological issue, not a limitation of freedom itself}, {The presence of many opportunities does not diminish freedom if individuals can effectively manage their choices}

90d85a36-7d71-4840-ab4a-959e9ac72252.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of decision-making skills
90d85a36-7d71-4840-ab4a-959e9ac72252.content: {Effective decision-making skills are necessary to navigate a wide range of opportunities}, {Freedom as opportunity assumes individuals have or can develop the skills to manage their choices}, {With decision-making skills, an increase in opportunities enhances rather than hinders freedom}

3b28f6b5-e14a-433c-b777-77b51ece07e6.content: {Freedom is having the opportunity to achieve one's goals}, {Freedom requires the ability to act on opportunities}, {Opportunities are the available options and resources to pursue one's aims}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have a wide range of opportunities and the ability to act on them}

e1b081df-1b53-4045-a517-7b4e7932851d.content: {Freedom is having effective opportunities to achieve one's goals}, {Effective opportunities require both the presence of options and the means to utilize them}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have effective opportunities to choose from}

14754721-b49c-49dc-b055-e484b18b8ddd.content: {Freedom is having the power to make choices that lead to the achievement of one's goals}, {Empowerment involves both opportunities and the capability to act on them}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals are empowered to make choices from a wide range of opportunities}

2e16a598-641c-4cf9-9b97-303d2f590b9d.content: {Freedom is having the capability to achieve one's goals}, {Capabilities include both opportunities and the ability to act on them}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have a wide range of capabilities}

33e9c2f4-b370-4a70-b1c6-1694084ca793.content: {Freedom is having practical opportunities to achieve one's goals}, {Practical opportunities require both the availability of options and the practical means to pursue them}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have practical opportunities to choose from}

1f1cb663-a86e-44f9-aa2e-f9263b1ee2ea.content: {There is a distinction between having opportunities and having the ability to act on them}, {Freedom as opportunity is a theory about the availability of options, not the ability to utilize them}, {The presence of opportunities is a necessary condition for freedom, even if the ability to act on them is lacking}, {The objection confuses the concept of opportunity with the concept of ability}

29ab73b6-3ad8-4d66-94c7-de739fe57fa5.summary: Rejecting the necessity of ability for freedom
29ab73b6-3ad8-4d66-94c7-de739fe57fa5.content: {It is false that the ability to act on opportunities is necessary for freedom}, {Freedom is primarily about the presence of opportunities, not the capacity to act on them}, {The intuition that ability is required for freedom is mistaken and conflates freedom with power}

a8c74af8-8d97-4086-96c1-8ea2106e465f.summary: Supplementing with a focus on potentiality
a8c74af8-8d97-4086-96c1-8ea2106e465f.content: {Freedom involves potentiality, which includes having opportunities even if they are not currently actionable}, {The potential to act on opportunities in the future is a key aspect of freedom}, {The objection overlooks the importance of potential future actions in the concept of freedom}

d11a9429-9d25-42c4-b100-5cb659589f05.content: {Freedom is having the opportunity to achieve one's goals}, {Opportunities are the available options and resources to pursue one's aims}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have a wide range of opportunities to choose from}, {Freedom requires the absence of coercion in making choices}

ba972b09-2c33-4dfc-aee6-3c6945681475.content: {Freedom is having the opportunity to achieve one's goals}, {Opportunities are the available options and resources to pursue one's aims}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have a wide range of opportunities to choose from}, {Freedom requires that individuals make choices based on their own values and reasoning}

4cbc4d7c-61fe-49db-b4b4-a0f4ff8e8cb5.content: {Freedom is having the opportunity to achieve one's goals}, {Opportunities are the available options and resources to pursue one's aims}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have a wide range of opportunities to choose from}, {Freedom requires that choices are made voluntarily without external pressure}

2c3359eb-f924-416f-95f1-9609852dedf2.content: {Freedom is having the opportunity to achieve one's goals}, {Opportunities are the available options and resources to pursue one's aims}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have a wide range of opportunities to choose from}, {Freedom requires that individuals have control over their own decision-making processes}

8d695c1a-48c9-497f-a212-cab2608997c4.content: {Freedom is having the opportunity to achieve one's goals}, {Opportunities are the available options and resources to pursue one's aims}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have a wide range of opportunities to choose from}, {Freedom requires that individuals are not subject to the arbitrary will of others}

5325e827-7d40-4716-be87-9ba4fd9ce0b2.content: {There is a distinction between having opportunities and being free from coercion}, {Freedom as opportunity focuses on the availability of options, not the absence of coercion}, {Coercion affects the exercise of freedom, not the existence of opportunities}, {A person can have opportunities but still be coerced, which affects their freedom in a different sense}

6c6ce70b-c827-4d0d-957f-e695d4351738.summary: Rejecting the intuition that coercion negates freedom
6c6ce70b-c827-4d0d-957f-e695d4351738.content: {It is false that coercion necessarily negates freedom as opportunity}, {Freedom as opportunity is about the range of options available, not the influence on choice}, {The presence of coercion does not eliminate the opportunities themselves}, {The intuition that coercion negates freedom can be explained by conflating different senses of freedom}

04e39317-16cd-4bde-81a1-108858d1f3a1.summary: Supplementing with a distinction between external and internal freedom
04e39317-16cd-4bde-81a1-108858d1f3a1.content: {Freedom can be understood as both external and internal}, {External freedom refers to the availability of opportunities}, {Internal freedom refers to the ability to choose without coercion}, {Freedom as opportunity pertains to external freedom, while coercion affects internal freedom}

ea26fcad-ac0e-4511-830a-280962391cd0.content: {Freedom is having the capability to achieve one's goals}, {Capabilities are the actual abilities and conditions to pursue one's aims}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have the capabilities to effectively pursue their chosen opportunities}

33e664af-66cf-4110-86ad-0b8af04e198e.content: {Freedom is having the effective power to achieve one's goals}, {Effective power includes both opportunities and the means to overcome systemic barriers}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have both opportunities and the power to act on them without systemic hindrances}

278e087e-6657-4e1e-9951-bde850bd4e0d.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination by others}, {Domination is the capacity of others to interfere arbitrarily in one's choices}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals are free from the threat of arbitrary interference}

ce635fc9-21eb-41e6-9d28-329c4c5ca67e.content: {Freedom is the ability to make autonomous choices}, {Autonomy requires both opportunities and the absence of coercion or manipulation}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals can make choices based on their own values and reasoning}

80a94922-9f54-4c17-bc1a-5fdb163711bd.content: {Freedom is having equal opportunities to achieve one's goals}, {Equality of opportunity requires that systemic barriers are removed for all individuals}, {Liberty is maximized when opportunities are distributed equally, allowing fair competition}

d20a3544-32d0-418d-9480-746e1ba7076f.content: {Freedom is the ability to act in accordance with one's true self}, {Positive liberty requires both opportunities and self-mastery}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals can pursue their true interests without internal or external constraints}

4073f618-ca4b-4f2c-8304-21390ab87c61.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's potential}, {Self-realization requires opportunities and the means to develop one's abilities}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals can fully develop and express their capabilities}

57479b6d-cc60-45a6-9b1e-ffb6fa8095b8.content: {Freedom is being empowered to achieve one's goals}, {Empowerment includes opportunities and the resources to overcome systemic challenges}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals are empowered to act effectively in pursuit of their aims}

8459d367-0c6f-4171-aee0-5dbfc3712b19.content: {Freedom is the absence of interference in one's choices}, {Non-interference must be coupled with equality to ensure fair access to opportunities}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals are free from interference and have equal access to opportunities}

ce61c0ec-f02c-4120-9192-0d8671e0fda4.content: {Freedom is having opportunities that are meaningful within one's context}, {Contextual opportunities require that systemic inequalities are addressed}, {Liberty is maximized when opportunities are relevant and accessible within the individual's social and economic context}

3096c93b-b63e-46ce-9f14-a88aee84a596.summary: Distinguishing between formal and effective opportunities
3096c93b-b63e-46ce-9f14-a88aee84a596.content: {There is a distinction between formal opportunities and effective opportunities}, {Freedom as opportunity is a theory about formal opportunities rather than effective opportunities}, {Systemic inequality affects effective opportunities but not necessarily formal opportunities}, {A person can be considered free in terms of formal opportunities even if systemic inequality limits their effective opportunities}, {The intuition that systemic inequality undermines freedom can be explained as confusion between formal and effective opportunities}

f4d0154e-0719-4f8e-86fa-e2818721720f.summary: Rejecting the intuition that systemic inequality negates freedom
f4d0154e-0719-4f8e-86fa-e2818721720f.content: {It is false that systemic inequality necessarily negates freedom as opportunity}, {Opportunities can exist independently of the ability to succeed within them}, {The presence of systemic inequality does not eliminate the existence of opportunities themselves}, {Freedom as opportunity focuses on the availability of options, not the likelihood of success}

1d70824f-cf6e-4beb-8926-abb11f15b316.summary: Supplementing with a focus on resource distribution
1d70824f-cf6e-4beb-8926-abb11f15b316.content: {Freedom as opportunity can be supplemented with a focus on equitable resource distribution}, {Systemic inequality can be addressed by ensuring fair access to resources that enable the pursuit of opportunities}, {With equitable resource distribution, the objection that opportunities alone do not guarantee freedom loses its force}, {This supplementary assumption allows for a broader understanding of freedom that includes both opportunities and the means to pursue them}

6545da8d-2e5e-4f59-91d2-af4c082198c7.content: {Freedom is having the opportunity to achieve one's goals}, {Opportunities are the available options and resources to pursue one's aims}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have a wide range of valuable opportunities to choose from}

7e01430d-6665-415d-b106-5ecea68cf8ce.content: {Freedom is having the opportunity to achieve one's goals}, {Opportunities are the available options and resources to pursue one's aims}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have a range of qualitatively distinct opportunities to choose from}

5a983590-e730-49e8-9cac-08317b79bdaf.content: {Freedom is having the opportunity to achieve one's goals}, {Opportunities are the available options and resources to pursue one's aims}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have a range of meaningful opportunities to choose from}

edf1b378-65ac-472d-9cba-f0651f1f9267.content: {Freedom is having the opportunity to achieve one's goals}, {Opportunities are the available options and resources to pursue one's aims}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have opportunities that are contextually relevant to their personal circumstances}

59336f63-eac8-4618-92dd-54a4c9002631.content: {Freedom is having the opportunity to achieve one's goals}, {Opportunities are the available options and resources to pursue one's aims}, {Liberty is maximized when individuals have a balanced range of opportunities that include both quantity and quality}

514ab66f-6969-4c2f-b1b0-e635e130f39f.summary: Distinguishing between quantitative and qualitative opportunities
514ab66f-6969-4c2f-b1b0-e635e130f39f.content: {There is a distinction between the quantity and quality of opportunities}, {Freedom as opportunity is concerned with both the number and the value of opportunities}, {Not all opportunities are equally valuable, and freedom considers the significance of these opportunities}, {The objection confuses the mere counting of opportunities with the assessment of their qualitative worth}

fcc1fea6-66e5-430d-ab1a-9c1dce3fa7e4.summary: Rejecting the idea that freedom is purely quantitative
fcc1fea6-66e5-430d-ab1a-9c1dce3fa7e4.content: {It is false that freedom as opportunity is solely about the number of options}, {Freedom involves assessing the value and relevance of opportunities to an individual's goals}, {The qualitative aspects of opportunities are integral to the concept of freedom as opportunity}

b18f8d7a-961c-466c-a8e9-aafbf929d3a0.summary: Supplementing with a value-based assessment of opportunities
b18f8d7a-961c-466c-a8e9-aafbf929d3a0.content: {Freedom as opportunity includes a supplementary assumption that opportunities must be assessed for their value}, {The assessment of opportunities involves considering their relevance and significance to an individual's goals}, {This value-based assessment ensures that freedom is not reduced to a mere calculation of available options}

6ad5de38-fefb-435f-ad35-389b03fbf1fc.content: {Freedom is the absence of constraints on action}, {Constraints are limitations or restrictions on what one can do}, {Liberty is present when individuals face minimal external and internal barriers to action}, {Freedom involves the presence of meaningful choices}, {Meaningful choices are those that significantly impact one's life and well-being}

82a8e51d-5893-4142-8661-41218ca162e7.content: {Freedom is the absence of constraints on action}, {Constraints are limitations or restrictions on what one can do}, {Liberty is present when individuals face minimal external and internal barriers to action}, {Freedom involves having the capability to achieve valuable outcomes}, {Capabilities are the real opportunities to accomplish what one values}

1f7c30b7-16de-432e-94c1-7f1a496f1e5f.content: {Freedom is the absence of constraints on action}, {Constraints are limitations or restrictions on what one can do}, {Liberty is present when individuals face minimal external and internal barriers to action}, {Freedom involves the ability to make autonomous choices}, {Autonomous choices are those made according to one's own values and reasoning}

86c0b858-1e6c-473e-adf1-7e81aa7a7b63.content: {Freedom is the absence of constraints on action}, {Constraints are limitations or restrictions on what one can do}, {Liberty is present when individuals face minimal external and internal barriers to action}, {Freedom involves being empowered to pursue one's goals}, {Empowerment is having the resources and support necessary to achieve one's aims}

27c979b2-b4e2-4ef7-8522-7d0a38a9bd9c.content: {Freedom is the absence of constraints on action}, {Constraints are limitations or restrictions on what one can do}, {Liberty is present when individuals face minimal external and internal barriers to action}, {Freedom involves the enhancement of individual well-being}, {Well-being is the state of being comfortable, healthy, or happy}

e2ac73cc-f5f7-460f-bdf9-787ed6a99226.summary: Distinguishing between constraints and quality of choices
e2ac73cc-f5f7-460f-bdf9-787ed6a99226.content: {There is a distinction between the absence of constraints and the quality of choices available}, {Freedom as absence of constraints is a theory about the lack of limitations, not about the nature of choices}, {The presence of only trivial or harmful choices does not imply a lack of freedom if no constraints are present}, {The intuition that freedom requires meaningful choices can be explained as a separate concern from the absence of constraints}

5e59b211-c09c-47fe-a318-5a635376ca70.summary: Rejecting the necessity of meaningful choices for freedom
5e59b211-c09c-47fe-a318-5a635376ca70.content: {It is false that freedom requires the presence of meaningful choices}, {Freedom is defined solely by the absence of constraints, regardless of the nature of available choices}, {The scenario of having only trivial or harmful choices does not undermine the absence of constraints}

69c12c74-7a1b-4b4f-ab18-244855fb9b50.summary: Supplementing with a focus on autonomy
69c12c74-7a1b-4b4f-ab18-244855fb9b50.content: {Autonomy involves self-governance and making choices based on one's own values and reasons}, {Freedom as absence of constraints can be supplemented with the concept of autonomy to address concerns about meaningful choices}, {The presence of autonomy ensures that individuals can pursue meaningful choices even in the absence of constraints}

4ab33bae-fb6d-41df-be99-0d6c0dac57b9.content: {Freedom is the ability to act according to one's own will}, {Constraints include both external and internal factors that limit self-determination}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices aligned with their authentic desires and values}

b18251e8-7398-4909-9e8d-05bd0b9e2e74.content: {Freedom is the capacity for autonomous decision-making}, {Autonomy requires the absence of both external and internal constraints}, {Liberty is present when individuals can reflectively endorse their motivations and actions}

eda0b3f7-e636-4715-b52d-c1d559e4f81f.content: {Freedom is the ability to act in accordance with rational deliberation}, {Constraints include irrational impulses and external restrictions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can govern their actions through reason}

f54c9e97-662b-4a2b-97b7-1293f0b13e36.content: {Freedom is the possession of the power and resources to fulfill one's own potential}, {Constraints include both external barriers and internal incapacities}, {Liberty is present when individuals have the means to achieve self-realization}

ef5bc1e2-4757-414b-aea5-fc1e39a38b45.content: {Freedom is the alignment of one's actions with one's true self}, {Constraints include external pressures and internal misalignments with one's identity}, {Liberty is present when individuals act in accordance with their authentic self}

7592000e-4ffd-41c5-bfaf-618535b5b09e.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination by others}, {Constraints include both overt control and subtle forms of manipulation}, {Liberty is present when individuals are not subject to arbitrary interference}

d223b744-b908-4154-8d3a-49fa0a052ae8.content: {Freedom is the ability to control one's own desires and impulses}, {Constraints include both external restrictions and internal lack of self-control}, {Liberty is present when individuals can master their own motivations}

28986557-869b-43e7-a881-e43666fe6817.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act effectively in the world}, {Constraints include both external limitations and internal disempowerment}, {Liberty is present when individuals have the capability to pursue their goals}

9405ead0-d026-458c-af82-7d268c1a068c.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act as a moral agent}, {Constraints include both external coercion and internal moral incapacity}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make moral choices freely}

52fe54d1-198c-4b99-ba1c-e51d50e1d322.content: {Freedom is the ability to express one's own identity and beliefs}, {Constraints include external censorship and internal suppression of self}, {Liberty is present when individuals can freely express who they are}

739139dd-7c87-4a4f-a535-c9e62519acf9.summary: Distinguishing between external and internal constraints
739139dd-7c87-4a4f-a535-c9e62519acf9.content: {There is a distinction between external constraints and internal compulsions}, {Freedom as absence of constraints is primarily concerned with external constraints}, {Internal compulsions like addiction do not count as constraints in the relevant sense for this theory}, {The intuition that internal compulsion undermines freedom can be explained by conflating different types of constraints}

505dcfa1-a563-402a-8d03-05f7366877d3.summary: Rejecting the intuition that internal compulsion undermines freedom
505dcfa1-a563-402a-8d03-05f7366877d3.content: {It is mistaken to think that internal compulsion undermines freedom in the absence of external constraints}, {Freedom is defined by the absence of external constraints, not internal compulsions}, {The presence of internal compulsion does not negate the absence of external constraints}

c5a02898-896f-41af-9d38-575159727de0.summary: Supplementing with a focus on external conditions
c5a02898-896f-41af-9d38-575159727de0.content: {Freedom is primarily about the absence of external constraints}, {Internal compulsions are not considered constraints within this framework}, {The focus on external conditions allows for a consistent application of the theory without addressing internal compulsions}

07b7928c-c792-4204-bd9c-c85bc250b30d.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve one's goals}, {Constraints are not just physical barriers but also lack of resources or opportunities}, {Liberty is present when individuals have the capabilities to pursue their objectives}

c6113c96-633e-423a-91f1-c0d001b6aad9.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination by others}, {Domination is the capacity of others to arbitrarily interfere in one's choices}, {Liberty is present when individuals are not subject to the arbitrary will of others}

3951b638-a041-4a32-a13d-74caa69e5d3b.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's true self or potential}, {Constraints include internal factors like ignorance or false consciousness}, {Liberty is present when individuals can develop and express their authentic selves}

7e647daa-1979-4aa9-b7a2-7628453c4f42.content: {Freedom is the capacity to make one's own choices}, {Constraints include external pressures and internal compulsions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act according to their own reasoned decisions}

9b136c06-0fee-4d29-b24a-738d617ed9ae.content: {Freedom is having fair opportunities to pursue one's goals}, {Constraints include systemic inequalities that limit access to opportunities}, {Liberty is present when individuals have equitable chances to succeed}

0a0bad50-3c85-4630-ba05-3d88913f108f.content: {There is a distinction between direct constraints and indirect constraints}, {Freedom as absence of constraints refers to direct constraints, such as legal or physical barriers}, {Systemic inequalities are indirect constraints and do not directly limit specific actions}, {The intuition that systemic inequalities undermine freedom can be explained by conflating direct and indirect constraints}

629d1d95-ae7a-4f6a-a827-2470e4554f73.summary: Rejecting the intuition that systemic inequalities negate freedom
629d1d95-ae7a-4f6a-a827-2470e4554f73.content: {It is mistaken to claim that systemic inequalities inherently negate freedom}, {Freedom as absence of constraints focuses on the lack of direct barriers to action}, {Systemic inequalities may affect opportunities but do not constitute direct constraints on specific actions}

416b82a4-2441-4268-ada8-7c49dbaa415f.summary: Supplementing with a focus on opportunity
416b82a4-2441-4268-ada8-7c49dbaa415f.content: {Freedom as absence of constraints can be supplemented with a focus on opportunity}, {Opportunities are conditions that enhance the ability to act freely}, {Systemic inequalities affect opportunities but do not directly impose constraints}, {By considering opportunities, the impact of systemic inequalities can be acknowledged without altering the core view of freedom}

0bca56dc-1019-42a4-a685-6d305a45a096.summary: Freedom as Autonomy and Absence of Constraints
0bca56dc-1019-42a4-a685-6d305a45a096.content: {Freedom involves both the absence of constraints and the presence of autonomy}, {Autonomy is the ability to govern oneself}, {Constraints are limitations or restrictions on what one can do}, {Liberty is present when individuals face minimal external and internal barriers to action and have the capacity for self-governance}

9d555575-4030-4e9a-8ab5-529554e6765c.summary: Freedom as Positive and Negative Liberty
9d555575-4030-4e9a-8ab5-529554e6765c.content: {Freedom consists of both negative liberty and positive liberty}, {Negative liberty is the absence of constraints on action}, {Positive liberty is the capacity to act upon one's free will}, {Liberty is present when individuals have minimal external and internal barriers to action and the ability to pursue their own goals}

14028207-26a7-4571-8e10-d15c0c9dc394.content: {Freedom is the capability to achieve valuable functionings}, {Capabilities are the real opportunities to accomplish what one values}, {Constraints are limitations or restrictions on what one can do}, {Liberty is present when individuals have the genuine ability to pursue their own well-being and goals}

d4788b56-1860-481e-bcc6-cbe718f8b7e8.content: {Freedom is the ability to determine one's own actions and life course}, {Self-determination involves both autonomy and the absence of constraints}, {Constraints are limitations or restrictions on what one can do}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that reflect their true self and values}

1894f270-164d-43cf-87b5-918e80a2fed9.content: {Freedom is the ability to act according to one's rational will}, {Rational autonomy involves making decisions based on reason and self-governance}, {Constraints are limitations or restrictions on what one can do}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act in accordance with their rational deliberations without undue external or internal barriers}

09a760da-e165-413b-a8c5-b421984dda23.content: {There is a distinction between freedom and autonomy}, {Freedom as absence of constraints is a theory about external and internal barriers, not about self-governance}, {Autonomy involves self-governance and decision-making, which is separate from the absence of constraints}, {The intuition that autonomy is essential to freedom can be explained as a conflation of two distinct concepts}

b26fa8e0-8563-4870-9695-8410041186bc.summary: Rejecting the necessity of autonomy for freedom
b26fa8e0-8563-4870-9695-8410041186bc.content: {It is false that autonomy is necessary for freedom}, {Freedom can exist in the absence of constraints even if autonomy is not present}, {The presence of minimal barriers to action is sufficient for freedom without requiring self-governance}

af5b12f9-0b40-4cba-b3fb-8768150a8036.summary: Supplementing with a focus on external constraints
af5b12f9-0b40-4cba-b3fb-8768150a8036.content: {Freedom as absence of constraints focuses on external limitations}, {Autonomy can be seen as an internal constraint, which is not the focus of this theory}, {The theory remains intact by emphasizing that freedom is about minimizing external barriers, not internal self-governance}

7d62b284-a328-4757-b1e7-406f7b8b7827.content: {Freedom is the ability to act according to one's own will}, {Constraints can be compatible with freedom if they are self-imposed}, {Liberty is present when individuals can pursue self-chosen goals without external interference}

73b12388-d849-41a8-a55a-ff9af2b1e546.content: {Freedom is the capacity to govern oneself}, {Constraints do not negate freedom if they align with one's rational will}, {Liberty is present when individuals act in accordance with their own values and principles}

44a95a52-d6b6-4dd9-9136-aa0c08878025.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's potential}, {Constraints can be part of freedom if they enable personal development}, {Liberty is present when individuals have the means to achieve self-fulfillment}

beceda9f-4567-4eda-ae47-3acc952525ac.content: {Freedom is the ability to make choices based on reason}, {Constraints are compatible with freedom if they promote rational decision-making}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act in accordance with their rational deliberations}

977b55a8-81c7-413f-870e-05eca915277d.content: {Freedom is the pursuit of one's true self}, {Constraints can enhance freedom if they guide individuals towards self-discovery}, {Liberty is present when individuals can express their authentic selves}

7e5c8905-bddb-4656-aecd-6e9d849db58c.summary: Distinguishing between self-imposed and external constraints
7e5c8905-bddb-4656-aecd-6e9d849db58c.content: {There is a distinction between self-imposed constraints and external constraints}, {Freedom as absence of constraints is primarily concerned with external constraints}, {Self-imposed constraints, such as a diet or study schedule, do not negate freedom because they are voluntarily chosen}, {The intuition that self-imposed constraints enhance freedom can be explained by their role in personal growth and autonomy}

71a1ed9c-010d-437a-bf41-6eced16b5813.summary: Rejecting the intuition that all constraints negate freedom
71a1ed9c-010d-437a-bf41-6eced16b5813.content: {It is false that all constraints negate freedom}, {Self-imposed constraints can be compatible with freedom because they are expressions of personal autonomy}, {The presence of self-imposed constraints does not necessarily limit freedom if they are aligned with one's goals and values}

56fbca81-7567-4946-b872-c15725ab7a0d.summary: Supplementing with the concept of positive freedom
56fbca81-7567-4946-b872-c15725ab7a0d.content: {Positive freedom involves the ability to pursue one's own goals and self-realization}, {Self-imposed constraints can be seen as enhancing positive freedom by facilitating personal development}, {The presence of self-imposed constraints does not negate freedom if they contribute to achieving one's own objectives}

a0f80914-279c-4c26-b832-7beb8c8d02fe.content: {Freedom is the ability to act according to one's own rational will}, {Rational decision-making is necessary for meaningful freedom}, {Constraints are limitations or restrictions on rational action}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make rational choices without external and internal barriers}

e0987522-c883-4e2b-ae4b-6a26e5cf09e6.content: {Freedom is the capacity for self-determination}, {Self-determination requires the ability to make rational decisions}, {Constraints are limitations on one's ability to determine one's own actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can determine their own actions without undue influence}

f4c17a4f-93ca-4425-8cb9-4610f6d1d186.content: {Freedom is the presence of conditions that enable rational decision-making}, {Rational decision-making is essential for exercising freedom}, {Constraints are factors that inhibit rational decision-making}, {Liberty is present when individuals have the resources and opportunities to make rational choices}

b470629f-908d-45e6-935d-8a39f05457f4.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act as a moral agent}, {Moral agency requires rational decision-making}, {Constraints are limitations on one's ability to act morally}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act according to moral principles without undue constraints}

13f1707e-6ef3-4c1f-b41a-dea486bc88b7.content: {Freedom is the capacity for deliberation and choice}, {Deliberation requires rational decision-making}, {Constraints are limitations on one's ability to deliberate and choose}, {Liberty is present when individuals can deliberate and choose without undue restrictions}

0e771f27-ec22-4a87-99fe-6ec8d0dfb7ea.summary: Distinguishing between freedom and rational capacity
0e771f27-ec22-4a87-99fe-6ec8d0dfb7ea.content: {There is a distinction between freedom and the capacity for rational decision-making}, {Freedom as absence of constraints is a theory about external and internal barriers, not about decision-making capacities}, {The capacity for rational decision-making is not a constraint but a separate ability that influences how freedom is exercised}, {The objection confuses the conditions for meaningful choice with the conditions for freedom itself}

2fc3553d-4054-475f-b25f-c5b623a636bd.summary: Rejecting the necessity of rational decision-making for freedom
2fc3553d-4054-475f-b25f-c5b623a636bd.content: {It is false that the capacity for rational decision-making is necessary for freedom}, {Freedom can exist as the absence of constraints even if rational decision-making is impaired or absent}, {The meaningfulness of choices is a separate issue from the presence of freedom}, {The objection mistakenly conflates the value of choices with the presence of freedom}

2f31a8e0-6348-4c1b-9140-320deade650d.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of potential rational capacity
2f31a8e0-6348-4c1b-9140-320deade650d.content: {Assume that individuals have a potential capacity for rational decision-making even if it is not currently exercised}, {Freedom as absence of constraints is compatible with the potential for rational decision-making}, {The potential for rational decision-making ensures that freedom can be meaningful even if not currently realized}, {The objection loses its force when considering potential rather than actual rational capacity}

7a471a1c-85c7-469a-b70c-c46ab1efded9.content: {Freedom involves the presence of internal capabilities to act}, {Freedom requires the absence of external constraints on action}, {Liberty is present when individuals have both the internal capacity and external opportunity to act}

a3564c49-85fe-4c30-b688-d44f06195c6f.content: {Freedom is the ability to make one's own choices}, {Freedom requires the absence of external constraints on decision-making}, {Liberty is present when individuals can autonomously determine their actions without coercion}

b5dece43-3bdc-40e0-95b0-058e447b42f9.content: {Freedom involves the realization of one's true self}, {Freedom requires the absence of external constraints that hinder self-realization}, {Liberty is present when individuals can pursue their authentic goals and desires}

7b67560f-2a83-4774-8302-d81c07a4b111.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act according to reason}, {Freedom requires the absence of external constraints that impede rational decision-making}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act in accordance with rational deliberation}

01438992-f7b9-480f-ac0d-010da1b5d269.content: {Freedom involves the capacity to act with moral responsibility}, {Freedom requires the absence of external constraints that prevent moral action}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act in ways that align with moral duties}

c0750442-add9-48e8-a3f9-27ffec060b1d.content: {Freedom is the empowerment to achieve one's goals}, {Freedom requires the absence of external constraints that limit empowerment}, {Liberty is present when individuals have the resources and opportunities to pursue their objectives}

3961b546-bf43-4a8c-b7e4-200c11d7f703.content: {Freedom is the ability to determine one's own life path}, {Freedom requires the absence of external constraints on self-determination}, {Liberty is present when individuals can freely choose their life direction}

e6208b1d-be95-418a-aebd-afd43deab487.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination by others}, {Freedom requires the absence of external constraints imposed by dominating forces}, {Liberty is present when individuals are not subject to arbitrary power}

2f59793c-edb2-4e19-a5f2-1bbffe37c5c7.content: {Freedom is the capacity for creative expression}, {Freedom requires the absence of external constraints on creativity}, {Liberty is present when individuals can freely express their creative potential}

8c62e43d-bbc4-424d-bdcc-e9905ec5f84f.content: {Freedom involves the potential for personal growth}, {Freedom requires the absence of external constraints that hinder growth}, {Liberty is present when individuals can develop and expand their capabilities}

038f7948-87c9-4255-9eb4-ac9017f5262d.summary: Distinguishing between external and internal constraints
038f7948-87c9-4255-9eb4-ac9017f5262d.content: {There is a distinction between external constraints and internal constraints}, {Freedom as absence of constraints is a theory about external constraints rather than internal constraints}, {A lack of internal psychological capacity does not constitute an external constraint on action}, {The intuition that someone with internal limitations is unfree can be explained as a confusion between external and internal constraints}

80bc7211-cee8-4fc1-bf80-7d6d22a461a1.summary: Rejecting the necessity of internal capacities for freedom
80bc7211-cee8-4fc1-bf80-7d6d22a461a1.content: {It is false that internal psychological capacities are necessary for freedom}, {Freedom is defined solely by the absence of external constraints, regardless of internal capacities}, {The presence of internal limitations does not affect the external conditions that define freedom}

be2e15aa-b76d-4e65-9b50-bb05af2d488e.summary: Supplementing with a dual-aspect view of freedom
be2e15aa-b76d-4e65-9b50-bb05af2d488e.content: {Freedom can be understood as having both external and internal aspects}, {The absence of external constraints is one aspect of freedom}, {Internal psychological capacities are a separate aspect that complements but does not define freedom}, {The dual-aspect view allows for a comprehensive understanding of freedom without altering the original theory}

bed5d263-8880-4090-8bb6-0f7511b01998.content: {Freedom is the presence of capabilities to achieve one's goals}, {Capabilities are the positive abilities or powers to act}, {Liberty is present when individuals have the necessary skills and resources to pursue their aims}

f7d507fe-4c89-4e6a-b0f2-723a5059004a.content: {Freedom is the ability to make one's own choices}, {Autonomy is the capacity to govern oneself according to one's own values}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act according to their own decisions without external interference}

4df1a242-1234-4c78-973f-c8e3d3f0ef83.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's true self}, {Self-realization involves fulfilling one's potential and authentic desires}, {Liberty is present when individuals can pursue their true interests and develop their unique abilities}

59c9d6b9-7798-41f0-bfe9-40c67f26b9fa.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination by others}, {Domination is the capacity of others to arbitrarily interfere in one's choices}, {Liberty is present when individuals are protected from the arbitrary will of others}

8ac66d8a-3cd4-44bd-b147-b2604094f90d.content: {Freedom is the ability to act according to reason}, {Rational control involves making decisions based on logical deliberation}, {Liberty is present when individuals can govern their actions through rational thought}

794c31ad-ccd3-4f4a-a768-02e0d830f5e6.content: {Freedom is the empowerment to act effectively}, {Empowerment involves having the means and confidence to pursue one's goals}, {Liberty is present when individuals are equipped with the tools and support to achieve their objectives}

f9fe8bdd-e623-4065-a838-a7c471dcd6a5.content: {Freedom is the capacity for self-determination}, {Self-determination is the ability to set and pursue one's own life plan}, {Liberty is present when individuals can freely choose and follow their own path}

ae8b908e-a69f-444e-a18b-8935dae36af6.content: {Freedom is the ability to express oneself creatively}, {Creative expression involves the pursuit of innovative and original ideas}, {Liberty is present when individuals can explore and manifest their creative potential}

fe14a5d3-fe84-4de8-ae09-ac6eb124bfc3.content: {Freedom is the absence of coercion}, {Coercion is the use of force or threats to control someone's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals are free from coercive influences}

9850d520-b527-46e8-a801-e8d3bf6d80e0.content: {Freedom is the condition for human flourishing}, {Flourishing involves living a fulfilling and meaningful life}, {Liberty is present when individuals have the opportunity to thrive and achieve well-being}

40bd64ad-74a1-415b-abcc-f90f5e265a78.summary: Distinguishing between constraints and motivational states
40bd64ad-74a1-415b-abcc-f90f5e265a78.content: {There is a distinction between constraints and motivational states such as apathy or indecision}, {Freedom as absence of constraints is a theory about external and internal barriers, not about motivational states}, {Apathy or indecision does not constitute a constraint in the relevant sense}, {The absence of constraints does not guarantee action, but it does guarantee the potential for action}

5584a509-2e06-455c-96ae-6b8a50789bc6.summary: Rejecting the necessity of action for liberty
5584a509-2e06-455c-96ae-6b8a50789bc6.content: {It is false that liberty requires the presence of action or decision}, {Liberty is defined by the absence of constraints, not by the presence of motivation or action}, {An individual can possess liberty even if they choose not to act due to apathy or indecision}, {The presence of liberty is independent of whether one exercises it}

6612b33f-3ddd-4e7a-89b2-29df63485258.summary: Supplementing with a focus on potentiality
6612b33f-3ddd-4e7a-89b2-29df63485258.content: {Liberty involves the potential to act without constraints, not the actualization of action}, {The absence of constraints ensures the potential for action, even if not realized}, {Apathy or indecision does not negate the potential for action, which is central to liberty}, {The focus on potentiality explains how liberty is present even without action}

7c5f9a91-5775-4793-a02a-b1662b1052b5.content: {Freedom is the ability to act according to one's own will}, {Self-determination involves making choices based on personal values and desires}, {Liberty is present when individuals can pursue their own goals without external interference}

a03cca55-09cc-433d-9aab-adf7f46287f6.content: {Freedom is the capacity for autonomous decision-making}, {Autonomy involves acting in accordance with one's own principles and reasoning}, {Liberty is present when individuals can govern themselves without coercion}

2b2f25d4-67c2-49c4-932c-c446abb9067d.content: {Freedom is the exercise of rational agency}, {Rational agency involves making decisions based on reason and reflection}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act in accordance with their rational deliberations}

f8bbbdc6-75e6-40ae-8291-cfe498984d61.content: {Freedom is the capacity for moral responsibility}, {Moral responsibility involves being accountable for one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make morally significant choices}

5460d74e-0171-4d5a-a3d2-c4f6eca75c2d.content: {Freedom is the possession of the power and resources to fulfill one's own potential}, {Positive liberty involves having the means to achieve personal goals}, {Liberty is present when individuals have the opportunity to develop and express themselves}

558b8eb0-7d07-4205-baee-ed9d2415e54a.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination by others}, {Non-domination involves not being subject to arbitrary interference}, {Liberty is present when individuals are protected from the will of others}

b0cbb909-51f4-44f3-af6b-8af499e0edc3.content: {Freedom is the capability to achieve valuable functionings}, {Capabilities involve having the real opportunities to do and be what one values}, {Liberty is present when individuals have the substantive freedoms to lead the kind of life they have reason to value}

4fce311e-4fb5-42de-b121-72bd3f197675.content: {Freedom is the process of self-realization}, {Self-realization involves achieving one's true potential and identity}, {Liberty is present when individuals can pursue their authentic selves}

c10cb575-9f0d-4c7b-a0fc-e0352248946d.content: {Freedom is the capacity for creative agency}, {Creative agency involves the ability to innovate and create new possibilities}, {Liberty is present when individuals can express their creativity without undue constraints}

fb833dc0-34c1-4880-b181-30550601f5be.content: {Freedom is the ability to participate in collective decision-making}, {Participatory liberty involves having a voice in the governance of one's community}, {Liberty is present when individuals can engage in democratic processes}

faf90b75-71f6-4017-a845-b4bd2f64f4c7.content: {There is a distinction between external constraints and internal constraints}, {Freedom as absence of constraints refers primarily to external constraints}, {Determinism is not an external constraint but a description of causal relations}, {The ability to have acted otherwise is not necessary for freedom from external constraints}

0c6ca155-6389-4303-a999-29fc3a8721df.summary: Rejecting the necessity of alternative possibilities
0c6ca155-6389-4303-a999-29fc3a8721df.content: {It is false that freedom requires the ability to have acted otherwise}, {Freedom can be understood as acting according to one's desires and intentions without external interference}, {Determinism does not prevent actions from aligning with one's desires and intentions}

6a2044d0-376a-4d6b-85de-64724c01cfa1.content: {Compatibilist freedom is the ability to act according to one's own motivations and reasons}, {Determinism is compatible with acting according to one's own motivations and reasons}, {Freedom as absence of constraints can be understood in a compatibilist sense, where determinism does not negate freedom}

97d0707d-224a-4da3-b57e-156e98c582ba.content: {Freedom is the capacity for self-governance}, {Autonomy involves making choices based on one's own values and reasons}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act according to their own rational deliberations}

86753465-e46b-49bb-a75c-b87a524889f7.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve one's true potential}, {Self-realization involves fulfilling one's capabilities and talents}, {Liberty is present when individuals can pursue personal growth and self-fulfillment}

62977c21-aa0d-4cbf-ae0d-7c5c2b38c092.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination by others}, {Domination involves being subject to the arbitrary will of another}, {Liberty is present when individuals are not vulnerable to interference by others}

fd1ea6dc-1b5b-420f-8e97-9cc05ddf0be9.content: {Freedom is the ability to act in pursuit of one's own goals}, {Positive liberty involves having the power and resources to fulfill one's own purposes}, {Liberty is present when individuals have the means to achieve their aims}

b622993d-4c3b-4909-948b-d6d057d88b01.content: {Freedom is the ability to act according to reason}, {Rational control involves aligning one's actions with rational deliberation}, {Liberty is present when individuals can govern their actions through rational thought}

3b10a5ee-2854-4f26-8e92-230abadd31c1.summary: Distinguishing between freedom and moral responsibility
3b10a5ee-2854-4f26-8e92-230abadd31c1.content: {There is a distinction between freedom and moral responsibility}, {Freedom as absence of constraints is a theory about the ability to act without barriers, not about accountability}, {Moral responsibility involves separate considerations about the rightness or wrongness of actions}, {The objection confuses the concept of freedom with the concept of moral responsibility}

e2779381-4a7f-463e-a76f-234e23c48608.summary: Rejecting the necessity of moral responsibility for freedom
e2779381-4a7f-463e-a76f-234e23c48608.content: {It is false that freedom necessarily requires consideration of moral responsibility}, {Freedom can be understood purely in terms of the absence of constraints without reference to moral accountability}, {The ability to act without barriers does not inherently involve being held accountable for those actions}

ea7e0ec9-15a9-4bc5-bd21-0c489a73568e.summary: Supplementing with a distinction between descriptive and normative freedom
ea7e0ec9-15a9-4bc5-bd21-0c489a73568e.content: {Freedom can be understood in both descriptive and normative terms}, {Descriptive freedom refers to the absence of constraints on action}, {Normative freedom involves considerations of moral responsibility and accountability}, {The theory of freedom as absence of constraints focuses on descriptive freedom, leaving normative considerations to a separate analysis}

65fddfac-4514-4c79-b129-4e946a4c2108.content: {Freedom is the capacity to choose among alternatives}, {The capacity to choose does not require rational deliberation}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can make choices based on their own preferences, whether rational or emotional}

2547b308-ebab-40d0-b1ac-52fbd1fcedaf.content: {Freedom is the ability to act in accordance with one's own values and desires}, {Autonomy involves self-governance and self-determination}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can pursue their own goals without external interference}

16897867-7a81-4b47-8acf-d5c0baf7c175.content: {Freedom is the absence of external constraints on action}, {Non-interference allows individuals to act according to their own will}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals are free from coercion and external control}

957e46e4-bbe4-4e9f-bd5b-265f96d68839.content: {Freedom is the ability to realize one's true potential}, {Self-realization involves acting in ways that fulfill one's nature and capacities}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can pursue personal growth and self-fulfillment}

2e82616d-9d09-44a2-ab3d-e6c95336f0a5.content: {Freedom involves acting for a variety of reasons, not just rational ones}, {Plurality of reasons includes emotional, instinctual, and rational motivations}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act based on a diverse set of motivations}

e36d5f6b-3940-4e9d-9092-0bef7eb6d216.content: {Freedom is the ability to express one's identity through action}, {Expressive agency involves acting in ways that reflect one's character and individuality}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can express themselves without constraint}

4fc543b4-604b-47a8-b0c3-d5dc056e98e3.content: {Freedom is the ability to create new possibilities through action}, {Creative agency involves innovation and originality in decision-making}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can generate novel actions and ideas}

68a3c175-e49e-47b4-9ec2-73aafccc2cfc.content: {Freedom is the ability to act based on one's emotions}, {Emotional agency involves making decisions influenced by feelings and passions}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act in accordance with their emotional states}

937ddcbc-6cca-45b8-a0e4-d5384cf668fd.content: {Freedom is the ability to endorse one's actions upon reflection}, {Reflective endorsement involves critically evaluating one's motivations and choices}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can reflectively affirm their actions}

639b3e5e-92ce-4753-b5bd-da0e9eec9a0c.content: {Freedom is the ability to choose actions appropriate to the context}, {Contextual choice involves understanding and responding to situational factors}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can adapt their actions to varying circumstances}

c9a1f7c2-3b0d-4030-8826-dcb88d0391c2.summary: Distinguishing between rational and non-rational actions
c9a1f7c2-3b0d-4030-8826-dcb88d0391c2.content: {There is a distinction between rational actions and non-rational actions such as emotional or instinctual actions}, {Freedom as rational control is a theory specifically about rational actions rather than all types of actions}, {Emotional and instinctual actions can be considered free in a different sense that does not involve rational control}, {The intuition that impulsive actions are free can be explained by recognizing a separate category of freedom for non-rational actions}

d298e6d8-20eb-45fa-a302-22101c174df2.summary: Rejecting the intuition that non-rational actions are free
d298e6d8-20eb-45fa-a302-22101c174df2.content: {It is mistaken to consider impulsive or emotional actions as instances of true freedom}, {True freedom involves the capacity to act according to reason and logical deliberation}, {The appearance of freedom in non-rational actions is an illusion, as they lack the element of rational control}

17a4a90d-b6ca-445f-bae7-3674917b6fff.summary: Supplementing with a broader conception of freedom
17a4a90d-b6ca-445f-bae7-3674917b6fff.content: {Freedom can be understood as having multiple dimensions, including rational and non-rational aspects}, {Rational control is one essential dimension of freedom, focusing on logical deliberation}, {Non-rational actions can be free in a different dimension that complements rational control}, {The objection loses its force when freedom is seen as a multi-faceted concept that includes both rational and non-rational elements}

92bb80e1-7ac1-410d-b46b-432f6cd3edca.content: {Freedom is the ability to act according to practical reason}, {Practical reason involves making decisions based on a combination of logic and context}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act in accordance with practical judgment}

ea439d9d-2472-4d89-a560-a95968b09835.content: {Freedom is the ability to act according to one's reflective endorsement}, {Reflective endorsement involves evaluating one's desires and motivations}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals act in accordance with their reflectively endorsed values}

2491803a-544f-4fc9-982b-9ebf168c98bd.content: {Freedom is the ability to act autonomously}, {Autonomy involves making decisions that are coherent with one's values and beliefs}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act in a way that is consistent with their own coherent set of values}

d6b7fd8d-dd35-4034-81f2-a985a0faa882.content: {Freedom is the ability to act according to emotional rationality}, {Emotional rationality involves integrating emotions into rational decision-making}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act in accordance with both rational and emotional considerations}
