26a98c6f-eab4-4cb0-9fe3-0245b23d4553.content: {Freedom is the ability to make reflective choices}, {Reflective choice involves considering one's options and potential consequences}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can make decisions based on reflection and deliberation}

a57d1e97-4fc9-45d7-988e-bf236bff13f2.summary: Freedom as the Exercise of Moral Agency
a57d1e97-4fc9-45d7-988e-bf236bff13f2.content: {Freedom is the exercise of moral agency}, {Moral agency involves acting in accordance with ethical principles and values}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act as moral agents, guided by their own ethical judgments}

bcdc3f3b-fadf-4c23-871e-bc31211aa57b.summary: Freedom as the Capacity for Creative Expression
bcdc3f3b-fadf-4c23-871e-bc31211aa57b.content: {Freedom is the capacity for creative expression}, {Creative expression involves the ability to innovate and create in various forms}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can express themselves creatively without undue restriction}

418a8a57-9dc2-46fd-855c-4e5c30ec5b32.summary: Freedom as the Ability to Choose Among Alternatives
418a8a57-9dc2-46fd-855c-4e5c30ec5b32.content: {Freedom is the ability to choose among alternatives}, {Choosing among alternatives involves having multiple options available for action}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can select from a range of possible actions}

f9c1ef01-cf3b-46ca-bd27-ee882c22d92f.summary: Freedom as the Power to Act in Accordance with One's Will
f9c1ef01-cf3b-46ca-bd27-ee882c22d92f.content: {Freedom is the power to act in accordance with one's will}, {Acting in accordance with one's will involves following one's own desires and intentions}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act based on their own volition}

35b30918-efd9-44eb-b6b0-33e0b31475ba.summary: Freedom as the Capacity for Rational and Irrational Action
35b30918-efd9-44eb-b6b0-33e0b31475ba.content: {Freedom is the capacity for rational and irrational action}, {Rational and irrational action involves the ability to act based on reason or contrary to it}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can choose to act rationally or irrationally}

66fa31c5-a9fb-4ff0-83ba-ab1552f77d49.summary: Distinguishing between rational capacity and rational action
66fa31c5-a9fb-4ff0-83ba-ab1552f77d49.content: {There is a distinction between having the capacity for rational control and always acting rationally}, {Freedom as rational control is about having the capacity to act according to reason, not necessarily doing so in every instance}, {A person can act irrationally while still possessing the capacity for rational deliberation}, {The intuition that irrational actions can be free is explained by the presence of rational capacity, even if not exercised}

2b1577b1-2ee4-4a32-ac4f-1c54b23aa798.summary: Rejecting the necessity of rationality for freedom
2b1577b1-2ee4-4a32-ac4f-1c54b23aa798.content: {It is false that freedom requires every action to be rational}, {Freedom involves the ability to choose, which includes the possibility of irrational choices}, {The capacity to act irrationally is consistent with the broader understanding of freedom as rational control}, {The intuition that freedom includes irrational actions is compatible with the theory when freedom is seen as the capacity for rational choice}

6f07214e-3426-4283-877a-4420031ffdbe.summary: Supplementing with the concept of rational potential
6f07214e-3426-4283-877a-4420031ffdbe.content: {Rational potential refers to the inherent ability to act according to reason, even if not always realized}, {Freedom as rational control includes the potential for rational action, not just actual rational actions}, {The presence of rational potential allows for freedom even in irrational actions}, {The intuition that freedom can involve irrational actions is explained by the underlying rational potential}

4d1a85eb-9a53-412d-a60f-dcac77d78e8d.content: {Freedom is the ability to act according to one's own will}, {Autonomous choice involves making decisions based on personal desires and preferences}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act in accordance with their own autonomous choices}

68c107a3-60a0-4332-9e8d-64729a781116.content: {Freedom is the absence of external constraints on action}, {Coercion involves being forced to act against one's will}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act without being coerced by others}

f0a6ee24-a1f6-4e9f-948f-589774a6a31b.content: {Freedom is the capacity for self-determination}, {Self-determination involves setting and pursuing one's own goals}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can determine their own actions and life paths}

54707a5c-a151-4b6c-ac4e-b009f9cf22b2.content: {Freedom is the absence of interference from others}, {Non-interference involves not being obstructed by others in one's actions}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act without interference from others}

40234f59-d5a6-4a26-a9f2-0b051e07d195.content: {Freedom is the capability to achieve valuable outcomes}, {Capability involves having the means and opportunities to pursue one's goals}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals have the capabilities to achieve what they value}

b0b47278-833b-408e-88ff-975c74dc706b.content: {Freedom is the ability to express one's identity through choices}, {Expressive choice involves making decisions that reflect one's personal identity}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can make choices that express their true selves}

aa872295-b20e-4d9d-b1ef-727cb1ba6623.content: {Freedom is having a plurality of options available}, {Plurality of options involves having multiple viable courses of action}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals have a wide range of options to choose from}

689a4cff-ce9f-467e-91d4-b5b230f79149.content: {Freedom is living authentically according to one's true self}, {Authenticity involves being true to one's own values and beliefs}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can live in a way that is authentic to themselves}

823260f4-451b-4d33-8d05-820fe9115d58.content: {Freedom is the empowerment to act effectively}, {Empowerment involves having the resources and confidence to pursue one's goals}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals are empowered to act as they choose}

351cf644-0ede-4f26-9e06-ac675a70cb09.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's potential}, {Self-realization involves achieving personal growth and fulfillment}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can realize their full potential}

5181bbcf-6d2e-4284-9724-7ed4e7e70f1e.summary: Distinguishing between rational and non-rational liberty
5181bbcf-6d2e-4284-9724-7ed4e7e70f1e.content: {There is a distinction between rational liberty and non-rational liberty}, {Freedom as rational control is a theory about rational liberty rather than non-rational liberty}, {Acting on impulse can be a form of non-rational liberty but does not constitute rational liberty}, {The intuition that impulsive actions can be free is explained by recognizing them as non-rational liberty}, {Rational liberty specifically requires actions to be guided by reason and logical deliberation}

5f06eefc-3f22-4b52-9969-aff0aefb7012.summary: Rejecting the intuition that liberty can be achieved without rational judgment
5f06eefc-3f22-4b52-9969-aff0aefb7012.content: {It is false that liberty can be achieved without rational judgment}, {Liberty, in the context of rational control, inherently involves acting according to reason}, {The appearance of liberty in impulsive actions is a misinterpretation of what constitutes true liberty}, {True liberty requires the capacity for rational deliberation and decision-making}

21026586-5b34-459a-924c-b593a87a3671.content: {Liberty can involve supplementary conditions beyond rational judgment}, {Rational control is one aspect of liberty, but other conditions such as autonomy and absence of coercion can also contribute to liberty}, {The appearance of liberty in impulsive actions can be explained by these supplementary conditions}, {Rational judgment is a necessary but not sufficient condition for liberty in the fullest sense}

37daf372-dc47-49da-abfa-56908906a8e7.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act according to one's own will}, {Autonomy involves making decisions based on personal values and desires}, {Liberty is present when individuals can pursue their own goals without external constraints}

51dd3e6c-c197-4ac5-bf8e-665af4751c1e.content: {Freedom is the ability to determine one's own actions}, {Self-determination involves having control over one's life choices}, {Liberty is present when individuals can shape their own destinies without interference}

93c69d39-6ea5-4a78-8f93-e762628a8525.content: {Freedom is the absence of external coercion}, {Coercion involves being forced to act against one's will}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act without being compelled by others}

3e01b600-c209-4403-a0b3-9f71eed379c4.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act as a rational agent}, {Rational agency involves making decisions based on reason and reflection}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act in accordance with their rational deliberations}

f1fe2b7f-bf33-4d66-b063-c348a37569da.content: {Freedom is having the opportunity to act}, {Opportunity involves having the means and resources to pursue one's goals}, {Liberty is present when individuals have access to the necessary conditions to achieve their aims}

5a6084a2-139c-4b15-8120-43f476791045.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination by others}, {Non-domination involves not being subject to arbitrary power}, {Liberty is present when individuals are free from the control of others}

075fc9bd-2783-4aa7-9004-d9457fe4128e.content: {Freedom is the capability to achieve valuable outcomes}, {Capability involves having the ability to realize one's potential}, {Liberty is present when individuals can pursue what they have reason to value}

ae9d2de8-8e2b-461a-96f6-6f5e0b711446.content: {Freedom is the ability to maintain personal integrity}, {Personal integrity involves acting in accordance with one's own principles}, {Liberty is present when individuals can live authentically without compromising their values}

4dd09e1d-7dc6-4c70-814d-57066b930087.content: {Freedom is the capacity for creative expression}, {Creative expression involves the ability to innovate and create}, {Liberty is present when individuals can express themselves freely through their actions}

513c7ad4-7542-47d3-b7a4-d3d341c2578e.content: {Freedom is the process of self-realization}, {Self-realization involves fulfilling one's potential and aspirations}, {Liberty is present when individuals can pursue personal growth and development}

3bf764f0-f6e7-48f2-8d28-a4ae32f96b6b.summary: Distinguishing between freedom and moral accountability
3bf764f0-f6e7-48f2-8d28-a4ae32f96b6b.content: {There is a distinction between freedom and moral accountability}, {Freedom as moral responsibility is a theory about the capacity to act with moral responsibility, not about every instance of free action}, {A person can act freely in a general sense without being morally accountable in specific situations like coercion or ignorance}, {The intuition that someone is free even when not morally responsible can be explained by separating the general capacity for moral responsibility from specific instances of action}

d49947ea-83a7-4430-9fdc-9de90193a440.summary: Rejecting the intuition that freedom is independent of moral responsibility
d49947ea-83a7-4430-9fdc-9de90193a440.content: {It is mistaken to think that freedom can exist without moral responsibility}, {Freedom involves the capacity to align actions with moral principles, which inherently includes moral responsibility}, {The appearance of freedom in cases of coercion or ignorance is an illusion, as true freedom requires the ability to be morally accountable}

e8e308c9-1949-4c0f-8ba8-026a30881577.summary: Supplementing with a distinction between types of freedom
e8e308c9-1949-4c0f-8ba8-026a30881577.content: {There is a distinction between basic freedom and moral freedom}, {Basic freedom refers to the ability to act without external constraints, while moral freedom involves acting with moral responsibility}, {In scenarios of coercion or ignorance, a person may have basic freedom but lacks moral freedom}, {The objection loses its force when recognizing that moral freedom, not basic freedom, is the focus of the theory}

0e1332fa-911a-49d6-8a3f-68cea413b1c1.summary: Freedom as Capacity for Rational Choice
0e1332fa-911a-49d6-8a3f-68cea413b1c1.content: {Freedom is the capacity to make rational choices}, {Rational choice involves selecting actions based on reason and understanding}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that align with rational principles}

f6be19a7-81cd-408b-920f-f7a7e92fbb44.content: {Freedom is the capacity for self-governance}, {Autonomy involves making decisions independently of external control}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that reflect their own values and desires}

b972cf4c-74ce-46ee-958e-9dfbb22ed603.content: {Freedom is the absence of coercion}, {Coercion involves being forced to act against one's will}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices without external pressure or force}

ea3a365b-bf8e-4153-a1e8-d7d2315b2102.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act authentically}, {Authenticity involves acting in accordance with one's true self}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that reflect their genuine character and beliefs}

0f6a53d5-8f54-4390-b103-d96eba4af30d.content: {Freedom is the capacity for self-determination}, {Self-determination involves directing one's own life}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that shape their own future}

0e859e4e-682a-4fb0-985f-03c308be297c.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {Domination involves being subject to arbitrary interference by others}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices without being dominated by others}

ca9540ba-bcae-499d-9cc3-12395adc959e.content: {Freedom is the capacity to achieve valuable outcomes}, {Capability involves having the means to pursue goals}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that lead to fulfilling their potential}

a19f9f95-3d1d-4c49-823e-2dddef7185b3.content: {Freedom is the availability of opportunities}, {Opportunity involves having options to choose from}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices from a range of possibilities}

ed25bd54-2a49-47f3-a029-9e6160aef80c.content: {Freedom is the capacity to give informed consent}, {Consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions voluntarily}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that they have willingly agreed to}

2d165786-d700-4947-90eb-78aa95a4896e.content: {Freedom is the capacity to flourish}, {Flourishing involves living a fulfilling and meaningful life}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that contribute to their well-being}

19fc3eb2-e286-4264-b12c-eca318100934.summary: Distinguishing between moral and social accountability
19fc3eb2-e286-4264-b12c-eca318100934.content: {There is a distinction between moral responsibility and social or legal accountability}, {Freedom as moral responsibility is a theory about moral accountability rather than social or legal accountability}, {Accountability based on social or legal norms does not require moral responsibility in the relevant moral sense}, {The intuition that accountability can exist without moral responsibility can be explained as confusion between moral and social or legal accountability}

a2452f8b-5f61-4f28-a388-f46109e7feef.summary: Rejecting the necessity of social norms for moral accountability
a2452f8b-5f61-4f28-a388-f46109e7feef.content: {It is false that accountability based on social or legal norms is sufficient for moral responsibility}, {Moral responsibility requires an internal capacity to align actions with moral principles, which is not guaranteed by social or legal norms}, {The appearance that accountability can exist without moral responsibility is due to conflating external norms with internal moral capacities}

8cff28fa-b54d-495b-a81e-bccf11bf4418.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of intrinsic moral capacity
8cff28fa-b54d-495b-a81e-bccf11bf4418.content: {Moral responsibility involves an intrinsic capacity to understand and act upon moral principles}, {This intrinsic capacity is necessary for true accountability, beyond social or legal norms}, {The objection loses its force when considering that true accountability requires this intrinsic moral capacity, which is not addressed by social or legal norms alone}

aadc048f-3f4e-4a04-b109-ff63f1f2b15e.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act autonomously}, {Autonomy involves making choices based on one's own values and reasoning}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices without external coercion}

fe19c84e-fc0d-40d5-a54e-e9a7cb2fea49.content: {Freedom is the absence of interference from others}, {Non-interference involves not being subject to the will of others}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act without being hindered by external forces}

d26d04cc-7fe9-4941-8ddb-81de8b3bd955.content: {Freedom is the ability to determine one's own actions}, {Self-determination involves having control over one's life choices}, {Liberty is present when individuals can pursue their own goals without external imposition}

abebdb35-d639-4773-aad6-df1fb6b802e4.content: {Freedom is the capability to achieve desired outcomes}, {Capability involves having the means and opportunities to pursue one's goals}, {Liberty is present when individuals have the resources and opportunities to act}

271c7728-36da-4990-bb46-5791858ee46a.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act as a rational agent}, {Rational agency involves making decisions based on reason and reflection}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act according to their rational deliberations}

291b2a47-64fa-4a51-a2f7-63200b5a4bcc.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination by others}, {Domination involves being subject to arbitrary power}, {Liberty is present when individuals are not under the control of others' arbitrary will}

9e90387a-089c-48f1-a60c-fef551468240.content: {Freedom is the ability to express one's identity through choices}, {Expressive choice involves making decisions that reflect one's personal identity}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that express who they are}

b390969d-b764-4b5c-bec9-fd90646953be.content: {Freedom is the empowerment to act effectively}, {Empowerment involves having the skills and confidence to pursue one's goals}, {Liberty is present when individuals are empowered to make meaningful choices}

6bfa913d-2115-4e04-963a-93b0f4011ca6.content: {Freedom is having a plurality of options available}, {Plurality of options involves having multiple viable choices}, {Liberty is present when individuals have a range of options to choose from}

8bf3cacd-6a0f-4614-bacc-426b825b802e.content: {Freedom is the absence of constraints on action}, {Non-constraint involves not being limited by external barriers}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act without being constrained by external factors}

3fc25aa3-8e31-4c21-87dd-b64f67b5ecb7.summary: Distinguishing between moral and non-moral freedom
3fc25aa3-8e31-4c21-87dd-b64f67b5ecb7.content: {There is a distinction between moral freedom and non-moral freedom}, {Freedom as moral responsibility is a theory about moral freedom rather than non-moral freedom}, {An individual can be free in a non-moral sense even if their actions do not align with moral principles}, {The intuition that liberty requires moral alignment can be explained as a confusion between moral and non-moral freedom}

17bb84ee-c777-4925-ba6b-487532d1170d.summary: Rejecting the necessity of moral alignment for freedom
17bb84ee-c777-4925-ba6b-487532d1170d.content: {It is false that liberty requires alignment with moral principles}, {An individual can be morally responsible even if their choices do not align with moral principles}, {Moral responsibility involves accountability, which can exist independently of moral alignment}

1af78fd2-495a-40af-9a66-ce8b97adca97.summary: Supplementing with the concept of moral potential
1af78fd2-495a-40af-9a66-ce8b97adca97.content: {Moral potential refers to the capacity to align with moral principles in the future}, {Freedom as moral responsibility includes the potential to align with moral principles, not just current alignment}, {An individual can be free if they have the potential to align with moral principles, even if they currently do not}

6fa6df1f-dcfa-4fbf-adb5-351961dadfff.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act with moral responsibility}, {Moral responsibility involves being accountable for one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that align with moral principles}, {Moral responsibility does not require the capacity to act otherwise}, {Determinism is compatible with moral responsibility}

6d31ebd3-f949-41aa-a0ca-ff407b45683e.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act with moral responsibility}, {Moral responsibility involves being accountable for one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that align with moral principles}, {Moral responsibility requires responsiveness to reasons}, {An individual is morally responsible if they can recognize and react to moral reasons}

f0f51497-4ab5-4fe5-bd5a-48c08ad2cfeb.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act with moral responsibility}, {Moral responsibility involves being accountable for one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that align with moral principles}, {Moral responsibility requires being the source of one's actions}, {An individual is morally responsible if their actions originate from their own motivations and character}

43a4b673-47bf-4b46-ad04-e125d8f4474c.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act with moral responsibility}, {Moral responsibility involves being accountable for one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that align with moral principles}, {Moral responsibility requires reflective endorsement of one's actions}, {An individual is morally responsible if they can reflectively endorse their motivations and actions}

20d1b8b6-c92e-4539-905c-1c5740591a19.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act with moral responsibility}, {Moral responsibility involves being accountable for one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that align with moral principles}, {Moral responsibility requires a historical process of character formation}, {An individual is morally responsible if their character has been formed through a process of rational reflection and choice}

bb8f060f-d359-4112-9026-92e56177fc10.summary: Distinguishing between moral responsibility and alternative possibilities
bb8f060f-d359-4112-9026-92e56177fc10.content: {There is a distinction between moral responsibility and the capacity to act otherwise}, {Freedom as moral responsibility is a theory about accountability, not about alternative possibilities}, {A person can be morally responsible even if they could not have acted otherwise due to determinism}, {The intuition that moral responsibility requires alternative possibilities can be explained as a confusion between accountability and the ability to choose differently}

eb457b3e-c573-4330-a85f-04532327cd86.summary: Rejecting the necessity of alternative possibilities for moral responsibility
eb457b3e-c573-4330-a85f-04532327cd86.content: {It is false that moral responsibility requires the capacity to act otherwise}, {Moral responsibility is about being accountable for one's actions, not about having multiple options}, {The appearance that alternative possibilities are necessary for moral responsibility can be explained by a misunderstanding of what accountability entails}

482f0bb9-2a29-4074-9918-9647d28853ad.summary: Explaining moral responsibility through the principle of actual sequence
482f0bb9-2a29-4074-9918-9647d28853ad.content: {Moral responsibility can be explained by the actual sequence of events leading to an action}, {The capacity to act otherwise is not necessary if the actual sequence reflects the agent's values and intentions}, {The intuition that alternative possibilities are required can be addressed by focusing on the actual sequence and its alignment with moral principles}

12f318e8-c793-488c-8e4e-26604ca0b092.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act with moral responsibility}, {Moral responsibility involves being accountable for one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that align with moral principles}, {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {Determinism does not negate the ability to act according to one's desires}

8e59d288-42a9-4f5e-80c7-4a2b2abfa769.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act with moral responsibility}, {Moral responsibility involves being accountable for one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that align with moral principles}, {Freedom requires the ability to act according to rational deliberation}, {Rational deliberation is compatible with determinism}

f4f61796-8380-496c-a292-fab3eb6d801b.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act with moral responsibility}, {Moral responsibility involves being accountable for one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that align with moral principles}, {Freedom involves acting in accordance with higher-order desires}, {Higher-order desires can be determined by one's character and values}

e49eafdd-39ec-4a25-8973-d8f759df6477.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act with moral responsibility}, {Moral responsibility involves being accountable for one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that align with moral principles}, {Freedom involves responsiveness to reasons}, {Responsiveness to reasons is compatible with determinism}

37b6040d-662e-470b-9e7e-8d48a649ab73.summary: Freedom as Moral Responsibility with Sourcehood
37b6040d-662e-470b-9e7e-8d48a649ab73.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act with moral responsibility}, {Moral responsibility involves being accountable for one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that align with moral principles}, {Freedom requires being the source of one's actions}, {Being the source of one's actions is compatible with determinism}

75161af1-44b4-4b52-a584-e09bdf881761.summary: Distinguishing between different senses of freedom
75161af1-44b4-4b52-a584-e09bdf881761.content: {There is a distinction between freedom as moral responsibility and freedom as metaphysical indeterminism}, {Freedom as moral responsibility is concerned with the capacity to act according to moral principles, not with the metaphysical nature of determinism}, {Determinism does not negate the ability to act according to one's desires in the context of moral responsibility}, {The objection confuses metaphysical freedom with moral freedom}

1550d1e8-913a-4418-a820-e472196e418a.summary: Rejecting the necessity of indeterminism for moral responsibility
1550d1e8-913a-4418-a820-e472196e418a.content: {It is false that indeterminism is necessary for moral responsibility}, {Moral responsibility can exist even if actions are determined, as long as individuals can act according to their desires and moral principles}, {The capacity to align actions with moral principles is sufficient for freedom as moral responsibility}

7a365a2b-4924-489e-aa6e-ecf577fd759b.summary: Supplementing with the concept of compatibilism
7a365a2b-4924-489e-aa6e-ecf577fd759b.content: {Compatibilism is the view that freedom and determinism are compatible}, {Freedom as moral responsibility can be understood within a compatibilist framework}, {Under compatibilism, individuals can be morally responsible even if their actions are determined}, {The objection loses its force when freedom is interpreted through a compatibilist lens}

e582a395-4cff-4db8-a328-d3e3edefb67f.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act in accordance with one's desires and intentions}, {Moral responsibility involves being accountable for one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that align with their desires and intentions}

9e2b049e-ebe2-4b16-adcf-a0ed4864331e.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act based on rational deliberation}, {Moral responsibility involves being accountable for actions that result from rational deliberation}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that are the result of rational deliberation}

9c8c553e-c863-493a-b97e-e9a155ca649e.content: {Freedom is the capacity to reflectively endorse one's motivations}, {Moral responsibility involves being accountable for actions that one reflectively endorses}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that they reflectively endorse}

53dc7b44-53d2-4277-b279-877444875107.content: {Freedom is the capacity to respond to reasons}, {Moral responsibility involves being accountable for actions that are responsive to reasons}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that are responsive to reasons}

cdaba7f0-7e50-40a5-86cb-a5e05bc09cb2.content: {Freedom is the capacity to control one's actions through higher-order desires}, {Moral responsibility involves being accountable for actions that align with higher-order desires}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that align with their higher-order desires}

a65329dc-88b8-4001-9d94-788e83b502d7.content: {Freedom is the capacity to express one's coherent self}, {Moral responsibility involves being accountable for actions that express one's coherent self}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that express their coherent self}

3576c29a-be3a-4991-9423-6cb5519ccb2f.content: {Freedom is the capacity to understand and act upon normative reasons}, {Moral responsibility involves being accountable for actions that are based on normative reasons}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices based on their understanding of normative reasons}

152651d3-3f04-4042-a623-62a8136407ac.content: {Freedom is the capacity to govern oneself according to one's own principles}, {Moral responsibility involves being accountable for actions governed by one's own principles}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices governed by their own principles}

e8cd0a25-053c-4c63-8bde-b5f5f8de808a.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act according to practical rationality}, {Moral responsibility involves being accountable for actions that follow from practical rationality}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that are guided by practical rationality}

3a9c0db5-b484-434f-be05-f312b62b1b73.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act as an integrated agent}, {Moral responsibility involves being accountable for actions that result from integrated agency}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices as integrated agents}

942ed1b2-87bc-4a6e-8831-5d81b51c8d73.content: {There is a distinction between metaphysical freedom and moral freedom}, {Freedom as moral responsibility is concerned with moral freedom rather than metaphysical freedom}, {Moral responsibility can be compatible with determinism if it pertains to moral freedom}, {The intuition that moral responsibility requires metaphysical freedom can be explained by conflating these two types of freedom}

688c94c5-6c8c-4e6a-bf3d-b67373c3cb25.summary: Rejecting the necessity of metaphysical freedom for moral responsibility
688c94c5-6c8c-4e6a-bf3d-b67373c3cb25.content: {It is false that moral responsibility requires metaphysical freedom}, {Moral responsibility can be grounded in the ability to respond to reasons, which does not necessitate metaphysical freedom}, {The appearance that free will is necessary for moral responsibility can be explained by the mistaken belief that determinism precludes reason-responsiveness}

dad6e5c4-58b3-4ef8-a9ae-b4cbb6fcf5f5.content: {Compatibilism is the view that free will and determinism are compatible}, {Under compatibilism, moral responsibility can exist even if determinism is true}, {The intuition that moral responsibility requires free will can be reconciled with determinism by adopting a compatibilist framework}

81cc3dad-6072-4a5d-9cfd-32c036a60779.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act autonomously}, {Autonomy involves making choices based on one's own reasoning and values}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices without external coercion}

c7dbc361-69cc-4300-b8ff-c5ff491b2213.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act as a rational agent}, {Rational agency involves making decisions based on reason and deliberation}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices guided by rational deliberation}

0d521bde-5fb2-498e-b553-e28a5b13fdc9.content: {Freedom is the capacity for self-determination}, {Self-determination involves making choices that reflect one's own desires and goals}, {Liberty is present when individuals can pursue their own goals without external interference}

56a4710d-2afa-4140-ba45-a1b5c32112dd.content: {Freedom is the absence of coercion}, {Coercion involves being forced to act against one's will}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act according to their own will without being coerced}

69c33e4a-c992-4557-8c49-93a26274cb0f.content: {Freedom is the capacity for personal sovereignty}, {Personal sovereignty involves having control over one's own life and decisions}, {Liberty is present when individuals have control over their own actions and decisions}

c288a137-324b-4e6c-bc7f-fe74c2107956.content: {Freedom is the capacity for choice}, {The capacity for choice involves the ability to select among alternatives}, {Liberty is present when individuals can choose among different options without constraint}

61a41314-ad5e-4812-b057-4ce6abfbb188.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {Domination involves being subject to the arbitrary will of another}, {Liberty is present when individuals are not subject to the arbitrary will of others}

c5697401-1c6d-415f-8ec5-89625d633e20.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act according to practical reason}, {Practical reason involves making decisions based on practical considerations and reasoning}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act according to their practical reasoning}

134d2766-23aa-4271-897d-100c16ab5ca0.content: {Freedom is the capacity for self-governance}, {Self-governance involves governing oneself according to one's own rules and principles}, {Liberty is present when individuals can govern themselves without external imposition}

7dfa9a2e-fc47-4898-8712-bd46793a4887.content: {Freedom is the capacity for authenticity}, {Authenticity involves acting in accordance with one's true self and values}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act in ways that are true to themselves}

bc79ab09-acbe-46af-9b1c-ad5356412525.summary: Distinguishing between liberty and moral liberty
bc79ab09-acbe-46af-9b1c-ad5356412525.content: {There is a distinction between general liberty and moral liberty}, {Freedom as moral responsibility is a theory about moral liberty rather than general liberty}, {Liberty in the absence of moral principles is not moral liberty}, {The intuition that liberty is present without moral principles can be explained as confusion between general liberty and moral liberty}

7bad98f6-1a0c-4fc3-a67b-06daf14f107a.summary: Rejecting the intuition that liberty can exist without moral principles
7bad98f6-1a0c-4fc3-a67b-06daf14f107a.content: {It is false that liberty is present when choices are made without reference to moral principles}, {Liberty, in the context of moral responsibility, inherently requires alignment with moral principles}, {The presence of liberty without moral principles is a misunderstanding of the concept of moral liberty}

eafba0f7-4a98-4816-95c6-7490831a9da1.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of implicit moral frameworks
eafba0f7-4a98-4816-95c6-7490831a9da1.content: {Even in the absence of explicit moral principles, individuals operate within implicit moral frameworks}, {Liberty as moral responsibility assumes the presence of these implicit frameworks}, {The appearance of liberty without moral principles is explained by the presence of unarticulated moral norms}

bc8b04a7-da90-4c84-b698-d342c15cf453.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act with moral autonomy}, {Moral autonomy involves making decisions based on one's own moral principles}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that reflect their personal moral convictions}

2a55a1a6-12c7-45ea-ac09-320a9cac05de.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act as a rational agent}, {Rational agency involves making decisions based on reason and reflection}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that are informed by rational deliberation}

7fd4951a-2e33-41a7-b0c4-9afbafd366b1.content: {Freedom is the capacity to make authentic choices}, {Authentic choice involves acting in accordance with one's true self}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that express their genuine desires and values}

9d2a993b-dc3b-40c3-a4c3-ebe6d7d7086d.content: {Freedom is the capacity for self-determination}, {Self-determination involves controlling one's own life and decisions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that determine their own path}

1bc822d2-e6a9-42f9-a0ee-f1ea67db530b.content: {Freedom is the capacity for volitional control}, {Volitional control involves the ability to govern one's own actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that are under their own volitional control}

ddec7c11-7922-4e08-9221-1a38902ff335.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act with moral integrity}, {Moral integrity involves consistency between one's actions and moral beliefs}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that maintain their moral integrity}

0c6909df-d7ad-4834-9624-2ea81870e7c6.content: {Freedom is the capacity for ethical deliberation}, {Ethical deliberation involves considering moral principles in decision-making}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that result from ethical deliberation}

427e51e2-ad5e-48b9-8318-0751792cd615.content: {Freedom is the capacity for personal responsibility}, {Personal responsibility involves being answerable for one's own actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that reflect personal responsibility}

2380fc08-6a11-4f83-ad3f-fc7b9e2cf154.content: {Freedom is the capacity for moral self-governance}, {Moral self-governance involves regulating one's actions according to moral standards}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that align with moral self-governance}

bdf8f6cc-a550-4836-9ecf-c3ef66ed66c3.content: {Freedom is the capacity for value-driven action}, {Value-driven action involves acting in accordance with one's values}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that are driven by their values}

758b1494-8bb5-4f65-9c03-1464d9726f7d.summary: Distinguishing between moral and legal accountability
758b1494-8bb5-4f65-9c03-1464d9726f7d.content: {There is a distinction between moral accountability and legal or social accountability}, {Freedom as moral responsibility is a theory about moral accountability rather than legal or social accountability}, {Legal or social systems can hold individuals accountable without moral considerations, but this does not undermine the concept of moral responsibility}, {The intuition that accountability can be purely legal or social can be explained as a confusion between moral accountability and legal or social accountability}

cf7fd352-9f19-4b0e-9f37-f0f9430f8956.summary: Rejecting the sufficiency of legal or social accountability
cf7fd352-9f19-4b0e-9f37-f0f9430f8956.content: {It is false that accountability can be purely legal or social without involving moral responsibility}, {Legal or social accountability without moral responsibility is insufficient for true accountability}, {Moral responsibility is necessary for genuine accountability, as it involves being accountable for one's actions in a morally significant way}

b4e306d1-00eb-4aa8-867b-8ace87f41e9a.summary: Supplementing with the necessity of moral principles
b4e306d1-00eb-4aa8-867b-8ace87f41e9a.content: {Moral responsibility requires the alignment of actions with moral principles}, {Legal or social accountability can exist without moral considerations, but true freedom involves moral responsibility}, {The presence of moral principles is necessary to transform legal or social accountability into genuine moral accountability}

ac851db7-c6ec-4be8-9302-03b4a10c542c.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act with moral accountability}, {Moral accountability involves being answerable for one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that align with moral values}

56b3e421-5371-4fcb-b7f5-9a5727dfe2ce.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act with moral autonomy}, {Moral autonomy involves self-governance in accordance with moral principles}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that reflect their own moral reasoning}

7b22232f-0383-4b65-ae98-575149e91555.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act as a moral agent}, {Moral agency involves the ability to make decisions based on moral considerations}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that are informed by moral understanding}

4763c876-2962-4d8b-be25-793a73830619.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act with moral integrity}, {Moral integrity involves consistency between one's actions and moral beliefs}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that are consistent with their moral convictions}

b188db04-8674-4f06-a2de-2723bcea272f.content: {Freedom is the capacity to engage in moral deliberation}, {Moral deliberation involves thoughtful consideration of moral principles in decision-making}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices after reflecting on moral values}

c576e82b-8ddf-4d68-84a4-52e1a6119c66.summary: Distinguishing between internal and external freedom
c576e82b-8ddf-4d68-84a4-52e1a6119c66.content: {There is a distinction between internal freedom and external freedom}, {Freedom as moral responsibility is a theory about internal freedom rather than external freedom}, {External constraints like laws or social norms do not negate internal freedom if individuals can still act with moral responsibility}, {The intuition that freedom requires absence of external constraints can be explained as a confusion between internal and external freedom}

3dc54382-7ed2-4495-a7b8-b5bd837404ac.summary: Rejecting the intuition that external constraints negate freedom
3dc54382-7ed2-4495-a7b8-b5bd837404ac.content: {It is false that external constraints like laws or social norms inherently negate freedom}, {Moral responsibility can be maintained even in the presence of external constraints}, {The presence of external constraints does not necessarily prevent individuals from making morally responsible choices}

f85a6254-7e66-4273-8990-ed103d64a78b.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of rational autonomy
f85a6254-7e66-4273-8990-ed103d64a78b.content: {Rational autonomy involves the ability to make decisions based on reason and moral principles}, {Freedom as moral responsibility assumes rational autonomy, which can coexist with external constraints}, {External constraints do not undermine freedom if individuals can still exercise rational autonomy in their decision-making}

b5604288-b3c6-4fb4-a15d-a2096157bae0.summary: Freedom as Capacity for Rational Choice
b5604288-b3c6-4fb4-a15d-a2096157bae0.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act based on rational deliberation}, {Rational deliberation involves weighing reasons for and against actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that are informed by rational deliberation}

3a466735-2676-44a6-a2d2-1abb10bd984d.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act autonomously}, {Autonomy involves acting according to one's own values and principles}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that reflect their authentic selves}

0108f430-8ec2-4ff9-a5de-43de8e880f86.content: {Freedom is the absence of coercion in decision-making}, {Coercion involves external forces compelling an individual to act against their will}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices free from external compulsion}

ce82b0c5-4d72-45c6-8f17-5ff6c98b4c01.content: {Freedom is the capacity for self-determination}, {Self-determination involves the ability to set and pursue one's own goals}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that align with their personal goals}

6f902354-6ef3-43b4-a551-79c5ed85e0dc.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act as a moral agent}, {Moral agency involves the ability to discern right from wrong}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that reflect their moral judgments}

55759886-8e8c-4c75-b8fc-13c75d2115d9.content: {Freedom is the capacity for volitional control over one's actions}, {Volitional control involves the ability to initiate and regulate one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that are under their volitional control}

e4034744-79b0-4225-9557-acefba9c9cbe.content: {Freedom is the capacity for reflective endorsement of one's actions}, {Reflective endorsement involves critically evaluating and affirming one's motivations}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that they reflectively endorse}

0c1ecc37-0561-4c5b-8751-0d56cc689fd2.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act according to practical reason}, {Practical reason involves reasoning about how to act in pursuit of one's ends}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices guided by practical reason}

d563f8c3-5934-415a-bf62-16385e492b09.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act with personal integrity}, {Personal integrity involves consistency between one's actions and values}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that maintain their personal integrity}

b48307d4-263f-496b-b7db-873233522bed.content: {Freedom is the capacity for self-governance}, {Self-governance involves the ability to regulate one's conduct according to one's own rules}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices that reflect self-governance}

e224ff15-4c4c-4d54-a7fa-d4d37cd87517.summary: Distinguishing between knowledge and understanding of moral principles
e224ff15-4c4c-4d54-a7fa-d4d37cd87517.content: {There is a distinction between knowledge and understanding of moral principles}, {Moral responsibility requires an understanding of moral principles rather than explicit knowledge}, {A person can be morally responsible if they have an implicit understanding of moral principles even if they lack explicit knowledge}, {The intuition that someone can be responsible without knowledge is explained by their implicit understanding}

92f9bc87-f85c-4217-8d41-b5ad83a3a698.summary: Rejecting the intuition that ignorance negates moral responsibility
92f9bc87-f85c-4217-8d41-b5ad83a3a698.content: {It is false that ignorance of moral principles always negates moral responsibility}, {Moral responsibility can be attributed based on the capacity to understand moral principles, not actual knowledge}, {The scenario where someone is held responsible despite ignorance can be explained by their potential to understand moral principles}

c88739b0-2b63-4998-a8de-d3c8c37d1d8b.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of innate moral understanding
c88739b0-2b63-4998-a8de-d3c8c37d1d8b.content: {Humans have an innate moral understanding that guides their actions}, {Moral responsibility is based on this innate understanding rather than explicit knowledge of moral principles}, {The appearance of responsibility without knowledge is explained by the presence of innate moral understanding}

9170f01a-d45d-42e1-9c04-5aaa40b2f894.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {Domination involves having power over someone that can be exercised arbitrarily}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}

75c0f318-10bc-4f9e-95d6-b873afc5e153.content: {Freedom is the ability to realize one's true self}, {Self-realization involves acting in accordance with one's authentic desires and values}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can pursue their own conception of the good life}

aa5348e8-1d7f-4bbd-b21f-5ac7031d8386.content: {Freedom is the capacity for self-governance}, {Autonomy involves making decisions based on one's own reasoning and values}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act according to their own rational deliberations}

2a50b057-53b6-424e-9216-ebd9e1230bb7.summary: Freedom as Non-Interference with Critical Interests
2a50b057-53b6-424e-9216-ebd9e1230bb7.content: {Freedom is the absence of interference with critical interests}, {Critical interests are those that are essential for a person's well-being}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can pursue their essential interests without interference}

7bbd7921-de5d-4d87-81d4-44aa96e6fab3.content: {Freedom is the ability to act on one's own choices}, {Empowerment involves having the resources and opportunities to pursue one's goals}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals have the means to act on their decisions}

ce5476bd-a658-4be1-b295-8ff608f6e588.content: {There is a distinction between coercion and influence}, {Coercion involves direct compulsion against one's will, while influence does not}, {Freedom as absence of coercion is concerned with the absence of direct compulsion, not with social influences}, {Social pressures do not constitute coercion if they do not force someone to act against their will}

00c6d1e3-e5fd-462e-b732-8ee2f28380a0.summary: Rejecting the intuition that social pressures undermine freedom
00c6d1e3-e5fd-462e-b732-8ee2f28380a0.content: {It is mistaken to equate social pressures with coercion}, {Social pressures do not force individuals to act against their will}, {Liberty is maintained as long as individuals are not compelled by others, regardless of social pressures}, {The presence of social pressures does not negate the absence of coercion}

edb1aa5a-d7e2-40e0-be47-7bcef7ea147c.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of personal autonomy
edb1aa5a-d7e2-40e0-be47-7bcef7ea147c.content: {Personal autonomy involves the capacity to reflect on and endorse one's desires}, {Freedom as absence of coercion assumes individuals have the autonomy to assess social pressures}, {With personal autonomy, individuals can distinguish between personal desires and social influences}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals autonomously choose in the absence of coercion}

ad0e1052-cee3-4919-937c-750c53547a20.summary: Freedom as Absence of External and Internal Coercion
ad0e1052-cee3-4919-937c-750c53547a20.content: {Freedom is the absence of coercion}, {Coercion involves forcing someone to act against their will}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can make choices without being compelled by others}, {Freedom requires the absence of internal compulsions such as addictions or phobias}

0b5051c3-38aa-42c7-a729-98886ab31b24.content: {Freedom is the ability to act according to one's own will}, {Autonomy involves self-governance and self-determination}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can make choices based on their own values and desires}, {Freedom requires the absence of both external coercion and internal compulsions}

593ce01b-05fb-4078-98fb-a6c23cff397b.content: {Freedom is the capacity to make rational choices}, {Rational self-determination involves acting in accordance with reason}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can make choices that align with their rational interests}, {Freedom requires the absence of external coercion and the ability to overcome internal compulsions through reason}

7ebad3d8-b438-42a0-bf98-a9b3e85aea18.content: {Freedom is the ability to pursue one's own goals}, {Positive liberty involves having the capacity and resources to achieve one's aims}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals have the means to act on their own intentions}, {Freedom requires the absence of external coercion and the empowerment to overcome internal compulsions}

14a2d001-e945-45cf-9aaa-7fc9dcd71cf4.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's true self}, {Self-realization involves fulfilling one's potential and authentic desires}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can live in accordance with their true nature}, {Freedom requires the absence of external coercion and the overcoming of internal compulsions that hinder self-realization}

138b5b62-4ec1-4b34-8bc2-5fce12e40513.summary: Distinguishing between external and internal constraints
138b5b62-4ec1-4b34-8bc2-5fce12e40513.content: {There is a distinction between external coercion and internal compulsion}, {Freedom as absence of coercion is a theory about external coercion rather than internal compulsion}, {Internal compulsions like addictions or phobias do not constitute coercion in the relevant external sense}, {The intuition that internal compulsions undermine freedom can be explained as a confusion between external coercion and internal constraints}

482bb7cd-bd4d-4b2a-9f2e-3741c22f97b9.summary: Rejecting the necessity of internal freedom for liberty
482bb7cd-bd4d-4b2a-9f2e-3741c22f97b9.content: {It is false that liberty requires the absence of internal compulsions}, {Liberty is defined solely by the absence of external coercion}, {Internal compulsions do not prevent individuals from being free in the relevant sense of liberty as absence of coercion}

e5e87d7e-67f3-4869-b87a-61538c0e83b8.summary: Supplementing with a focus on external influences
e5e87d7e-67f3-4869-b87a-61538c0e83b8.content: {Freedom as absence of coercion focuses on external influences on decision-making}, {Internal compulsions are not considered coercion because they do not involve external forces}, {Liberty is achieved when external influences do not compel individuals, regardless of internal compulsions}

3226c5c6-dbeb-496a-b75d-decff34e8cc3.content: {Freedom is the ability to act according to one's desires and intentions}, {Determinism is compatible with individuals having desires and intentions}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act in accordance with their own desires, even if those desires are determined by prior causes}

c27a44fc-dc94-43da-b102-5398583e8dfe.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act according to rational deliberation}, {Rational deliberation involves evaluating reasons and making decisions based on them}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act based on rational self-determination, regardless of deterministic influences}

2aa965a0-4864-430c-9cf5-97f6a21d9b9a.content: {Freedom is the alignment of first-order desires with second-order volitions}, {First-order desires are basic wants or inclinations}, {Second-order volitions are desires about which first-order desires to act upon}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals' actions align with their reflective endorsement of those actions}

95abc930-6e09-447d-87ac-269eaf22a541.content: {Freedom is the capacity to be morally responsible for one's actions}, {Moral responsibility requires the ability to respond to reasons}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can be held accountable for their actions, even in a deterministic framework}

b5d274a6-ccf8-4645-b2bc-01ecfe8a2211.content: {Freedom is the ability to govern oneself according to one's own principles}, {Autonomy involves acting in accordance with self-imposed rules or values}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can live according to their own authentic principles, irrespective of deterministic constraints}

8f2a5d64-0a31-4f7f-9b2d-be9efc0358af.content: {There is a distinction between coercion and determinism}, {Freedom as absence of coercion is concerned with social and interpersonal constraints, not metaphysical ones}, {Determinism does not involve forcing someone to act against their will in the relevant sense}, {Liberty is about the absence of external compulsion, not the absence of causal determination}

c63365f1-446f-4275-8c16-6c00e2555734.summary: Rejecting the incompatibility of freedom and determinism
c63365f1-446f-4275-8c16-6c00e2555734.content: {It is false that determinism precludes genuine freedom to choose}, {Freedom as absence of coercion is compatible with determinism because it focuses on the absence of external compulsion}, {The ability to act according to one's will is preserved even if actions are determined by prior causes}, {Liberty is not an illusion if individuals can act without being compelled by others}

0981e5bf-2b5e-468f-99b0-85d4cb73bd88.summary: Supplementing with a compatibilist view of freedom
0981e5bf-2b5e-468f-99b0-85d4cb73bd88.content: {Compatibilism is the view that freedom and determinism are compatible}, {Freedom as absence of coercion can be understood within a compatibilist framework}, {Even in a deterministic universe, individuals can be free if they act according to their desires without external compulsion}, {Liberty is achieved when choices align with one's will, regardless of determinism}

7ace2d20-8730-4332-852f-001de9758d1d.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {Domination involves having power over someone in a way that they cannot contest}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}

e3546b3c-3599-48c5-92b3-924eca947862.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {Functionings are the various things a person may value doing or being}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals have the capability to pursue their goals}

af59537c-feea-4848-994a-5da075ff953f.content: {Freedom is the ability to act in accordance with one's true self}, {True self involves rational reflection and self-determination}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can pursue their rationally chosen goals}

5fc9b2ee-5351-4fd4-b158-51266ec54b13.content: {Freedom is the ability to access fair opportunities}, {Fair opportunities involve equal access to resources and chances}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals have equitable opportunities to pursue their goals}

74c8cb3d-464f-4d14-b23c-0581d1472906.content: {Freedom is the capacity for self-governance}, {Self-governance involves making decisions based on one's own values and reasons}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can make autonomous choices}

86683c2c-ae14-43d7-98ea-f1f72c37d9dd.content: {Freedom is the absence of constraints on action}, {Constraints involve any barriers that limit one's ability to act}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act without external or internal barriers}

62a7b52d-f4c2-4836-b0c8-24cf00eeeed7.content: {Freedom is the empowerment to make meaningful choices}, {Empowerment involves having the resources and abilities to act}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals are empowered to pursue their goals}

57ca2977-c4be-48ad-b1ac-f393244990e2.content: {Freedom is the realization of social justice}, {Social justice involves fair distribution of resources and opportunities}, {Liberty is achieved when society ensures just conditions for all individuals}

2b54e250-9429-4bb4-90d1-1372e82a027f.summary: Distinguishing between coercion and economic constraints
2b54e250-9429-4bb4-90d1-1372e82a027f.content: {There is a distinction between coercion and economic constraints}, {Freedom as absence of coercion is a theory about coercion, not economic conditions}, {Economic inequality does not constitute coercion if it does not involve forcing someone to act against their will}, {A person who lacks resources is not being coerced in the relevant sense, even if their choices are limited}, {The intuition that economic inequality affects freedom can be explained as a confusion between coercion and economic constraints}

e852f17e-623e-42a8-9b2a-4640292bdce8.summary: Rejecting the claim that economic constraints equate to coercion
e852f17e-623e-42a8-9b2a-4640292bdce8.content: {It is false that economic constraints are equivalent to coercion}, {Coercion specifically involves forcing someone to act against their will, which is not the case with economic inequality}, {Economic inequality may limit choices but does not involve compulsion by others}, {The claim that liberty requires fair economic conditions is not part of the definition of freedom as absence of coercion}

b58a708e-3dc6-4cf0-88c7-ae6e200fa860.summary: Supplementing with a distinction between negative and positive liberty
b58a708e-3dc6-4cf0-88c7-ae6e200fa860.content: {Negative liberty is the absence of interference or coercion}, {Positive liberty involves having the means or capacity to achieve one's goals}, {Freedom as absence of coercion is concerned with negative liberty}, {Economic inequality may affect positive liberty but does not affect negative liberty as defined by absence of coercion}, {The objection confuses the requirements for positive liberty with those for negative liberty}

92648b0c-f2ec-4d40-8592-f32c0b79e033.content: {Freedom is the capacity for autonomous decision-making}, {Autonomy involves making choices based on rational deliberation}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act according to their own reasoned judgments}

831bbf0e-e0b5-46f0-b59c-5fd4b6883bbe.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination by others}, {Domination involves being subject to the arbitrary will of another}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals are not vulnerable to the arbitrary power of others}

47ad6d8c-2770-493b-b50f-5683d9f5d3bf.summary: Rejecting the intuition that manipulation undermines freedom
47ad6d8c-2770-493b-b50f-5683d9f5d3bf.content: {It is mistaken to think that manipulation necessarily undermines freedom}, {Manipulation does not involve coercion as it does not force someone to act against their will}, {Liberty is preserved as long as individuals are not compelled by others, regardless of manipulation}

41a78cae-3fa9-4815-a167-b5a3d64690fe.content: {Freedom is the absence of interference from others}, {Interference involves actions that prevent someone from achieving their goals}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can pursue their goals without obstruction by others}

3b8bf43b-3a3c-48ec-9585-69d0ef014e8a.content: {Freedom is the ability to determine one's own actions}, {Self-determination involves making choices based on one's own values and desires}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act according to their own self-chosen plans}

4d236fac-2087-4fde-8f9f-39b2b1928ce4.content: {Freedom is the capacity for autonomous decision-making}, {Autonomy involves acting according to one's own rational deliberation}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can make decisions based on their own reasoned judgments}

5d1cecc3-f31d-45ec-a37e-9ffbfdaac243.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination by others}, {Domination involves being subject to the arbitrary will of another}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals are not vulnerable to the arbitrary interference of others}

bedef303-2313-4a81-b30a-01877eb2a95b.content: {Freedom is having the opportunity to achieve one's goals}, {Opportunity involves having access to the resources and options necessary to pursue one's aims}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals have the means to pursue their chosen paths}

5d1ecc79-5cee-4841-b27f-8b83306b1156.content: {Freedom is acting with consent}, {Consent involves agreeing to actions or conditions voluntarily}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals engage in actions or agreements of their own volition}

238b89f3-9b9f-4059-8c0d-ad72ea90a6bc.content: {Freedom is the empowerment to act effectively}, {Empowerment involves having the skills and resources to achieve one's aims}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals are empowered to pursue their goals successfully}

de988183-72e4-4012-9a6c-1649959c4b74.content: {There is a distinction between coercion and legitimate authority.}, {Legal obligations derive from legitimate authority and are not coercive in the relevant sense.}, {Freedom as absence of coercion pertains to illegitimate compulsion, not to obligations arising from legitimate social contracts.}

5ab89545-1dca-4cbc-bf28-6034e01c117d.summary: Rejecting the view that legal obligations are coercive
5ab89545-1dca-4cbc-bf28-6034e01c117d.content: {It is false that legal obligations inherently constitute coercion.}, {Legal obligations are a form of social agreement and do not force individuals against their will in the coercive sense.}, {Liberty is not compromised by legal obligations that individuals have consented to as part of a social contract.}

89ceb1da-0f6e-45aa-9445-6a0d0dcaca57.summary: Supplementing with the concept of voluntary social contracts
89ceb1da-0f6e-45aa-9445-6a0d0dcaca57.content: {Legal obligations are part of a voluntary social contract that individuals agree to.}, {Freedom is compatible with legal obligations when they are the result of collective agreements.}, {The appearance of coercion in legal obligations is mitigated by the voluntary nature of social contracts.}

24856ecc-9248-466c-ba96-0dec15d1fcf4.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {Domination involves having power over someone, even if not actively exercised}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals are not subject to arbitrary interference by others}

478048c6-ce36-4266-a1ae-1619e1ecb0cb.content: {Freedom is the ability to realize one's true self}, {Self-realization involves acting in accordance with one's authentic desires and values}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can pursue personal growth and fulfillment}

89db895f-78db-4a2f-a837-9e56d0bc1ba9.content: {Freedom is the capacity for self-governance}, {Autonomy involves making decisions based on one's own reasoning and values}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act according to their own principles without external constraints}

0af14f63-2aae-4aca-be04-f492c73e10f0.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable functionings}, {Capabilities are the real opportunities to accomplish what one values}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals have the means to pursue their goals and aspirations}

72fff309-813d-47a2-a51f-906d3af24bea.content: {Freedom is the absence of interference from others}, {Interference involves actions that prevent someone from doing what they would otherwise do}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act without being obstructed by others}

d83620f8-91da-4872-8f15-0d278ccfa4ce.content: {There is a distinction between coercion and cultural influence}, {Coercion involves an external force compelling action against one's will}, {Cultural norms do not constitute coercion if they do not involve force or compulsion}, {Conforming to cultural norms without compulsion does not undermine freedom as defined by absence of coercion}

ac671ba3-f58d-4d41-84b5-442636c94580.content: {It is mistaken to equate cultural conformity with a lack of freedom}, {Freedom as absence of coercion is not compromised by voluntary adherence to cultural norms}, {Choosing to follow cultural norms without external compulsion is an exercise of freedom}

68cb01c2-0ec3-46e8-8f7c-b72720a8f8ca.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of voluntary cultural engagement
68cb01c2-0ec3-46e8-8f7c-b72720a8f8ca.content: {Individuals can engage with cultural norms voluntarily}, {Voluntary engagement with cultural norms does not equate to coercion}, {Liberty includes the ability to choose to follow cultural norms without compulsion}

d99edab1-d739-4733-8b95-cf0b4932c9a0.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination}, {Domination involves the capacity to interfere on an arbitrary basis}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals are not subject to the arbitrary will of others}

6cbd56cb-1322-4311-90a5-384c6bb9d40e.content: {Freedom is the ability to act according to one's moral convictions}, {Moral independence involves making choices based on one's ethical beliefs}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can act in alignment with their moral principles}

4505c2a5-66bd-4ca4-9e9a-a0624ba4735a.content: {Internal autonomy refers to the ability to make decisions based on personal values and desires}, {External autonomy involves freedom from external constraints like coercion}, {Authority figures may affect internal autonomy but do not necessarily impact external autonomy}, {Liberty as absence of coercion is concerned with external autonomy, not internal}

ee69a1c6-c9fc-4b29-8aef-5d4ebd064f7b.content: {Freedom is the absence of interference from others}, {Interference involves actions that prevent someone from achieving their goals}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can pursue their goals without obstruction by others}

ce0cbb8d-0b55-4680-8ed9-2dcdcf68b6b1.content: {Freedom is the ability to express oneself creatively}, {Creative expression involves the manifestation of one's ideas and imagination}, {Liberty is present when individuals can freely engage in artistic and innovative activities}, {Freedom encompasses a variety of expressions including political and social}, {An individual is fully free when they can express themselves in creative, political, and social ways}

8dc50ad0-b080-408f-9500-21fc842a5413.summary: Distinguishing between creative and comprehensive freedom
8dc50ad0-b080-408f-9500-21fc842a5413.content: {There is a distinction between creative freedom and comprehensive freedom}, {Freedom as creative expression is a theory about creative freedom rather than comprehensive freedom}, {Political, economic, and social dimensions are aspects of comprehensive freedom, not creative freedom}, {An individual can be creatively free even if they are not comprehensively free}, {The intuition that someone is not fully free can be explained as confusion between creative freedom and comprehensive freedom}

52610ae1-4ac4-4ac9-84b8-e5e0d9899d8f.content: {It is false that political freedom is necessary for creative freedom}, {Creative expression can occur even in the absence of political rights}, {The ability to express oneself creatively does not inherently require political, economic, or social freedoms}, {The scenario where an individual is creatively expressive but politically restricted does not undermine their creative freedom}

d2a085a0-d241-403a-8615-92020756aaeb.content: {Freedom can be understood as a hierarchy with creative freedom as a foundational level}, {Political, economic, and social freedoms can be seen as higher levels that build upon creative freedom}, {The presence of creative freedom is a necessary but not sufficient condition for comprehensive freedom}, {The objection loses its force when considering that creative freedom is a distinct and foundational aspect of overall freedom}

ae081e7e-872d-4195-8fe5-1eef36a0d9d5.content: {Freedom is acting with contextual consent}, {Contextual consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions with an understanding of the relevant context and implications}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have contextually and voluntarily agreed to}

e98349b4-25c5-4866-a828-1205ed9d07b2.content: {Freedom is acting with explicit consent}, {Explicit consent involves clearly and unambiguously agreeing to actions or decisions}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have explicitly and willingly agreed to}

955b1b9d-4c2b-4eb4-95e4-ed4449893113.content: {Freedom is acting with continuous consent}, {Continuous consent involves maintaining agreement to actions or decisions throughout the process}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have continuously and voluntarily agreed to}

fb5ea683-0627-436f-858b-dc2e4c14e856.content: {Freedom is acting with transparent consent}, {Transparent consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions with full transparency and disclosure}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have transparently and willingly agreed to}

13e848cf-26aa-4f39-9a1c-850c9c1a4a65.content: {Freedom is acting with empowered consent}, {Empowered consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions with the empowerment to make informed choices}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have empoweredly and voluntarily agreed to}

9f9a353b-8a8f-47be-9181-41d635e994d2.summary: Distinguishing between informed and uninformed consent
9f9a353b-8a8f-47be-9181-41d635e994d2.content: {There is a distinction between informed consent and uninformed consent}, {Freedom as consent is a theory about informed consent rather than uninformed consent}, {A person who agrees to an action without full knowledge is not providing informed consent}, {The intuition that a person did not truly consent can be explained by the lack of information, not by the absence of consent itself}

8e5415c7-fea5-4188-8d7a-a4daae7bf1b9.summary: Rejecting the necessity of full knowledge for true consent
8e5415c7-fea5-4188-8d7a-a4daae7bf1b9.content: {It is false that full knowledge of all consequences is necessary for true consent}, {Consent can be genuine even if not all consequences are known, as long as the decision is voluntary}, {The appearance of lacking true consent can be explained by the expectation of complete information, which is not required for voluntary agreement}

d38f0d0a-c0f5-442e-9c1f-92a3e17f203f.summary: Supplementing with a threshold of reasonable knowledge
d38f0d0a-c0f5-442e-9c1f-92a3e17f203f.content: {Consent requires a threshold of reasonable knowledge, not complete knowledge}, {Freedom as consent includes the assumption that individuals have a reasonable understanding of the action}, {The objection loses force when considering that reasonable knowledge suffices for true consent}

fd7717de-4c48-47a3-a368-4c9011e5929a.content: {Freedom is acting with informed consent}, {Informed consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions with full understanding of relevant information}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have willingly and knowledgeably agreed to}

3fbfa9df-9c16-4d56-8dd6-267f81df4541.content: {Freedom is acting with autonomous consent}, {Autonomous consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions without external coercion or manipulation}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have autonomously agreed to}

d22db8b6-0514-4a60-8357-28e1e57dfa89.content: {Freedom is acting with reflective consent}, {Reflective consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions after careful consideration and reflection}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have reflectively agreed to}

20544fc9-f26c-4f95-9cf5-478db653ee5d.content: {Freedom is acting with rational consent}, {Rational consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions based on logical reasoning and evidence}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have rationally agreed to}

6912d7b4-dfdc-4a25-866a-7166dfb058d0.content: {Freedom is acting with non-coerced consent}, {Non-coerced consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions without any form of coercion or undue pressure}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have non-coercively agreed to}

80f5b90c-4e35-499d-be9f-995ab414388e.content: {Freedom is acting with authentic consent}, {Authentic consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions that align with one's true values and desires}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have authentically agreed to}

c6c1183a-e7f5-4bb9-85bd-64777b0c6b57.content: {Freedom is acting with transparent consent}, {Transparent consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions with clear and open communication of all relevant factors}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have transparently agreed to}

97d7e828-0f73-4de7-a3ab-ff8a154528e4.content: {Freedom is acting with competent consent}, {Competent consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions with the necessary mental and emotional capacity}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have competently agreed to}

107b886d-5a50-4e6c-a57e-5ea533adf8cc.content: {Freedom is acting with volitional consent}, {Volitional consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions as an expression of one's own will}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have volitionally agreed to}

b22eb7d7-6f2f-41b8-9980-e91478504e03.content: {Freedom is acting with contextual consent}, {Contextual consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions with an understanding of the situational context}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have contextually agreed to}

57a220b7-3e85-4568-9c33-46ea0d7d256f.summary: Distinguishing between informed and uninformed consent
57a220b7-3e85-4568-9c33-46ea0d7d256f.content: {There is a distinction between informed consent and uninformed consent}, {Freedom as consent is a theory about informed consent rather than uninformed consent}, {Manipulation through deceit or misinformation results in uninformed consent, which is not the relevant kind of consent for freedom}, {A person manipulated into agreeing does not provide informed consent, and thus their freedom is not achieved}, {The intuition that manipulated consent is not true consent can be explained by the lack of information}

85cc1f64-0f21-43d9-9059-debd825f3ac8.summary: Rejecting the intuition that manipulated consent is not consent
85cc1f64-0f21-43d9-9059-debd825f3ac8.content: {It is false that manipulated consent is not a form of consent}, {Consent can still be considered voluntary even if influenced by external factors like misinformation}, {The appearance of non-consent in manipulated scenarios can be explained by the presence of external influences, not by the absence of consent itself}

faba436a-4f16-432f-8aa0-52f34ffed3f6.summary: Explaining the intuition through the concept of autonomy
faba436a-4f16-432f-8aa0-52f34ffed3f6.content: {Autonomy involves making decisions based on one's own values and understanding}, {Manipulation undermines autonomy by distorting the decision-making process}, {The intuition that manipulated consent is not true consent is explained by the violation of autonomy, not by the absence of consent}

2331a972-ef32-465c-b66a-f9928a9f858c.content: {Freedom is acting with authentic consent}, {Authentic consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions without coercion or undue influence}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have authentically agreed to}

d2a37f92-ddb2-4e67-b96d-18fe11e08fff.content: {Freedom is acting with informed consent}, {Informed consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions with full understanding of the consequences}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have agreed to with full knowledge}

bc051ca9-e986-424c-9c02-8d525bc5024f.content: {Freedom is acting with reflective consent}, {Reflective consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions after careful consideration and reflection}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have reflectively agreed to}

604bb035-c53d-43c5-9560-a1537a517207.content: {Freedom is acting with autonomous consent}, {Autonomous consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions based on one's own values and reasoning}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have autonomously agreed to}
