09c6d407-48cd-4547-8d19-1ea441c5dbb1.content: {Freedom is acting with uncoerced consent}, {Uncoerced consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions without any form of coercion}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have uncoercedly agreed to}

9761ff0d-27da-4068-b357-20993e1b21a1.content: {Freedom is acting with voluntary participation}, {Voluntary participation involves engaging in actions or decisions by one's own free will}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have voluntarily chosen}

bb5c0035-83a4-4eea-85f1-3008e65886f3.content: {Freedom is acting with rational consent}, {Rational consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions based on logical reasoning and evidence}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have rationally agreed to}

00a38748-afe4-4e09-85db-fe36c3368ee7.content: {Freedom is acting with non-manipulated consent}, {Non-manipulated consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions without being subject to manipulation}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have non-manipulatively agreed to}

3afc6aaf-34b9-4c65-bd06-1566a584d1e6.content: {Freedom is acting with contextual consent}, {Contextual consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions with an understanding of the situational context}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have contextually agreed to}

5e59e22a-fdf7-46ba-83a9-ddc268bc4636.content: {Freedom is acting with self-determined consent}, {Self-determined consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions based on one's own self-determination}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have self-determinedly agreed to}

dd8d47c9-88e7-4f63-b95d-8bea0cb6aa76.summary: Distinguishing between voluntary and coerced consent
dd8d47c9-88e7-4f63-b95d-8bea0cb6aa76.content: {There is a distinction between voluntary consent and coerced consent}, {Freedom as consent is a theory about voluntary consent rather than coerced consent}, {Social pressure does not invalidate consent if the individual still agrees voluntarily}, {A person who consents under social pressure is not being coerced in the relevant voluntary sense}, {The intuition that consent is invalidated by social pressure can be explained as confusion between voluntary and coerced consent}

d36ba21f-d9d1-44ad-b083-771c0d29fe6b.summary: Rejecting the intuition that social pressure negates consent
d36ba21f-d9d1-44ad-b083-771c0d29fe6b.content: {It is false that social pressure inherently negates consent}, {Consent remains valid as long as the individual has the capacity to agree voluntarily}, {The presence of social pressure does not automatically transform voluntary consent into non-consent}

18a1d166-e705-47b6-80d5-deb8a5f5d421.content: {Consent involves supplementary conditions such as awareness and absence of coercion}, {Social pressure does not meet the threshold of coercion if the individual is aware and agrees voluntarily}, {The appearance of invalid consent under social pressure is explained by misunderstanding the supplementary conditions of valid consent}

99d2005a-2bbf-4000-8711-0c8a40101b4b.content: {Freedom is acting according to one's rational will}, {Rational autonomy involves making decisions based on reason and reflection}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals act in accordance with their rational deliberations}

220fde6e-ef51-41ae-b656-7fc677987274.content: {Freedom is the ability to determine one's own actions}, {Self-determination involves having control over one's choices and actions}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals have the power to shape their own lives}

ea711c92-60e9-4473-91f4-2c20bf4b20c9.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination by others}, {Non-domination involves not being subject to arbitrary interference}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals are free from the control of others}

d9cb49a3-da0c-40fd-97bf-2e4bbadca0b9.content: {Freedom is living in accordance with one's true self}, {Authenticity involves acting in ways that reflect one's genuine desires and values}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals express their true identity through their actions}

d10c150b-0e14-4985-864a-7549bacbb0a1.content: {Freedom is having the capability to achieve valuable outcomes}, {Capability involves having the means and opportunities to pursue one's goals}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals have the resources to realize their potential}

8d7e9f97-974d-473b-8f5e-0a78208741d3.summary: Distinguishing between voluntary consent and coerced consent
8d7e9f97-974d-473b-8f5e-0a78208741d3.content: {There is a distinction between voluntary consent and coerced consent}, {Freedom as consent is a theory about voluntary consent rather than coerced consent}, {A scenario where a person agrees due to lack of alternatives is not an instance of voluntary consent}, {The intuition that liberty is absent in such scenarios can be explained by the presence of coerced consent rather than voluntary consent}

6df72e07-6f27-42eb-bc3a-9319f06e32f3.summary: Rejecting the intuition that lack of alternatives negates consent
6df72e07-6f27-42eb-bc3a-9319f06e32f3.content: {It is false that lack of alternatives negates the possibility of consent}, {Consent can still be genuine even if the range of options is limited}, {The presence of limited alternatives does not inherently undermine the voluntariness of consent}

1ef4fbc5-32c2-4225-9b82-cb34569fa1e9.summary: Explaining consent through the presence of rational deliberation
1ef4fbc5-32c2-4225-9b82-cb34569fa1e9.content: {Consent involves rational deliberation, not merely the presence of alternatives}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals make decisions based on rational deliberation, even if alternatives are limited}, {The appearance of lacking liberty can be explained by a misunderstanding of the role of rational deliberation in consent}

44be172f-d5a9-4f4e-ab56-9caaf4fce750.content: {Freedom is acting with informed consent}, {Informed consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions with understanding}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have willingly and knowledgeably agreed to}

6fd6974c-c791-4a94-90b0-8a2324394c12.content: {Freedom is acting with rational consent}, {Rational consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions based on reason and understanding}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have rationally and voluntarily agreed to}

2fcea907-f0e3-4c92-9441-a1657da128f4.content: {Freedom is acting with autonomous consent}, {Autonomous consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions independently and with understanding}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have autonomously and knowledgeably agreed to}

ded3311a-1e35-4345-843f-d57f071f98d4.content: {Freedom is acting with reflective consent}, {Reflective consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions after careful consideration and understanding}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have reflectively and voluntarily agreed to}

7fe6abe0-bac0-4b53-9ba4-29ca48fe792f.content: {Freedom is acting with competent consent}, {Competent consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions with the necessary competence and understanding}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have competently and knowledgeably agreed to}

5fc3477a-969e-49c6-937a-b3e017a75989.summary: Distinguishing between consent and informed consent
5fc3477a-969e-49c6-937a-b3e017a75989.content: {There is a distinction between consent and informed consent}, {Freedom as consent is a theory about consent in general, not specifically informed consent}, {A person can consent to an action without fully understanding it, and this still counts as consent}, {The intuition that understanding is necessary for consent can be explained as a confusion between consent and informed consent}

afb03f67-b51a-4ae4-873f-f814767ed982.summary: Rejecting the necessity of understanding for consent
afb03f67-b51a-4ae4-873f-f814767ed982.content: {It is false that understanding is necessary for consent}, {Consent involves a voluntary agreement, which does not inherently require full understanding}, {The appearance that understanding is necessary for consent can be explained by societal norms rather than the nature of consent itself}

6d7de8de-7a98-4865-83b6-e5e3cdf84091.summary: Supplementing with a distinction between types of consent
6d7de8de-7a98-4865-83b6-e5e3cdf84091.content: {There are different types of consent, such as explicit and implicit consent}, {Freedom as consent focuses on the voluntary nature of agreement, not the level of understanding}, {A person can give implicit consent without full understanding, and this still aligns with the theory of freedom as consent}

ed2b0e30-03f9-4b47-8c2c-e0cc05ac6e79.content: {Freedom is acting with informed consent}, {Informed consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions with full understanding of the implications}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have willingly and knowledgeably agreed to}

9ddf5bb9-c753-48d3-8c71-529616051a7d.content: {Freedom is acting with reflective consent}, {Reflective consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions after thoughtful consideration}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have thoughtfully and willingly agreed to}

93e9117a-eedc-4bce-9d63-6ef54bbdea50.content: {Freedom is acting with explicit consent}, {Explicit consent involves clearly and directly agreeing to actions or decisions}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have explicitly and willingly agreed to}

c0ffd07c-3459-40e3-96b2-102aabefe50e.content: {Freedom is acting with autonomous consent}, {Autonomous consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions independently and without coercion}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have autonomously and willingly agreed to}

0dd6049b-36a1-4549-aaef-46a84f26d035.content: {Freedom is acting with contextual consent}, {Contextual consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions with awareness of the surrounding circumstances}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have contextually and willingly agreed to}

8337049a-f82a-4200-b98b-4eba5da9b8d3.content: {Freedom is acting with continuous consent}, {Continuous consent involves ongoing agreement to actions or decisions throughout the process}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have continuously and willingly agreed to}

285eefed-da64-40c3-8ae4-eb9fb4691045.content: {Freedom is acting with empowered consent}, {Empowered consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions with the capacity to make free choices}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have empowered and willingly agreed to}

f3827a5e-ad88-4b8b-9d87-2d8e1cfb72c0.content: {Freedom is acting with rational consent}, {Rational consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions based on reason and logical deliberation}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have rationally and willingly agreed to}

5be88929-bff3-4ec4-a724-b26c03a8510d.content: {Freedom is acting with authentic consent}, {Authentic consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions that align with one's true self and values}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have authentically and willingly agreed to}

e8e1eecd-a4e9-4037-83c4-0e82122c1ced.content: {Freedom is acting with volitional consent}, {Volitional consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions as an expression of one's will}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have volitionally and willingly agreed to}

3bb4dfa2-0d17-45ad-b37a-084199f8bbf9.summary: Distinguishing between compliance and genuine consent
3bb4dfa2-0d17-45ad-b37a-084199f8bbf9.content: {There is a distinction between habitual compliance and genuine consent}, {Freedom as consent is a theory about genuine consent rather than mere compliance}, {Habitual compliance without active agreement does not meet the criteria for genuine consent}, {The intuition that habitual compliance is not true consent can be explained by the absence of active agreement}

b4915ee7-fc3a-4405-bf5e-e583fe9d43dd.summary: Rejecting the intuition that habitual compliance undermines consent
b4915ee7-fc3a-4405-bf5e-e583fe9d43dd.content: {It is mistaken to equate habitual compliance with a lack of consent}, {Consent can be present even if actions are habitual, provided there is an underlying voluntary agreement}, {The appearance of non-consent in habitual compliance can be explained by overlooking the initial voluntary agreement}

6fe249cd-31fb-467c-8d39-81fcd6b39ee3.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of implicit consent
6fe249cd-31fb-467c-8d39-81fcd6b39ee3.content: {Implicit consent can occur when there is a history of voluntary agreement}, {Habitual compliance can be seen as an expression of implicit consent if it aligns with past voluntary agreements}, {The intuition that habitual compliance lacks consent is addressed by recognizing the role of implicit consent}

bab533e0-9c22-43e1-ba33-3236c389aec6.content: {Freedom is acting with informed consent}, {Informed consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions with full understanding of the implications}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have willingly and knowledgeably agreed to}

48e89392-5c0c-499f-a918-36ffae875e0e.content: {Freedom is acting with autonomous consent}, {Autonomous consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions without external coercion or manipulation}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have autonomously agreed to}

d8c0a071-00b7-4b9f-b9b2-ee7013afac1b.content: {Freedom is acting with rational consent}, {Rational consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions based on reasoned deliberation}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have rationally agreed to}

a0965624-f970-48b7-9cf1-fa3d9bae4580.content: {Freedom is acting with reflective consent}, {Reflective consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions after careful reflection on personal values and desires}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have reflectively agreed to}

36a42fb7-12ae-4d3c-ae6d-6bee981678c7.content: {Freedom is acting with egalitarian consent}, {Egalitarian consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions in a context of equal power relations}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have agreed to in an egalitarian context}

e44f188f-2384-4c1c-bb76-57a8a47d44f7.content: {Freedom is acting with voluntary participation}, {Voluntary participation involves engaging in actions or decisions without any form of coercion or undue influence}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have voluntarily chosen}

86fb24e4-abf7-4ca8-af3e-4a1408260ecc.content: {Freedom is acting with empowered consent}, {Empowered consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions with the capacity to make free choices}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have empoweredly agreed to}

67edd02d-fa3f-4b61-9ba1-5ca5196d5bf1.content: {Freedom is acting with contextual consent}, {Contextual consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions with awareness of the surrounding circumstances}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have contextually agreed to}

230e2195-2d0f-4cc1-ab45-bf0b8977121a.content: {Freedom is acting with dialogical consent}, {Dialogical consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions through open and honest dialogue}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have dialogically agreed to}

b390b22d-62ac-4101-956e-5e1ae075ee83.content: {Freedom is acting with mutual consent}, {Mutual consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions in a reciprocal and consensual manner}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have mutually agreed to}

6d380ed7-7205-4ab0-9550-d010f2d43ca4.summary: Distinguishing between voluntary and coerced consent
6d380ed7-7205-4ab0-9550-d010f2d43ca4.content: {There is a distinction between voluntary consent and coerced consent}, {Freedom as consent is a theory about voluntary consent rather than coerced consent}, {A significant power imbalance can lead to coerced consent, which is not genuine consent}, {Liberty is not compromised if consent is truly voluntary, even in the presence of power dynamics}, {The intuition that liberty is compromised can be explained by confusion between voluntary and coerced consent}

c08e92dc-fbef-4c40-9c53-014d0ef5f078.summary: Rejecting the intuition that power imbalance negates consent
c08e92dc-fbef-4c40-9c53-014d0ef5f078.content: {It is false that a power imbalance automatically negates genuine consent}, {Consent can still be voluntary even if there is a power imbalance, provided the individual agrees without coercion}, {The presence of a power imbalance does not necessarily mean that liberty is compromised if the consent is given freely}, {The intuition that liberty is compromised by power imbalance is mistaken if consent is voluntary}

071d7860-a2ed-44b7-bbfa-5d1da902b283.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of informed consent
071d7860-a2ed-44b7-bbfa-5d1da902b283.content: {Informed consent requires that individuals understand the implications of their agreement}, {Liberty is achieved when consent is both informed and voluntary}, {A power imbalance does not compromise liberty if individuals are fully informed and consent voluntarily}, {The appearance of compromised liberty can be explained by a lack of informed consent, not by the power imbalance itself}

4f4d4f4c-2b8c-41e7-b9bd-00b13b5d5945.content: {Freedom is acting with informed consent}, {Informed consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions with full understanding}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have willingly and knowledgeably agreed to}

bad1de73-aa62-4e06-9e12-52cc01edbfa6.content: {Freedom is acting with autonomous consent}, {Autonomous consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions without external coercion}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have independently agreed to}

a0401830-6130-4739-8a5d-fc5640f15cec.content: {Freedom is acting with reflective consent}, {Reflective consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions after careful consideration}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have thoughtfully agreed to}

bbac6b40-5a8e-483a-a84b-13414b071f1f.content: {Freedom is acting with rational consent}, {Rational consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions based on reasoned judgment}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have logically agreed to}

8e97084a-ae44-43ba-bcf2-137425e4b72e.content: {Freedom is acting with contextual consent}, {Contextual consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions considering situational factors}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have contextually agreed to}

d0220423-17f2-481f-ae1e-2cc72405eed1.content: {Freedom is acting with dynamic consent}, {Dynamic consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions with the ability to revise consent}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have flexibly agreed to}

f28097eb-ad83-49f4-9ddd-c1099761a6cd.content: {Freedom is acting with mutual consent}, {Mutual consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions with reciprocal agreement}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have mutually agreed to}

84e63c49-0d4a-4030-89d4-2e9414e82a69.content: {Freedom is acting with explicit consent}, {Explicit consent involves clearly agreeing to actions or decisions}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have explicitly agreed to}

9a0b23fc-cfc3-432a-a660-9050f585e8eb.content: {Freedom is acting with continuous consent}, {Continuous consent involves ongoing agreement to actions or decisions}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have continuously agreed to}

5052ab0f-9257-4e8a-b907-d4fe307b085a.content: {Freedom is acting with empowered consent}, {Empowered consent involves agreeing to actions or decisions with the capacity to influence outcomes}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals participate in actions they have empoweredly agreed to}

16c3d3e2-095b-4c60-a73a-65c52bf43480.content: {There is a distinction between consent and coercion}, {Freedom as consent is a theory about voluntary agreement, not about the absence of coercion}, {A scenario where refusal is impossible does not involve genuine consent but rather coercion}, {The intuition that consent requires the possibility of refusal is based on conflating consent with coercion}

9588970e-c7c2-45a5-9e14-60149c3808e2.summary: Rejecting the necessity of refusal for consent
9588970e-c7c2-45a5-9e14-60149c3808e2.content: {It is false that the possibility of refusal is necessary for genuine consent}, {Consent can be genuine even in scenarios where refusal is not an option if the agreement is made without external pressure}, {The intuition that consent requires the possibility of refusal is mistaken and overlooks the voluntary nature of agreement}

dd91588c-b479-4ae0-a25a-ecf6b2287892.summary: Supplementing with the concept of internal willingness
dd91588c-b479-4ae0-a25a-ecf6b2287892.content: {Consent involves internal willingness, which does not necessarily require the possibility of refusal}, {Internal willingness can exist even in scenarios where refusal is not an option}, {The appearance that consent requires the possibility of refusal is explained by misunderstanding internal willingness as dependent on external options}

1f9dff99-223c-4714-99bf-a630560043ab.content: {Freedom is acting autonomously}, {Autonomy involves making decisions based on one's own reasoning and values}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals act according to their own principles and desires}

f7bf8d74-2e7a-4336-ae55-8344464aae27.content: {Freedom is self-determination}, {Self-determination involves the ability to set and pursue one's own goals}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can freely choose and pursue their own objectives}

b105106e-1b9e-470d-a2e7-4761a7ec4907.content: {Freedom is non-interference}, {Non-interference involves the absence of external constraints on actions}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals are not hindered by others in their actions}

952a3d04-2fed-4ff8-a472-75ca7a78d2bb.content: {Freedom is rational agency}, {Rational agency involves making choices based on reason and reflection}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals act in accordance with rational deliberation}

a55e48fa-fe68-4d7c-906a-ca1cb61f9438.content: {Freedom is moral responsibility}, {Moral responsibility involves being accountable for one's actions}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can be held responsible for their choices}

66c2542a-4b87-4eaa-b08c-7ca9e9f5da6d.content: {Freedom is authenticity}, {Authenticity involves acting in accordance with one's true self}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals express their genuine identity through their actions}

f533205c-2bc8-4761-85c2-bd5b79b6a9f2.content: {Freedom is empowerment}, {Empowerment involves having the resources and opportunities to act}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals have the means to pursue their chosen paths}

3c7b8b8e-ed3c-4030-b14c-49172904f55d.content: {Freedom is capability}, {Capability involves having the ability to achieve desired outcomes}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals possess the capabilities to fulfill their potential}

80217daf-8dc6-4e0c-86db-d306586541ca.content: {Freedom is self-realization}, {Self-realization involves fulfilling one's potential and aspirations}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can pursue and achieve their personal growth}

d05c477d-5e6f-4670-bcd6-73f305820aef.content: {Freedom is volitional control}, {Volitional control involves having control over one's own actions and decisions}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can direct their actions according to their will}

46979c99-b451-42a2-9f13-03a9cb68c9e1.content: {There is a distinction between internal and external consent}, {Freedom as consent is concerned with internal consent, which involves personal agreement and acceptance}, {In a deterministic universe, internal consent can still exist if individuals agree with their actions}, {The intuition that liberty is absent in determinism can be explained by confusing internal consent with external freedom}

79a94df0-4127-4888-a05a-8b5711447841.summary: Rejecting the intuition that determinism negates consent
79a94df0-4127-4888-a05a-8b5711447841.content: {It is mistaken to believe that determinism inherently negates the possibility of consent}, {Consent is a matter of personal agreement, which can occur even if actions are determined}, {The appearance of a lack of liberty in determinism is due to a misunderstanding of consent as requiring indeterminacy}

c46f67ca-66c5-4cba-88a7-2081517e02c9.content: {Compatibilism is the view that free will and determinism are compatible}, {Freedom as consent can be maintained by adopting a compatibilist perspective}, {Under compatibilism, individuals can consent to actions even if those actions are determined}, {The objection loses its force when considering that consent does not require indeterminacy}

64feb6d3-e0ad-4af9-807f-221d47bec957.content: {Freedom is the absence of constraints on individual actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act without interference from others}, {Political participation is not necessary for freedom}

c5b37653-c218-4f20-8fa0-dc32fba10ad2.content: {Freedom is the capacity for self-determination}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices based on their own values and desires}, {Political participation is one way, but not the only way, to achieve freedom}

dbc5342d-e7bc-455f-b6e9-61cc576ce937.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve valuable states of being and doing}, {Liberty is present when individuals have the capabilities to pursue their goals}, {Political participation is one of many capabilities that contribute to freedom}

924b0bca-0ffc-4bc3-923a-6c4d7a437f65.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination by others}, {Liberty is present when individuals are not subject to arbitrary power}, {Political participation is a means to prevent domination but not the sole determinant of freedom}

4b8b6d70-c1ed-45a5-bfdd-5324c58b5314.content: {Freedom is the opportunity for personal growth and development}, {Liberty is present when individuals can pursue their own paths of development}, {Political participation is one avenue for personal development but not essential for freedom}

a7418f5c-f397-403a-a67f-2b65121b4fc6.content: {Freedom is the availability of options to choose from}, {Liberty is present when individuals have a range of choices in their lives}, {Political participation is one choice among many that can contribute to freedom}

e4c73781-3922-4d48-bed3-cbd5ee44089f.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's true self and potential}, {Liberty is present when individuals can pursue self-fulfillment}, {Political participation can aid self-realization but is not necessary for freedom}

64aadba5-6afd-47e6-a1fa-2cf8d4037902.content: {Freedom is the capacity to act according to moral principles}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make moral choices}, {Political participation is a context for moral agency but not required for freedom}

a39638f0-8b2d-4781-ae4f-f6aa2b7884cc.content: {Freedom is the absence of coercion by others}, {Liberty is present when individuals are not forced to act against their will}, {Political participation is not required to avoid coercion}

c06101d9-d677-44db-ba82-ac98b9d6029c.content: {Freedom is the state of inner peace and contentment}, {Liberty is present when individuals are free from internal conflicts}, {Political participation is not necessary for achieving inner peace}

ea0943ed-a675-4119-b45c-9acfe08d01fa.summary: Distinguishing between political and personal freedom
ea0943ed-a675-4119-b45c-9acfe08d01fa.content: {There is a distinction between political freedom and personal freedom}, {Freedom as political participation is a theory about political freedom rather than personal freedom}, {An individual can be politically unfree if they do not participate in political processes, even if they are personally free in their actions}, {The intuition that someone is free without political participation can be explained as a confusion between political freedom and personal freedom}

f7b54dba-9732-4e81-bd37-cff2d66a0ad2.summary: Rejecting the principle that freedom is only absence of constraints
f7b54dba-9732-4e81-bd37-cff2d66a0ad2.content: {It is false that freedom can only be understood as the absence of constraints on individual actions}, {Freedom as political participation involves having a voice in governance, which is a different dimension of freedom}, {The scenario where an individual is free without political participation does not undermine the importance of political freedom}

4b7ecc60-4511-4d60-ac28-26629b783519.summary: Supplementing with the value of political engagement
4b7ecc60-4511-4d60-ac28-26629b783519.content: {Political participation is valuable because it contributes to the collective decision-making process}, {The absence of personal constraints does not negate the importance of having a voice in political processes}, {Freedom as political participation emphasizes the role of individuals in shaping their society, which is a distinct aspect of freedom}

3a373b71-9625-46a9-badc-abbe96912dbc.content: {Freedom is the absence of interference from others}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act without being obstructed by others}, {Political participation is not necessary for liberty}

bd7bcb77-ce2e-4c6b-bc6a-d3cafdb05889.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination by others}, {Liberty is present when individuals are not subject to arbitrary power}, {Political participation is not necessary for liberty}

cb3871de-51a0-42b7-b122-6f6389fdae4f.content: {Freedom is the ability to make one's own choices}, {Liberty is present when individuals can pursue their own goals}, {Political participation is not necessary for liberty}

c1c0c3c5-371f-4c28-b7b1-e5d13a423184.content: {Freedom is the ability to achieve one's potential}, {Liberty is present when individuals can develop their capabilities}, {Political participation is not necessary for liberty}

d9be01a2-bde6-436e-a427-1820331a1bd5.content: {Freedom is the availability of opportunities to pursue one's goals}, {Liberty is present when individuals have access to various life paths}, {Political participation is not necessary for liberty}

f0fc0b49-f46a-4673-bdc8-1055ae74c656.content: {Freedom is the absence of constraints on action}, {Liberty is present when individuals are not restricted by external barriers}, {Political participation is not necessary for liberty}

c5d46570-d3d5-459e-b1a7-ae2e69c892a6.content: {Freedom is the state of being self-reliant}, {Liberty is present when individuals can live independently}, {Political participation is not necessary for liberty}

6047b2ed-f8e0-4101-8670-50b0f1044656.content: {Freedom is the capacity to achieve valuable outcomes}, {Liberty is present when individuals have the means to pursue what they value}, {Political participation is not necessary for liberty}

d32e0295-c9a8-4067-99ca-dc6129594ad7.content: {Freedom is the ability to act according to one's moral values}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make ethical choices}, {Political participation is not necessary for liberty}

0b512595-397f-4fc7-8667-add4c3d586d5.content: {Freedom is the absence of internal psychological barriers}, {Liberty is present when individuals are free from mental constraints}, {Political participation is not necessary for liberty}

8e7413b9-1956-4f27-a3dd-e3262e78e485.summary: Distinguishing between active and passive political participation
8e7413b9-1956-4f27-a3dd-e3262e78e485.content: {There is a distinction between active and passive political participation}, {Freedom as political participation is a theory about active participation rather than passive participation}, {An individual who chooses not to engage actively in political processes still possesses passive political participation by virtue of having the option to participate}, {Liberty is maintained as long as the option for political participation exists, regardless of personal interest}

c67ad45d-0331-42d8-acb4-6236665d250d.summary: Rejecting the necessity of political interest for liberty
c67ad45d-0331-42d8-acb4-6236665d250d.content: {It is false that liberty is dependent on an individual's interest in political participation}, {Liberty is defined by the availability of political participation, not by the individual's desire to engage in it}, {An individual can possess liberty even if they choose not to exercise their political participation rights}

e7caead3-b92f-4685-91a1-4791a8a270c9.summary: Supplementing with the concept of potential political engagement
e7caead3-b92f-4685-91a1-4791a8a270c9.content: {Potential political engagement is the capacity to participate in political processes if desired}, {Liberty is preserved as long as individuals have the potential to engage politically, even if they choose not to}, {The presence of potential political engagement ensures that liberty is not contingent on actual political interest}

9e12e3d8-ce05-47f9-b8ac-f3cdc6f9cdc7.summary: Freedom as Genuine Influence in Political Participation
9e12e3d8-ce05-47f9-b8ac-f3cdc6f9cdc7.content: {Freedom is the ability to participate in political processes}, {Political participation involves engaging in decision-making within a community}, {Liberty is present when individuals have genuine influence over the governance of their society}

b84e24f2-3e21-484d-8b9a-3cfcd70c35b1.content: {Freedom is the ability to participate in political processes}, {Political participation involves engaging in decision-making within a community}, {Liberty is present when individuals have effective influence in the governance of their society}

eabbae69-836d-403a-af85-926b3c8d2764.content: {Freedom is the ability to participate in political processes}, {Political participation involves engaging in decision-making within a community}, {Liberty is present when individuals are empowered to influence the governance of their society}

a0f84a4c-5301-4bed-8102-c92e2d376e04.content: {Freedom is the ability to participate in political processes}, {Political participation involves engaging in decision-making within a community}, {Liberty is present when individuals have meaningful influence in the governance of their society}

a25501ed-4124-44e1-bcb3-1a67b5a4820b.content: {Freedom is the ability to participate in political processes}, {Political participation involves engaging in decision-making within a community}, {Liberty is present when individuals have substantive influence over the governance of their society}

e4fadea8-6c75-4096-8b54-a929556abd13.content: {There is a distinction between mere participation and meaningful participation}, {Freedom as political participation is a theory about meaningful participation rather than mere participation}, {Mere participation without influence does not fulfill the criteria of meaningful participation}, {The intuition that individuals are not free when they have no influence can be explained by the lack of meaningful participation}

e98462fd-c081-465a-9a5f-c933a4bd37c9.summary: Rejecting the necessity of influence for freedom
e98462fd-c081-465a-9a5f-c933a4bd37c9.content: {It is false that genuine influence is necessary for freedom}, {Freedom can be understood as the opportunity to participate, regardless of the outcome}, {The value of political participation lies in the process itself, not necessarily in the influence over outcomes}

d9168993-ad09-4a3e-bb9d-0bf4931c05f3.summary: Supplementing with a condition of procedural fairness
d9168993-ad09-4a3e-bb9d-0bf4931c05f3.content: {Procedural fairness is a supplementary condition for freedom}, {Political participation must occur within a framework of fair procedures to ensure freedom}, {The lack of influence is mitigated by the fairness of the decision-making process}

18f7a4e5-6d02-4e62-a3c6-f75a4363cebb.summary: Freedom as Political and Personal Autonomy
18f7a4e5-6d02-4e62-a3c6-f75a4363cebb.content: {Freedom is the ability to participate in political processes}, {Political participation involves engaging in decision-making within a community}, {Liberty is present when individuals have a voice in the governance of their society}, {Freedom also includes personal autonomy and self-determination}, {Personal autonomy involves making choices about one's own life independent of political processes}

87b0b47f-8147-4034-859f-753fa33fd981.summary: Freedom as Political Participation and Non-Interference
87b0b47f-8147-4034-859f-753fa33fd981.content: {Freedom is the ability to participate in political processes}, {Political participation involves engaging in decision-making within a community}, {Liberty is present when individuals have a voice in the governance of their society}, {Freedom also includes the absence of interference in personal choices}, {Non-interference means individuals can make personal decisions without external constraints}

c25b16c2-7825-4a5c-b4d7-3d45bc0354cd.summary: Freedom as Political Participation and Positive Liberty
c25b16c2-7825-4a5c-b4d7-3d45bc0354cd.content: {Freedom is the ability to participate in political processes}, {Political participation involves engaging in decision-making within a community}, {Liberty is present when individuals have a voice in the governance of their society}, {Freedom also includes positive liberty, which is the capacity to act upon one's free will}, {Positive liberty involves having the resources and opportunities to pursue one's goals}

35de4db5-b1ae-4580-9080-6b49cc9e7dd2.summary: Freedom as Political Participation and Negative Liberty
35de4db5-b1ae-4580-9080-6b49cc9e7dd2.content: {Freedom is the ability to participate in political processes}, {Political participation involves engaging in decision-making within a community}, {Liberty is present when individuals have a voice in the governance of their society}, {Freedom also includes negative liberty, which is the absence of obstacles to individual actions}, {Negative liberty involves being free from coercion and interference by others}

efb4aaa8-e8e5-439b-b8d7-8f2d76e56b09.summary: Freedom as Political Participation and Self-Realization
efb4aaa8-e8e5-439b-b8d7-8f2d76e56b09.content: {Freedom is the ability to participate in political processes}, {Political participation involves engaging in decision-making within a community}, {Liberty is present when individuals have a voice in the governance of their society}, {Freedom also includes self-realization, which is the fulfillment of one's potential}, {Self-realization involves pursuing personal growth and achieving one's aspirations}

fcab69b9-ec58-4ca9-91f3-5783860e2954.summary: Distinguishing between political and personal freedom
fcab69b9-ec58-4ca9-91f3-5783860e2954.content: {There is a distinction between political freedom and personal freedom}, {Freedom as political participation is a theory specifically about political freedom}, {The inability to participate in political processes does not negate the presence of personal freedom}, {The intuition that freedom includes personal autonomy can be explained by recognizing different domains of freedom}

a35c981c-bdbc-470c-88f8-f35818064159.summary: Rejecting the reduction of freedom to a single domain
a35c981c-bdbc-470c-88f8-f35818064159.content: {It is false that freedom must be entirely reduced to political participation}, {Freedom as political participation focuses on one essential aspect of freedom, not the entirety of it}, {The presence of personal autonomy is compatible with the absence of political participation}

03a13f51-6679-458b-a8f2-2d643376eaae.summary: Supplementing with a broader conception of freedom
03a13f51-6679-458b-a8f2-2d643376eaae.content: {Freedom involves multiple dimensions, including political and personal aspects}, {Political participation is one crucial dimension of freedom, but not the only one}, {The objection loses its force when freedom is understood as a multi-faceted concept}

2719217a-5a65-4542-afea-46e252512e68.summary: Freedom as Political and Personal Autonomy
2719217a-5a65-4542-afea-46e252512e68.content: {Freedom is the ability to participate in political processes}, {Political participation involves engaging in decision-making within a community}, {Liberty is present when individuals have a voice in the governance of their society}, {Liberty requires personal autonomy in addition to political participation}, {Personal autonomy involves the ability to make choices about one's own life without undue interference}

789a7ffc-7f9a-405d-b3c1-502df50103e3.content: {Freedom is the ability to participate in political processes}, {Political participation involves engaging in decision-making within a community}, {Liberty is present when individuals have a voice in the governance of their society}, {Liberty requires the capacity for self-determination in both public and private spheres}, {Self-determination involves having control over one's own actions and decisions}

700e22ea-9bd1-44e9-9394-e38ced162d25.content: {Freedom is the ability to participate in political processes}, {Political participation involves engaging in decision-making within a community}, {Liberty is present when individuals have a voice in the governance of their society}, {Liberty requires participation in both political and personal decision-making processes}, {Personal decision-making involves having a say in matters that affect one's personal life}

24d716a5-1090-4683-92a9-5319f68a0c51.summary: Freedom as Integrated Political and Personal Rights
24d716a5-1090-4683-92a9-5319f68a0c51.content: {Freedom is the ability to participate in political processes}, {Political participation involves engaging in decision-making within a community}, {Liberty is present when individuals have a voice in the governance of their society}, {Liberty requires the protection of both political and personal rights}, {Personal rights include freedoms related to privacy, expression, and lifestyle choices}

7ad4e27b-de81-4e94-b149-5bc64992c04e.summary: Freedom as Balanced Political and Personal Freedom
7ad4e27b-de81-4e94-b149-5bc64992c04e.content: {Freedom is the ability to participate in political processes}, {Political participation involves engaging in decision-making within a community}, {Liberty is present when individuals have a voice in the governance of their society}, {Liberty requires a balance between political freedom and personal freedom}, {Personal freedom involves the absence of constraints on individual lifestyle and choices}

93c9ac57-2ace-499b-a3b7-c9359da788c7.summary: Distinguishing between political and personal freedom
93c9ac57-2ace-499b-a3b7-c9359da788c7.content: {There is a distinction between political freedom and personal freedom}, {Freedom as political participation is a theory specifically about political freedom}, {Political participation ensures political freedom but does not necessarily guarantee personal freedom}, {The intuition that individuals are not fully free with restricted personal lives can be explained by the absence of personal freedom, not political freedom}

f45b9343-63ba-404e-8ab2-304559aaa777.summary: Rejecting the principle that liberty requires both political and personal freedoms
f45b9343-63ba-404e-8ab2-304559aaa777.content: {It is false that liberty necessarily involves both political and personal freedoms}, {Political participation is sufficient for achieving political freedom, which is a form of liberty}, {The presence of political freedom can be considered a distinct and valuable form of liberty even if personal freedoms are restricted}

2bc06bc6-f761-40fd-bc26-2590efa91a28.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of separate domains of freedom
2bc06bc6-f761-40fd-bc26-2590efa91a28.content: {Freedom can be divided into separate domains, such as political and personal}, {Political participation ensures freedom within the political domain}, {The objection loses its force when recognizing that liberty in one domain does not imply liberty in all domains}, {The intuition that individuals are not fully free is due to conflating different domains of freedom}

c897aac4-e22b-48af-ad01-83c1d149b216.content: {Freedom is the ability to participate effectively in political processes}, {Political participation involves engaging in decision-making within a community}, {Liberty is present when individuals have an effective voice in the governance of their society}

018e2d2f-244c-4d70-9644-ec01aa887125.content: {Freedom is the ability to influence political processes}, {Political participation involves engaging in decision-making within a community}, {Liberty is present when individuals can influence the governance of their society}

7551116d-aa5a-4c5b-b10b-37c62b8dcbfe.content: {Freedom is the ability to hold political leaders accountable}, {Political participation involves engaging in decision-making within a community}, {Liberty is present when individuals can ensure their voices are considered in governance}

90aa71d7-6d1c-4c33-9da5-7d632cf8db88.content: {Freedom is the ability to engage in deliberative political processes}, {Political participation involves engaging in decision-making within a community}, {Liberty is present when individuals can participate in meaningful deliberation in governance}

0cba6a0d-57ff-4f99-ad5f-f6869d9879c8.content: {Freedom is the ability to be represented in political processes}, {Political participation involves engaging in decision-making within a community}, {Liberty is present when individuals have representatives who ensure their voices are heard in governance}

b707a841-1fa6-4428-84c0-4bbc12104228.content: {Freedom is the ability to participate equally in political processes}, {Political participation involves engaging in decision-making within a community}, {Liberty is present when individuals have equal opportunities to influence governance}

bded37e3-10a2-411e-b01b-96a2238b7f28.content: {Freedom is the ability to participate in responsive political processes}, {Political participation involves engaging in decision-making within a community}, {Liberty is present when governance is responsive to the voices of individuals}

fd77ff96-7ee8-4528-94d0-2185e15a7e6d.content: {Freedom is the ability to be empowered in political processes}, {Political participation involves engaging in decision-making within a community}, {Liberty is present when individuals are empowered to have their voices heard in governance}

c67f435d-9412-49e0-84b5-fa1939388187.content: {Freedom is the ability to engage actively in political processes}, {Political participation involves engaging in decision-making within a community}, {Liberty is present when individuals are actively engaged in governance}

2ac0b8ec-6b0f-474c-887c-b8cafcc5d4fb.content: {Freedom is the ability to be included in political processes}, {Political participation involves engaging in decision-making within a community}, {Liberty is present when individuals are included in the governance of their society}

2cf1cbc5-6b4a-4e46-8182-4ea0ea4127d7.content: {There is a distinction between mere participation and effective participation in political processes}, {Freedom as political participation is concerned with effective participation, which includes being heard}, {Mere participation without influence does not fulfill the criteria of having a voice in governance}, {The objection confuses mere participation with effective participation, which is necessary for true political freedom}

4da5f00b-fae2-4698-905b-f4f003c78e20.summary: Rejecting the intuition that participation without being heard is meaningless
4da5f00b-fae2-4698-905b-f4f003c78e20.content: {It is false that political participation is meaningless if individuals are not heard}, {Participation itself is a form of expression and engagement that contributes to political freedom}, {The value of participation lies in the opportunity to engage, regardless of immediate influence}, {The objection mistakenly assumes that being heard is the sole measure of having a voice in governance}

1e359f7b-18ad-498a-8bb8-f548cf8b6e8b.summary: Supplementing with a requirement for accountability
1e359f7b-18ad-498a-8bb8-f548cf8b6e8b.content: {Political participation requires a supplementary assumption of accountability from those in power}, {Accountability ensures that participation leads to being heard and having influence}, {The objection loses its force when political systems include mechanisms for holding leaders accountable to participants}, {Freedom as political participation is maintained when accountability is present}

408b6603-e3d5-4cae-9aeb-29d95bb76954.content: {Freedom is the ability to act according to one's own will}, {Liberty is present when individuals have personal autonomy}, {Political participation is not necessary for liberty}

4742c5bb-1f1e-489a-901f-c994a321a9ad.content: {Freedom is the absence of interference from others}, {Liberty is present when individuals are free from coercion}, {Political participation is not required for liberty}

8c8cf0b8-b5ec-4a3d-b1fe-ac02a6fca82e.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination by others}, {Liberty is present when individuals are not subject to arbitrary power}, {Political participation is one way, but not the only way, to achieve liberty}

0da48283-0c78-485f-805e-89d7dcc5d85c.content: {Freedom is the ability to pursue one's own goals and self-development}, {Liberty is present when individuals can achieve self-realization}, {Political participation is not essential for liberty}

04c92591-2c56-4af1-b4bb-014d28a225b6.content: {Freedom is the ability to make moral choices independently}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act according to their moral beliefs}, {Political participation is not necessary for liberty}

72461eba-9ca2-4f15-a6d9-f50ca01627c9.content: {Freedom is the availability of opportunities to pursue one's interests}, {Liberty is present when individuals have a range of opportunities}, {Political participation is not required for liberty}

eb86fae8-0631-4f0d-909a-5e3af6ccc297.content: {Freedom is the capability to achieve valuable outcomes}, {Liberty is present when individuals have the capabilities to pursue their goals}, {Political participation is not necessary for liberty}

0017c0ec-2182-43e9-9414-2b2c136294b3.content: {Freedom is the absence of constraints on action}, {Liberty is present when individuals are not constrained by external forces}, {Political participation is not required for liberty}

5e605ea1-fe4f-40f6-99b1-abc0fea2e3fc.content: {Freedom is the state of inner peace and contentment}, {Liberty is present when individuals achieve inner tranquility}, {Political participation is not necessary for liberty}

fe5eb8d0-8d86-4e19-91f4-19057fa27edc.content: {Freedom is the ability to express oneself creatively}, {Liberty is present when individuals can engage in creative activities}, {Political participation is not required for liberty}

4c9ea48d-e8d0-483b-990d-624f86472247.summary: Distinguishing between political and personal liberty
4c9ea48d-e8d0-483b-990d-624f86472247.content: {There is a distinction between political liberty and personal liberty}, {Freedom as political participation is a theory about political liberty rather than personal liberty}, {An individual can possess personal liberty without political liberty if they have autonomy and freedom from coercion}, {The intuition that someone without a voice in governance lacks liberty can be explained as a confusion between political liberty and personal liberty}

fc1e1bda-5019-4c50-ac4c-53747f24833f.summary: Rejecting the necessity of political participation for liberty
fc1e1bda-5019-4c50-ac4c-53747f24833f.content: {It is false that liberty requires direct involvement in governance}, {Liberty can be understood as having multiple dimensions, including personal autonomy and freedom from coercion}, {An individual can possess liberty through personal autonomy even without political participation}

4a2e6ad2-99cf-4c52-b6c9-376216ad0566.summary: Supplementing with a broader conception of liberty
4a2e6ad2-99cf-4c52-b6c9-376216ad0566.content: {Liberty can be understood as a broader concept that includes both political participation and personal autonomy}, {Freedom as political participation focuses on one aspect of liberty, which is political engagement}, {An individual can possess liberty through personal autonomy, which complements the political aspect of liberty}

47c0a2a4-ad10-4534-b50d-34746d31ff63.summary: Freedom as Political and Personal Autonomy
47c0a2a4-ad10-4534-b50d-34746d31ff63.content: {Freedom is the ability to participate in political processes}, {Political participation involves engaging in decision-making within a community}, {Liberty is present when individuals have a voice in the governance of their society}, {Freedom also requires personal autonomy and the absence of significant personal restrictions}

8074d039-51d8-4d01-83df-b8d2f9b41ffb.content: {Freedom is the ability to participate in political processes}, {Political participation involves engaging in decision-making within a community}, {Liberty is present when individuals have a voice in the governance of their society}, {Freedom includes both political participation and personal freedom from surveillance}

e54837f6-1891-4ab1-b04d-317fe0838bb7.content: {Freedom is the ability to participate in political processes}, {Political participation involves engaging in decision-making within a community}, {Liberty is present when individuals have a voice in the governance of their society}, {Freedom requires both political engagement and personal freedom from coercion}

7cf4666e-87ea-47a9-9c75-3926e1cae0bb.summary: Freedom as Integrated Political and Personal Freedom
7cf4666e-87ea-47a9-9c75-3926e1cae0bb.content: {Freedom is the ability to participate in political processes}, {Political participation involves engaging in decision-making within a community}, {Liberty is present when individuals have a voice in the governance of their society}, {Freedom necessitates both political participation and personal freedom from undue restrictions}

ca08871c-18f6-4f17-a1a3-3e232c2ceb29.summary: Freedom as Political Participation with Personal Rights
ca08871c-18f6-4f17-a1a3-3e232c2ceb29.content: {Freedom is the ability to participate in political processes}, {Political participation involves engaging in decision-making within a community}, {Liberty is present when individuals have a voice in the governance of their society}, {Freedom is contingent upon both political participation and the protection of personal rights}

cbd95340-207f-4bdd-9b6a-cf0d7a5dc3ad.summary: Distinguishing between political and personal freedom
cbd95340-207f-4bdd-9b6a-cf0d7a5dc3ad.content: {There is a distinction between political freedom and personal freedom}, {Freedom as political participation is a theory about political freedom rather than personal freedom}, {Having a voice in governance addresses political freedom, not personal restrictions}, {The intuition that individuals are not fully free under personal restrictions can be explained by the distinction between political and personal freedom}

41199ef3-dfba-4bf4-a8d6-b12c7f80adc5.summary: Rejecting the equivalence of political voice and complete freedom
41199ef3-dfba-4bf4-a8d6-b12c7f80adc5.content: {It is false that having a voice in governance is equivalent to complete freedom}, {Freedom involves multiple dimensions, including both political and personal aspects}, {The presence of political freedom does not negate the need for personal freedom to achieve full liberty}

2088936a-04a3-4c54-82e4-a59086e7599e.summary: Supplementing with a broader conception of freedom
2088936a-04a3-4c54-82e4-a59086e7599e.content: {Freedom involves both political and personal dimensions}, {Political participation is a necessary but not sufficient condition for full freedom}, {The theory of freedom as political participation can be supplemented with the recognition of personal freedoms to address the objection}

5b4d4d00-34ec-46c5-9602-36477d02062e.content: {Freedom is the ability to participate in political processes}, {Political participation involves engaging in decision-making within a community}, {Liberty is present when individuals have effective influence in the governance of their society}

f8e2ef86-80ae-4caf-8183-42bc671176c7.summary: Freedom as Political Participation with Accountability
f8e2ef86-80ae-4caf-8183-42bc671176c7.content: {Freedom is the ability to participate in political processes}, {Political participation involves engaging in decision-making within a community}, {Liberty is present when individuals have a voice in the governance of their society}, {Political systems must be structured to ensure accountability to participants}

753a5030-e02a-4c16-a88e-b0cd31c2aaba.summary: Freedom as Political Participation with Deliberative Impact
753a5030-e02a-4c16-a88e-b0cd31c2aaba.content: {Freedom is the ability to participate in political processes}, {Political participation involves engaging in decision-making within a community}, {Liberty is present when individuals have a voice in the governance of their society}, {Political participation must include opportunities for deliberative impact on decisions}

a921798f-4f56-4063-bd6f-758e99c7074b.summary: Freedom as Political Participation with Equal Influence
a921798f-4f56-4063-bd6f-758e99c7074b.content: {Freedom is the ability to participate in political processes}, {Political participation involves engaging in decision-making within a community}, {Liberty is present when individuals have a voice in the governance of their society}, {Political systems must ensure equal influence for all participants}

8bdcf0e5-4dd0-40ae-94c8-f07402142973.summary: Freedom as Political Participation with Guaranteed Outcomes
8bdcf0e5-4dd0-40ae-94c8-f07402142973.content: {Freedom is the ability to participate in political processes}, {Political participation involves engaging in decision-making within a community}, {Liberty is present when individuals have a voice in the governance of their society}, {Political participation must guarantee that outcomes reflect the will of the participants}

a305d44a-20fc-4e5a-805c-6752cfcac7f6.content: {There is a distinction between political participation and actual influence on decision-making}, {Freedom as political participation is a theory about the opportunity to engage, not necessarily about the outcome of influence}, {The intuition that participation should lead to influence can be explained by conflating participation with influence}, {Political participation is valuable even if it does not always result in direct decision-making power}

b4548238-1056-48ac-a9e9-f5d1f527dc61.summary: Rejecting the necessity of influence for freedom
b4548238-1056-48ac-a9e9-f5d1f527dc61.content: {It is false that political participation must inherently lead to decision-making power for freedom to be present}, {Freedom as political participation emphasizes the process of engagement rather than the outcome of influence}, {The value of political participation lies in the opportunity to express one's views and engage with the community, not solely in the power to influence decisions}

e24e9051-aebe-4c8b-aa9b-3e407bad934d.summary: Supplementing with a focus on procedural justice
e24e9051-aebe-4c8b-aa9b-3e407bad934d.content: {Procedural justice refers to the fairness of the processes that lead to outcomes}, {Freedom as political participation can be supplemented by emphasizing the importance of fair procedures in political processes}, {Even if individual participation does not lead to direct influence, the fairness of the process ensures that participation is meaningful}, {The objection loses its force when considering that procedural justice can uphold the value of political participation}

a13f1e2a-8093-481e-9a75-1e8f72a1023e.summary: Freedom as Political and Personal Autonomy
a13f1e2a-8093-481e-9a75-1e8f72a1023e.content: {Freedom is the ability to participate in political processes}, {Political participation involves engaging in decision-making within a community}, {Liberty is present when individuals have a voice in the governance of their society}, {Freedom includes the ability to make personal choices about one's life}, {Personal autonomy is a necessary component of freedom}

f34d84f1-12a8-4e1e-ba94-937f741b73cd.summary: Freedom as Political Participation and Individual Rights
f34d84f1-12a8-4e1e-ba94-937f741b73cd.content: {Freedom is the ability to participate in political processes}, {Political participation involves engaging in decision-making within a community}, {Liberty is present when individuals have a voice in the governance of their society}, {Freedom includes the protection of individual rights}, {Individual rights ensure personal liberties and the pursuit of personal goals}

3003f600-1944-4c3b-b6e4-1d86357f5070.summary: Freedom as Political Engagement and Personal Choice
3003f600-1944-4c3b-b6e4-1d86357f5070.content: {Freedom is the ability to participate in political processes}, {Political participation involves engaging in decision-making within a community}, {Liberty is present when individuals have a voice in the governance of their society}, {Freedom requires the capacity for personal choice}, {Personal choice is essential for an individual's freedom}

d391f0ca-2bfc-4cd6-bf07-6712bdeea262.summary: Freedom as Dual Aspects of Political and Personal Freedom
d391f0ca-2bfc-4cd6-bf07-6712bdeea262.content: {Freedom is the ability to participate in political processes}, {Political participation involves engaging in decision-making within a community}, {Liberty is present when individuals have a voice in the governance of their society}, {Freedom also encompasses personal freedom}, {Personal freedom includes the ability to pursue one's own goals}

ed1d6530-6561-455f-a85b-f9c2be62b775.summary: Freedom as Political Involvement and Personal Agency
ed1d6530-6561-455f-a85b-f9c2be62b775.content: {Freedom is the ability to participate in political processes}, {Political participation involves engaging in decision-making within a community}, {Liberty is present when individuals have a voice in the governance of their society}, {Freedom includes personal agency}, {Personal agency is the capacity to act independently and make free choices}

6ef81e47-26cb-48e2-a0a0-ec085a8d59ea.summary: Distinguishing between political and personal freedom
6ef81e47-26cb-48e2-a0a0-ec085a8d59ea.content: {There is a distinction between political freedom and personal freedom}, {Freedom as political participation is a theory specifically about political freedom}, {Political freedom is concerned with the ability to engage in governance and decision-making}, {Personal freedom involves the ability to make choices about one's own life}, {The objection confuses political freedom with personal freedom, which are distinct concepts}

913361a6-2fb0-4606-b799-e2b89c7bf636.summary: Rejecting the intuition that political engagement excludes personal freedom
913361a6-2fb0-4606-b799-e2b89c7bf636.content: {It is false that political engagement necessarily excludes personal freedom}, {Political participation can enhance personal freedom by providing individuals with a say in the laws and policies that affect their personal lives}, {The intuition that political engagement is insufficient for freedom overlooks the interconnectedness of political and personal liberties}

27947bb8-6b09-4407-8b28-3bbb0caf16b4.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of interconnected freedoms
27947bb8-6b09-4407-8b28-3bbb0caf16b4.content: {Political freedom and personal freedom are interconnected and mutually reinforcing}, {Engagement in political processes can lead to greater personal liberties by influencing societal norms and laws}, {The assumption that political participation contributes to personal freedom addresses the objection that political engagement alone is insufficient for full freedom}

0108c587-420b-4df0-a859-0a7052abc380.content: {Freedom is having economic independence}, {Economic independence involves having the resources to support oneself}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can sustain themselves without reliance on others}, {Freedom includes political autonomy, which involves the ability to participate in political processes}, {Freedom includes social autonomy, which involves the ability to engage freely in social interactions}, {Freedom includes personal autonomy, which involves the ability to make personal life choices without coercion}

0c29d0a5-fc92-4e6a-a08d-b60697e90dac.content: {Freedom is having economic independence}, {Economic independence involves having the resources to support oneself}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can sustain themselves without reliance on others}, {Freedom includes the ability to express oneself freely}, {Freedom includes the ability to move freely without restrictions}, {Freedom includes the ability to associate with others freely}

7fa9946c-100a-4d1f-b532-9fc4ec99ec17.content: {Freedom is having economic independence}, {Economic independence involves having the resources to support oneself}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can sustain themselves without reliance on others}, {Freedom includes the ability to make decisions about one's own life}, {Freedom includes the ability to access information freely}, {Freedom includes the ability to participate in cultural and community activities}

fd8ae62d-7e9d-4a75-9c73-ab904e21347d.content: {Freedom is having economic independence}, {Economic independence involves having the resources to support oneself}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can sustain themselves without reliance on others}, {Freedom includes empowerment in political contexts}, {Freedom includes empowerment in social contexts}, {Freedom includes empowerment in personal contexts}

8c6bff28-f713-4c9d-87fa-6b209c22954b.content: {Freedom is having economic independence}, {Economic independence involves having the resources to support oneself}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can sustain themselves without reliance on others}, {Freedom includes the right to participate in democratic processes}, {Freedom includes the right to engage in social relationships of one's choosing}, {Freedom includes the right to pursue personal goals and aspirations}

3f91d666-4ef0-4bb2-9641-b656189fd481.summary: Distinguishing between economic and comprehensive freedom
3f91d666-4ef0-4bb2-9641-b656189fd481.content: {There is a distinction between economic freedom and comprehensive freedom, which includes political, social, and personal dimensions}, {Freedom as economic independence is a theory about economic freedom rather than comprehensive freedom}, {Economic independence is a necessary but not sufficient condition for comprehensive freedom}, {A person with economic independence under a repressive regime is economically free but not comprehensively free}, {The intuition that someone is not truly free under a repressive regime can be explained as confusion between economic freedom and comprehensive freedom}

6aae25bb-fa09-4089-ba9a-d71788ab9ea3.summary: Rejecting the intuition that economic independence is insufficient for freedom
6aae25bb-fa09-4089-ba9a-d71788ab9ea3.content: {It is false that economic independence is insufficient for true freedom}, {Economic independence provides the foundation for other forms of freedom, such as political and social freedom}, {The appearance of lacking freedom under a repressive regime is due to external constraints, not the inadequacy of economic independence}, {Economic independence is the primary form of freedom, and other freedoms are derivative}

cf84c270-4c77-4022-b10a-b8a096625589.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of minimal political rights
cf84c270-4c77-4022-b10a-b8a096625589.content: {Economic independence requires a supplementary assumption of minimal political rights to ensure true freedom}, {Minimal political rights include freedom of speech and movement}, {With the assumption of minimal political rights, economic independence becomes sufficient for true freedom}, {The scenario of a person with economic independence under a repressive regime is addressed by ensuring these minimal political rights}

6d2d5393-c867-4bec-8e0d-c49373f66aa1.summary: Freedom as Economic and Social Independence
6d2d5393-c867-4bec-8e0d-c49373f66aa1.content: {Freedom is having both economic and social independence}, {Economic independence involves having the resources to support oneself}, {Social independence involves having meaningful relationships and social connections}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can sustain themselves without reliance on others and have meaningful social connections}

ba344b8c-31f6-4fd6-849a-3f1b5ce9769c.summary: Freedom as Economic Independence with Social Flourishing
ba344b8c-31f6-4fd6-849a-3f1b5ce9769c.content: {Freedom is having economic independence}, {Economic independence involves having the resources to support oneself}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can sustain themselves without reliance on others}, {True liberty also requires opportunities for social flourishing and meaningful relationships}

e25db5ef-9dd8-4ff8-b317-c1d192be2d9e.content: {Freedom is having comprehensive independence}, {Comprehensive independence includes economic independence and social well-being}, {Economic independence involves having the resources to support oneself}, {Social well-being involves having meaningful relationships and social engagement}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can sustain themselves and have fulfilling social lives}

4dd5f18d-2110-4940-85ad-8e98f1f98f7a.summary: Freedom as Economic Independence with Social Capability
4dd5f18d-2110-4940-85ad-8e98f1f98f7a.content: {Freedom is having economic independence}, {Economic independence involves having the resources to support oneself}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can sustain themselves without reliance on others}, {True liberty also requires the capability to form and maintain meaningful social relationships}

081e0b42-c779-4572-9cce-231a31ad83d5.summary: Freedom as Economic Independence with Social Autonomy
081e0b42-c779-4572-9cce-231a31ad83d5.content: {Freedom is having economic independence}, {Economic independence involves having the resources to support oneself}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can sustain themselves without reliance on others}, {True liberty also requires social autonomy, which includes the ability to engage in meaningful social interactions}

8d97de0d-be12-4206-a4a8-330627ca1a92.summary: Distinguishing between economic and social freedom
8d97de0d-be12-4206-a4a8-330627ca1a92.content: {There is a distinction between economic freedom and social freedom}, {Freedom as economic independence is a theory about economic freedom rather than social freedom}, {Economic independence does not address social isolation, which is a separate aspect of freedom}, {A person with economic independence is free in the economic sense, even if they lack social connections}, {The intuition that social isolation undermines freedom can be explained as a confusion between economic and social freedom}

b58823fa-28a4-4508-a1f2-5f1302b91d3b.summary: Rejecting the necessity of social connections for liberty
b58823fa-28a4-4508-a1f2-5f1302b91d3b.content: {It is false that meaningful relationships are necessary for liberty}, {Liberty can be understood as the absence of economic dependence, regardless of social connections}, {A person with economic independence is free because they are not reliant on others for their sustenance}, {The lack of social connections does not negate the state of being economically independent}

0746464b-0619-4504-abcf-ad391304eb21.summary: Supplementing with a broader conception of well-being
0746464b-0619-4504-abcf-ad391304eb21.content: {Economic independence is a necessary but not sufficient condition for overall well-being}, {Liberty as economic independence focuses on one aspect of well-being, namely self-sufficiency}, {Social connections contribute to well-being but are not part of the definition of economic liberty}, {The appearance of lacking freedom due to social isolation is explained by considering well-being as a broader concept than liberty}

6e910313-a51a-4d21-8d6d-08a0dd7fd393.content: {Freedom is having economic self-sufficiency}, {Economic self-sufficiency involves having the resources to support oneself}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can sustain themselves without involuntary reliance on others}

804893e8-d980-4350-b0cf-9838310d66d0.content: {Freedom is having economic empowerment}, {Economic empowerment involves having the resources and opportunities to make choices}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can make economic choices without coercion}

5415d740-86b6-4edd-ba5e-4a6f5a2b1bd0.content: {Freedom is having the ability to engage in voluntary economic cooperation}, {Voluntary economic cooperation involves mutual agreements that benefit all parties}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can choose to cooperate economically without coercion}

23220552-c8c9-49fa-8981-2a45e6347518.content: {Freedom is having economic autonomy}, {Economic autonomy involves having control over one's economic resources}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can manage their economic resources independently}

6c1b6573-9cf1-4be8-9b3f-c3e8ffdb9127.content: {Freedom is having economic choice}, {Economic choice involves having multiple options for economic engagement}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can choose among economic options without external constraints}

015a494e-0292-4a27-9870-e55aab9aee57.content: {There is a distinction between economic reliance and emotional or social reliance}, {Freedom as economic independence is concerned with economic reliance, not emotional or social reliance}, {Voluntary emotional support does not undermine economic independence}, {Mutual reliance for companionship is not a threat to economic freedom}

5de63d26-f95f-4088-94d8-5613feb46be4.summary: Rejecting the intuition that all reliance is equal
5de63d26-f95f-4088-94d8-5613feb46be4.content: {It is false that all forms of reliance undermine freedom}, {Economic reliance specifically undermines the ability to sustain oneself independently}, {Voluntary emotional reliance does not equate to economic dependence}, {The intuition that mutual reliance enhances freedom does not apply to economic contexts}

e3d128f7-7cea-427d-acac-806b7261b371.summary: Supplementing with the concept of voluntary choice
e3d128f7-7cea-427d-acac-806b7261b371.content: {Freedom involves the ability to make voluntary choices}, {Economic independence allows for voluntary choices in economic matters}, {Voluntary reliance on others for emotional support is a choice that does not affect economic independence}, {The ability to choose reliance in non-economic areas is consistent with economic freedom}

15b44a2f-249d-4f70-9d66-8f9dd1a8dcbe.content: {Freedom is having economic security}, {Economic security involves having stable access to necessary resources}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals have guaranteed access to resources regardless of external economic changes}

592fdbbd-dc51-4ac5-a9e0-9d6ca0fa9ac7.content: {Freedom is having economic resilience}, {Economic resilience involves the ability to adapt to economic changes}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can maintain their well-being despite economic fluctuations}

b2899452-4610-43dc-acc4-d4622309ad8d.content: {Freedom is having economic autonomy}, {Economic autonomy involves making independent economic decisions}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can make economic choices without coercion}

d0e3f4c4-39c6-43ce-aa49-e47a72519ff3.content: {Freedom is having economic sufficiency}, {Economic sufficiency involves having enough resources to meet basic needs}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals have enough resources to live without undue hardship}

2650af81-d2fc-44c4-98cf-b659e94a2aaf.content: {Freedom is having economic empowerment}, {Economic empowerment involves having control over one's economic resources}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can manage their resources to pursue personal goals}

4a43b2e2-61d6-4da5-8a8f-eff9d61ad146.content: {Freedom is having economic stability}, {Economic stability involves consistent access to resources over time}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals are not subject to sudden economic deprivation}

d34b47a5-d34e-49d0-822b-78a54d22fcbc.content: {Freedom is having economic opportunity}, {Economic opportunity involves access to resources for personal development}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can pursue economic advancement without barriers}

539acb9e-0d50-455c-bb74-7fff1a517fca.content: {Freedom is having economic self-sufficiency}, {Economic self-sufficiency involves generating one's own resources}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can produce what they need without external dependency}

b02bed87-3a44-4ebe-bef8-822d3896312d.content: {Freedom is having economic participation}, {Economic participation involves engaging in economic systems}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can actively contribute to and benefit from the economy}

46411451-3253-470b-a23c-c1d056444fbc.content: {Freedom is having economic access}, {Economic access involves the ability to obtain necessary resources}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can access resources without discrimination or exclusion}

84f081ca-0956-40e4-8184-9b492ef9db19.summary: Distinguishing between absolute and practical economic independence
84f081ca-0956-40e4-8184-9b492ef9db19.content: {There is a distinction between absolute economic independence and practical economic independence}, {Freedom as economic independence is a theory about practical economic independence rather than absolute independence}, {Practical economic independence involves having sufficient resources to support oneself despite external influences}, {A person can be considered economically independent if they can sustain themselves without direct reliance on specific others, even if influenced by broader economic systems}

b442b4ae-83dd-4afe-b7f2-af7e326e8422.summary: Rejecting the impossibility of economic independence
b442b4ae-83dd-4afe-b7f2-af7e326e8422.content: {It is false that economic independence requires complete detachment from all external influences}, {Economic independence can be understood as having control over one's resources and decisions, even within an interconnected system}, {The intuition that one is not independent due to market and regulatory influences is mistaken, as these do not negate the ability to sustain oneself}

5282912a-8578-4e08-8299-d84ca6052d5d.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of relative independence
