5282912a-8578-4e08-8299-d84ca6052d5d.content: {Economic independence can be understood in terms of relative independence rather than absolute independence}, {Relative independence involves having the capacity to make economic decisions without undue reliance on specific external entities}, {The appearance of dependence due to market and regulatory influences is mitigated by the ability to adapt and sustain oneself within those constraints}

1d898e51-6388-4781-8a29-97cee629085d.summary: Freedom as Economic and Political Independence
1d898e51-6388-4781-8a29-97cee629085d.content: {Freedom is having economic independence}, {Economic independence involves having the resources to support oneself}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can sustain themselves without reliance on others}, {Freedom requires the ability to participate in democratic processes}

f33f9a14-c6ed-471e-a418-fd95f4b91d70.content: {Freedom is having economic independence}, {Economic independence involves having the resources to support oneself}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can sustain themselves without reliance on others}, {Freedom requires autonomy in personal decision-making}, {Autonomy includes the ability to participate in political and social institutions}

62fe75f0-b6a8-476a-8c49-737ff3a4a1b3.summary: Freedom as Economic Independence with Political Rights
62fe75f0-b6a8-476a-8c49-737ff3a4a1b3.content: {Freedom is having economic independence}, {Economic independence involves having the resources to support oneself}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can sustain themselves without reliance on others}, {Freedom includes having political rights and the ability to exercise them}

46689e85-6b0a-4534-bafd-9168d32c3d7b.summary: Freedom as Economic Independence and Social Participation
46689e85-6b0a-4534-bafd-9168d32c3d7b.content: {Freedom is having economic independence}, {Economic independence involves having the resources to support oneself}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can sustain themselves without reliance on others}, {Freedom requires the ability to participate in social and community activities}

c98929d5-3def-4a6a-9b9d-8ac19e9e0cf1.summary: Freedom as Economic Independence and Civic Engagement
c98929d5-3def-4a6a-9b9d-8ac19e9e0cf1.content: {Freedom is having economic independence}, {Economic independence involves having the resources to support oneself}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can sustain themselves without reliance on others}, {Freedom requires active engagement in civic duties and responsibilities}

07dc27c8-22d3-4505-9190-928313145c37.summary: Distinguishing between economic and political freedom
07dc27c8-22d3-4505-9190-928313145c37.content: {There is a distinction between economic freedom and political freedom}, {Freedom as economic independence is a theory about economic freedom rather than political freedom}, {A person can be economically independent and still lack political freedom}, {The intuition that political participation is necessary for liberty can be explained as a confusion between economic and political freedom}

f5303ee5-f91e-4f05-b41d-8e732b9d43db.summary: Rejecting the necessity of political participation for liberty
f5303ee5-f91e-4f05-b41d-8e732b9d43db.content: {It is false that political participation is necessary for liberty}, {Economic independence is sufficient for a form of liberty focused on self-sufficiency}, {The absence of political participation does not negate the presence of economic liberty}

8eadf0c4-a0bc-46f9-a1e0-799ff67c3ca8.summary: Supplementing with a broader conception of freedom
8eadf0c4-a0bc-46f9-a1e0-799ff67c3ca8.content: {Freedom can be understood as a multi-dimensional concept involving both economic and political aspects}, {Economic independence is one dimension of freedom, focusing on self-sufficiency}, {Political participation is another dimension of freedom, focusing on civic engagement}, {The objection loses force when freedom is seen as encompassing multiple dimensions, with economic independence being one of them}

98f47ba2-5b30-49b9-b970-fdbbe49b9e9e.content: {Freedom is having autonomy}, {Autonomy involves making one's own choices}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can make decisions without coercion}

889d2b84-21a4-4694-864e-9d28d3c4bced.content: {Freedom is the absence of interference from others}, {Non-interference involves not being subject to the will of others}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals are not hindered by external constraints}

5d6867b3-fc6d-48b9-ae2e-b69085724adb.content: {Freedom is the ability to realize one's potential}, {Self-realization involves pursuing personal goals and values}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can develop their capabilities}

0ad7b57f-f946-46e0-a30d-08c93c6fb689.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination by others}, {Non-domination involves not being subject to arbitrary power}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals are protected from domination}

57094b59-2bce-4478-8863-a67508a2c79c.content: {Freedom is having the capability to achieve valuable outcomes}, {Capability involves having the means to pursue a range of life activities}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals have the opportunity to pursue what they value}

22fec1a3-620a-492f-89a9-e8ca5edd9df9.summary: Distinguishing between economic and expressive freedom
22fec1a3-620a-492f-89a9-e8ca5edd9df9.content: {There is a distinction between economic freedom and expressive freedom}, {Freedom as economic independence is a theory about economic freedom rather than expressive freedom}, {A person who is economically independent but unable to express their identity is not lacking economic freedom}, {The intuition that someone is not free due to societal norms can be explained as confusion between economic freedom and expressive freedom}

d62e69fa-8164-420a-adb2-e0e25d663c26.summary: Rejecting the intuition that economic independence is insufficient for freedom
d62e69fa-8164-420a-adb2-e0e25d663c26.content: {It is false that economic independence is insufficient for freedom}, {Economic independence provides the necessary foundation for other forms of freedom, including expressive freedom}, {The inability to express one's identity due to societal norms does not negate the economic freedom achieved through independence}

29d91f44-5d96-4d57-9d03-05ab01956999.summary: Supplementing with a broader conception of freedom
29d91f44-5d96-4d57-9d03-05ab01956999.content: {Freedom involves multiple dimensions, including economic and expressive aspects}, {Economic independence is a necessary but not sufficient condition for complete freedom}, {A broader conception of freedom includes both economic independence and the ability to express one's identity}

3e7db92a-b7f5-4cf9-bcef-5eaa6e125a3e.summary: Freedom as Economic and Political Independence
3e7db92a-b7f5-4cf9-bcef-5eaa6e125a3e.content: {Freedom is having economic independence}, {Economic independence involves having the resources to support oneself}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can sustain themselves without reliance on others}, {Liberty requires social and political rights}, {Social and political rights protect individual freedoms}

bd3ab55e-f90a-4977-96c2-836e2dbb1370.content: {Freedom is having comprehensive independence}, {Comprehensive independence includes economic, social, and political independence}, {Economic independence involves having the resources to support oneself}, {Social independence involves the ability to engage freely in social interactions}, {Political independence involves having the rights to participate in political processes}

72f9b7b6-579e-4727-a4ab-5e7fbc84b000.content: {Freedom is multi-dimensional}, {Economic independence is one dimension of freedom}, {Social rights are another dimension of freedom}, {Political rights are another dimension of freedom}, {All dimensions are necessary for true liberty}

99acdff4-1e68-475e-935b-14080e008d8e.content: {Freedom is based on resources and rights}, {Economic independence involves having the resources to support oneself}, {Liberty requires having social rights}, {Liberty requires having political rights}, {Resources and rights together ensure individual freedom}

09a376a3-2e45-4d03-986f-9171867101cf.summary: Freedom as Independence with Rights Safeguards
09a376a3-2e45-4d03-986f-9171867101cf.content: {Freedom is having independence with rights safeguards}, {Economic independence involves having the resources to support oneself}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can sustain themselves without reliance on others}, {Social and political rights safeguard individual freedoms}, {Rights are necessary to protect and enhance economic independence}

0f20952c-4ba5-4bb7-80fd-e28ccf613407.summary: Distinguishing between economic and political liberty
0f20952c-4ba5-4bb7-80fd-e28ccf613407.content: {There is a distinction between economic liberty and political liberty}, {Freedom as economic independence is a theory about economic liberty rather than political liberty}, {Economic independence does not entail political rights, but it is a separate dimension of freedom}, {The intuition that someone is not free without political rights can be explained as a confusion between economic and political liberty}

aa1ae3b6-dcc3-4167-9ac4-8d1bd4c7f4cc.summary: Rejecting the necessity of political rights for liberty
aa1ae3b6-dcc3-4167-9ac4-8d1bd4c7f4cc.content: {It is false that political rights are necessary for liberty}, {Economic independence can be sufficient for a form of liberty focused on self-sufficiency}, {The absence of political rights does not negate the presence of economic freedom}

eb96a75c-3236-4c00-92ec-8a9720e0f6d1.summary: Supplementing with a broader conception of liberty
eb96a75c-3236-4c00-92ec-8a9720e0f6d1.content: {Liberty can be understood as a multi-dimensional concept involving both economic and political aspects}, {Economic independence is one essential component of liberty, but not the only one}, {The objection loses its force when liberty is seen as comprising multiple dimensions, with economic independence being a key part}

5c5815a0-28bc-467f-8436-9c37d291c8a1.summary: Freedom as Economic and Emotional Independence
5c5815a0-28bc-467f-8436-9c37d291c8a1.content: {Freedom is having both economic and emotional independence}, {Economic independence involves having the resources to support oneself}, {Emotional independence involves not relying on others for emotional validation}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can sustain themselves both economically and emotionally without reliance on others}

b9416d46-5646-4f6e-800f-bb790e4f3323.summary: Freedom as Economic Independence with Social Support
b9416d46-5646-4f6e-800f-bb790e4f3323.content: {Freedom is having economic independence}, {Economic independence involves having the resources to support oneself}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can sustain themselves without reliance on others for basic needs}, {Social support systems are compatible with economic independence and do not negate freedom}

9b1cf584-727d-4af0-b7fd-31a850c6e5b3.content: {Freedom is having independence in multiple dimensions}, {Economic independence involves having the resources to support oneself}, {Emotional independence involves not relying on others for emotional validation}, {Social independence involves not being constrained by social norms or pressures}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can sustain themselves across these dimensions without reliance on others}

59b7cb16-d817-4c69-a360-d09841117de2.summary: Freedom as Economic Independence with Emotional Resilience
59b7cb16-d817-4c69-a360-d09841117de2.content: {Freedom is having economic independence}, {Economic independence involves having the resources to support oneself}, {Emotional resilience involves the ability to cope with emotional challenges independently}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can sustain themselves economically and are emotionally resilient}

3721948b-d0db-479b-9aec-47b57d58232d.summary: Freedom as Economic Independence with Community Engagement
3721948b-d0db-479b-9aec-47b57d58232d.content: {Freedom is having economic independence}, {Economic independence involves having the resources to support oneself}, {Community engagement involves participating in communal activities without economic reliance}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can sustain themselves economically and engage with their community voluntarily}

71917c29-e298-4644-85a7-366868d25d1d.summary: Distinguishing between economic and emotional dependence
71917c29-e298-4644-85a7-366868d25d1d.content: {There is a distinction between economic dependence and emotional dependence}, {Freedom as economic independence is a theory about economic dependence rather than emotional dependence}, {A person can be economically independent while still being emotionally dependent}, {The intuition that someone is dependent due to emotional needs does not undermine their economic independence}

f4960da6-dcee-46d9-9227-c28303243d66.summary: Rejecting the claim that economic independence must eliminate all forms of dependence
f4960da6-dcee-46d9-9227-c28303243d66.content: {It is false that economic independence must eliminate all forms of dependence}, {Economic independence specifically addresses financial self-sufficiency, not other types of dependence}, {The presence of emotional dependence does not negate the achievement of economic independence}

7140bc5b-410e-4513-a8c3-7fcff804065d.summary: Supplementing with a focus on primary forms of dependence
7140bc5b-410e-4513-a8c3-7fcff804065d.content: {Economic independence addresses primary forms of dependence related to survival and self-sufficiency}, {Emotional dependence is a secondary form of dependence that does not directly impact economic freedom}, {The theory focuses on the primary goal of achieving self-sufficiency in economic terms}

628c8629-af29-4a92-bf7e-5ed9a2ea8654.content: {Freedom is having personal autonomy}, {Personal autonomy involves making one's own choices}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can make decisions independently of external control}

edc27462-6755-45c8-a748-7870c5f949ef.content: {Freedom is achieving self-realization}, {Self-realization involves fulfilling one's potential}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can pursue their own goals and aspirations}

8292b8e9-3a37-4c71-a96a-3699bf8a25e0.content: {Freedom is having the ability for creative expression}, {Creative expression involves engaging in artistic or innovative activities}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can express themselves creatively without constraints}

da8eb329-5d35-4dbf-9043-a952ae6e30f7.content: {Freedom is having the ability to participate in society}, {Social participation involves engaging in communal and civic activities}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can contribute to and influence their community}

49a60bbd-3f88-4cbb-9d24-a9538fab05ae.content: {Freedom is having psychological independence}, {Psychological independence involves having control over one's mental state}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can maintain their mental autonomy without external manipulation}

e28e3ed6-de08-4453-9705-9a2068970431.content: {Freedom is having moral agency}, {Moral agency involves acting according to one's ethical beliefs}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can make moral choices without coercion}

5b2e2e74-c497-4916-9dc0-653fd058d7b8.content: {Freedom is the expansion of capabilities}, {Capability expansion involves increasing one's abilities and opportunities}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can develop and utilize their capabilities fully}

daf8e552-5254-4739-bedb-5cc9c3f06bac.content: {Freedom is having relational autonomy}, {Relational autonomy involves maintaining meaningful relationships while being independent}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can balance personal independence with social connections}

dc248017-a5ff-48f8-8a9b-9e8f0111083e.content: {Freedom is having intellectual independence}, {Intellectual independence involves forming one's own beliefs and opinions}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can think critically and independently}

8709b77b-36fe-421b-992b-c9c6ee49b94b.content: {Freedom is having emotional autonomy}, {Emotional autonomy involves managing one's emotions independently}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can regulate their emotions without external influence}

a04bcce6-36c5-418d-9e0d-2df37d236ec2.summary: Distinguishing between economic and personal freedom
a04bcce6-36c5-418d-9e0d-2df37d236ec2.content: {There is a distinction between economic freedom and personal freedom}, {Freedom as economic independence is a theory about economic freedom rather than personal freedom}, {A person can achieve personal freedom through creative expression and personal growth without economic independence}, {The intuition that someone is free through personal growth can be explained as a different type of freedom than economic independence}

3272317f-9cb2-4c1c-af71-8086dfeb5b3b.summary: Rejecting the necessity of multiple paths to freedom
3272317f-9cb2-4c1c-af71-8086dfeb5b3b.content: {It is false that freedom must be achieved through multiple paths}, {Economic independence is a sufficient condition for freedom even if not the only possible path}, {The scenario of achieving freedom through personal growth does not negate the sufficiency of economic independence for freedom}

2682b60e-af71-4280-9fb1-b57f5517196b.summary: Supplementing with a broader definition of independence
2682b60e-af71-4280-9fb1-b57f5517196b.content: {Independence can be understood in a broader sense that includes personal autonomy and self-realization}, {Economic independence is one aspect of a broader independence that encompasses personal growth}, {The appearance of freedom through personal growth is consistent with a broader understanding of independence that includes economic factors}

df83fa32-bf34-4abb-844c-5d6d80f709bc.content: {Freedom is having the capability to achieve one's goals}, {Capabilities are enhanced through access to resources and opportunities}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can pursue their goals with or without reliance on others}

fc5a24db-5b87-481f-90df-de4ab59abd28.content: {Freedom is having autonomy in decision-making}, {Autonomy involves making choices based on one's own values and preferences}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals can make decisions independently, even if they rely on others for resources}

24f5a5d8-6e49-49c9-9ae9-ef73feb9d045.content: {Freedom is having mutual dependence that enhances well-being}, {Mutual dependence involves reciprocal relationships that benefit all parties}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals engage in interdependent relationships that enhance their freedom}

1de52eb4-e706-4f47-ae50-141730002fda.content: {Freedom is having access to necessary resources}, {Resource access involves the ability to obtain what is needed for well-being}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals have access to resources, regardless of reliance on others}

0bf8a32e-386e-4b1a-825a-8858429db70e.content: {Freedom is having empowerment to act according to one's will}, {Empowerment involves having the means and confidence to pursue one's goals}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals are empowered to act, whether or not they rely on others}

7801fc04-85b0-4c16-81b6-06023e7db726.content: {There is a distinction between reliance that compromises liberty and reliance that enhances it}, {Freedom as economic independence is concerned with reliance that compromises liberty}, {Collaborative reliance that enhances capabilities does not compromise liberty in the relevant sense}, {The intuition that reliance can enhance liberty is explained by distinguishing between types of reliance}

43f323f1-ce26-43ab-ba56-eab07013704b.summary: Rejecting the intuition that all reliance compromises liberty
43f323f1-ce26-43ab-ba56-eab07013704b.content: {It is false that all reliance on others compromises liberty}, {Collaborative projects that enhance capabilities do not compromise liberty}, {The appearance that reliance always compromises liberty is mistaken and based on a misunderstanding of the nature of collaboration}

d8bce67d-3875-4189-9d78-ea01410ff375.summary: Supplementing with a capability enhancement assumption
d8bce67d-3875-4189-9d78-ea01410ff375.content: {Economic independence includes the ability to engage in collaborations that enhance capabilities}, {Collaborative reliance that enhances capabilities is consistent with economic independence}, {The objection loses its force when economic independence is understood to include capability-enhancing collaborations}

b944ef82-7ec6-42cf-af75-a17464c7a046.summary: Freedom as Absence of Both Psychological and External Constraints
b944ef82-7ec6-42cf-af75-a17464c7a046.content: {Freedom is the absence of psychological constraints}, {Freedom is the absence of external constraints}, {Psychological constraints involve mental barriers that limit one's actions}, {External constraints involve physical or social barriers that limit one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act without internal psychological limitations and external barriers}

ffcb07e1-d760-4557-9ddf-dc788b54e40f.summary: Freedom as Capability to Achieve Desired Ends
ffcb07e1-d760-4557-9ddf-dc788b54e40f.content: {Freedom is the capability to achieve one's desired ends}, {The capability to achieve desired ends requires the absence of psychological constraints}, {The capability to achieve desired ends requires the absence of external constraints}, {Psychological constraints involve mental barriers that limit one's actions}, {External constraints involve physical or social barriers that limit one's actions}

7245d812-b726-4abd-beee-331c2214c76c.content: {Freedom is the ability to make autonomous choices}, {Autonomous choices require the absence of psychological constraints}, {Autonomous choices require the absence of external constraints}, {Psychological constraints involve mental barriers that limit one's actions}, {External constraints involve physical or social barriers that limit one's actions}

9040d4de-ffe7-4249-8bf1-84723ec09204.content: {Freedom is the capacity for self-determination}, {Self-determination requires the absence of psychological constraints}, {Self-determination requires the absence of external constraints}, {Psychological constraints involve mental barriers that limit one's actions}, {External constraints involve physical or social barriers that limit one's actions}

2f12edfd-ace1-4a84-942d-fb0b2597a269.content: {Freedom is the state of non-domination}, {Non-domination requires the absence of psychological constraints}, {Non-domination requires the absence of external constraints}, {Psychological constraints involve mental barriers that limit one's actions}, {External constraints involve physical or social barriers that limit one's actions}

8fb228fa-ad86-4930-a1fc-9f43970d5101.summary: Distinguishing between internal and external freedom
8fb228fa-ad86-4930-a1fc-9f43970d5101.content: {There is a distinction between internal freedom and external freedom}, {Freedom as psychological freedom is a theory about internal freedom rather than external freedom}, {A person locked in a room without a desire to leave is not lacking internal freedom, even if they lack external freedom}, {The intuition that someone locked in a room is unfree can be explained as confusion between internal and external freedom}

f9fff3cd-b6bd-46f7-aa6e-1b7266012e8a.summary: Rejecting the necessity of external freedom for psychological freedom
f9fff3cd-b6bd-46f7-aa6e-1b7266012e8a.content: {It is false that freedom must include the absence of external constraints to be complete}, {Psychological freedom is sufficient for a person to be considered free in the relevant internal sense}, {The presence of external constraints does not negate the existence of psychological freedom if internal barriers are absent}

88be9184-4293-4800-801e-87c757921cbc.summary: Supplementing with a dual-aspect theory of freedom
88be9184-4293-4800-801e-87c757921cbc.content: {Freedom involves both psychological and external aspects}, {Psychological freedom is one aspect of a broader conception of freedom that includes external freedom}, {The absence of psychological constraints is a necessary but not sufficient condition for complete freedom}, {The scenario of a person locked in a room highlights the need for considering both aspects to fully understand freedom}

46d8e8f8-407d-49ab-a91e-48760d50146e.content: {Freedom is the absence of psychological constraints}, {Psychological constraints involve mental barriers that limit one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act with rational deliberation and without internal psychological limitations}

53b1b9bf-d4b9-445e-b289-1657315674b6.content: {Freedom is the absence of psychological constraints}, {Psychological constraints involve mental barriers that limit one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act according to their own values and without internal psychological limitations}

63562d62-703f-4519-b55f-cea5b4bc2732.content: {Freedom is the absence of psychological constraints}, {Psychological constraints involve mental barriers that limit one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act in ways that they reflectively endorse and without internal psychological limitations}

9ef3c758-156a-4beb-831d-427c5b2abe63.content: {Freedom is the absence of psychological constraints}, {Psychological constraints involve mental barriers that limit one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act authentically and without internal psychological limitations}

445ab875-ce7d-4043-b3d8-ed31ec3263e3.content: {Freedom is the absence of psychological constraints}, {Psychological constraints involve mental barriers that limit one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act in a manner that coherently expresses their self-identity and without internal psychological limitations}

27bc352f-4929-494a-84da-9c0ac605b53e.summary: Distinguishing between psychological and rational freedom
27bc352f-4929-494a-84da-9c0ac605b53e.content: {There is a distinction between psychological freedom and rational freedom}, {Freedom as psychological freedom is a theory about the absence of psychological constraints, not about rational deliberation}, {A person under the influence of a drug may lack rational freedom but can still possess psychological freedom}, {The intuition that rational deliberation is necessary for genuine liberty can be explained as a confusion between psychological and rational freedom}

affc5716-ea12-4730-86d0-a632c083e77a.summary: Rejecting the necessity of rational deliberation for freedom
affc5716-ea12-4730-86d0-a632c083e77a.content: {It is false that rational deliberation is necessary for genuine liberty}, {Psychological freedom is sufficient for liberty as it allows individuals to act without internal psychological limitations}, {The presence of rational deliberation is not required for a person to be considered free in the psychological sense}

d093f8e7-a915-4434-a45c-1a370f122e36.summary: Supplementing with the role of external conditions
d093f8e7-a915-4434-a45c-1a370f122e36.content: {External conditions play a role in determining genuine liberty}, {Psychological freedom must be supplemented with favorable external conditions to ensure genuine liberty}, {A person under the influence of a drug may lack genuine liberty due to unfavorable external conditions, not due to a lack of psychological freedom}

b0a28281-fbb4-4c47-8a4f-6a41a990c670.content: {Freedom is the ability to act according to one's rational deliberations}, {Rational deliberations involve making decisions based on reason and reflection}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act in accordance with their rational judgments}

c121eebb-f513-44c3-9bea-8b646fbc61ef.content: {Freedom is the ability to express one's true self}, {True self involves desires and values that are genuinely one's own}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act in ways that reflect their authentic desires and values}

8761fb39-949b-495b-9ca1-08ba2cdd6f00.content: {Freedom is the ability to make choices based on full information}, {Full information involves having access to all relevant facts and understanding their implications}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make decisions with a comprehensive understanding of their options}

263cadb6-b5b1-48ba-9338-e52027b40583.content: {Freedom is the ability to endorse one's actions upon reflection}, {Reflective endorsement involves critically evaluating one's motivations and desires}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act in ways they would endorse upon reflection}

ea43b245-23f1-45f8-8c6c-b6826d0f7e6e.content: {Freedom is the capacity to determine one's own actions}, {Self-determination involves having control over one's choices and life direction}, {Liberty is present when individuals can shape their lives according to their own plans and goals}

caaf4ea3-5797-4af8-af39-b64ec8a454de.content: {Freedom is the absence of external coercion}, {Coercion involves being forced to act against one's will by external forces}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act without being compelled by others}

17b4d409-31b5-4d12-bd49-d177c958a3e2.content: {Freedom is the ability to act according to one's moral principles}, {Moral principles involve ethical guidelines that one has chosen to follow}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act in accordance with their moral convictions}

7bcc6989-e978-4cd7-b402-6c255b920889.content: {Freedom is the ability to maintain personal integrity}, {Personal integrity involves consistency between one's actions and values}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act in ways that align with their core values}

897a3418-1f27-49d0-8e94-dc96861470f4.content: {Freedom is the ability to engage in creative actions}, {Creative actions involve original and innovative expressions of one's ideas}, {Liberty is present when individuals can pursue creative endeavors without restriction}

7f5b2854-4b20-4b6f-b2fe-555112f1435f.content: {Freedom is the ability to realize one's potential}, {Self-realization involves achieving personal growth and fulfillment}, {Liberty is present when individuals can pursue their own development and aspirations}

eafff2c6-3af7-4648-8229-951c9036b37a.summary: Distinguishing between psychological freedom and autonomy
eafff2c6-3af7-4648-8229-951c9036b37a.content: {There is a distinction between psychological freedom and autonomy}, {Freedom as psychological freedom is a theory about the absence of internal mental barriers, not about autonomy}, {An individual can lack autonomy while still being psychologically free if their actions are not self-directed}, {The intuition that brainwashed individuals lack freedom can be explained by confusing psychological freedom with autonomy}

6625198a-c8fa-4ecb-816c-e47848713f42.summary: Rejecting the intuition that autonomy is necessary for freedom
6625198a-c8fa-4ecb-816c-e47848713f42.content: {It is false that autonomy is necessary for freedom as psychological freedom}, {Psychological freedom focuses on the absence of internal constraints, not on the source of one's desires or actions}, {The appearance of lacking freedom in brainwashed individuals can be explained by a separate concern for autonomy, not by a lack of psychological freedom}

6c87adac-1079-44cf-b469-bafa5c85f875.summary: Supplementing with a condition of authenticity
6c87adac-1079-44cf-b469-bafa5c85f875.content: {Authenticity involves acting in accordance with one's true self or values}, {Freedom as psychological freedom can be supplemented with a condition of authenticity to address concerns about autonomy}, {An individual is psychologically free and autonomous if they act without internal constraints and in line with their authentic self}, {The intuition that brainwashed individuals lack freedom is addressed by the absence of authenticity, not by a lack of psychological freedom}

e86da9b3-139a-4077-9119-2735ea04a58f.content: {Freedom is the absence of both psychological and external constraints}, {Psychological constraints involve mental barriers that limit one's actions}, {External constraints involve physical or social barriers that limit one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act without internal psychological limitations and external interferences}

b4e6dd6f-34b6-4dd4-bf8e-09a9b41115c0.content: {Freedom is the capability to achieve one's goals}, {Capabilities include both internal psychological states and external conditions}, {Liberty is present when individuals have the capability to pursue their goals without internal or external limitations}

7790bf3a-100e-426a-849c-ea558b96c749.content: {Freedom is the ability to make autonomous choices}, {Autonomous choices require the absence of both psychological and external constraints}, {Liberty is present when individuals can make choices without internal psychological limitations and external interferences}

4fe639d9-eec3-4173-a9be-9466506c9a4f.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination by others}, {Domination involves both psychological manipulation and external control}, {Liberty is present when individuals are free from both internal psychological manipulation and external domination}

0498f2c6-37dd-41bc-8443-e2188d2c61d0.content: {Freedom is the effective agency to act according to one's will}, {Effective agency requires the absence of both psychological and external constraints}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act according to their will without internal psychological limitations and external interferences}

3795a44d-8b7f-4b07-97ad-a73ef09fdc76.summary: Distinguishing between internal and external constraints
3795a44d-8b7f-4b07-97ad-a73ef09fdc76.content: {There is a distinction between internal psychological constraints and external physical constraints}, {Freedom as psychological freedom is a theory about internal constraints rather than external ones}, {A person can be psychologically free even if they are physically restrained}, {The intuition that someone lacks liberty when physically restrained can be explained as confusion between internal and external constraints}

7df67f32-9f03-4311-9c41-9b69e69b9fc9.summary: Rejecting the necessity of external freedom for liberty
7df67f32-9f03-4311-9c41-9b69e69b9fc9.content: {It is false that liberty necessarily requires the absence of external interference}, {Liberty can be fully realized through the absence of internal psychological constraints alone}, {The presence of external constraints does not negate the existence of psychological freedom}

82f36fd3-6617-4eca-8e06-93317d05cacd.summary: Supplementing with a dual-aspect view of freedom
82f36fd3-6617-4eca-8e06-93317d05cacd.content: {Freedom involves both internal psychological and external physical aspects}, {Psychological freedom is one aspect of a broader conception of liberty}, {The absence of psychological constraints is necessary for liberty, but not sufficient without considering external factors}

de0e5e0c-abde-4c69-a107-abf6582de74f.summary: Freedom as Absence of External and Internal Constraints
de0e5e0c-abde-4c69-a107-abf6582de74f.content: {Freedom is the absence of psychological constraints}, {Freedom is the absence of external constraints}, {Psychological constraints involve mental barriers that limit one's actions}, {External constraints involve social and legal barriers that limit one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act without internal psychological limitations and external restrictions}

d4c668d1-ace4-4d71-bb4d-56c8a961cbe9.content: {Freedom is the ability to act according to one's own will}, {Autonomy requires the absence of psychological constraints}, {Autonomy requires the absence of external constraints}, {Psychological constraints involve mental barriers that limit one's actions}, {External constraints involve social and legal barriers that limit one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act autonomously without internal or external limitations}

45c19691-2561-4d88-b4c5-816f4bceb373.content: {Freedom is the capability to achieve valuable outcomes}, {Capabilities require the absence of psychological constraints}, {Capabilities require the absence of external constraints}, {Psychological constraints involve mental barriers that limit one's actions}, {External constraints involve social and legal barriers that limit one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals have the capability to achieve valuable outcomes without internal or external limitations}

4b401974-823d-4550-86ee-a5d00736135e.content: {Freedom is the capacity for self-determination}, {Self-determination requires the absence of psychological constraints}, {Self-determination requires the absence of external constraints}, {Psychological constraints involve mental barriers that limit one's actions}, {External constraints involve social and legal barriers that limit one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can determine their own actions without internal or external limitations}

3b06f3b8-8159-48c5-8631-d5619c71ab9d.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination by others}, {Non-domination requires the absence of psychological constraints}, {Non-domination requires the absence of external constraints}, {Psychological constraints involve mental barriers that limit one's actions}, {External constraints involve social and legal barriers that limit one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals are not dominated by others and can act without internal or external limitations}

7b2abbf3-5188-4617-b62e-a5b6149b2865.summary: Distinguishing between internal and external freedom
7b2abbf3-5188-4617-b62e-a5b6149b2865.content: {There is a distinction between internal freedom and external freedom}, {Freedom as psychological freedom is a theory about internal freedom rather than external freedom}, {A person can be internally free if they have no psychological barriers, even if they are externally constrained by legal restrictions}, {The intuition that someone is not free due to legal restrictions can be explained as confusion between internal and external freedom}

edd90b1b-f6e1-4319-9d47-dab408b088ef.summary: Rejecting the necessity of external conditions for freedom
edd90b1b-f6e1-4319-9d47-dab408b088ef.content: {It is false that freedom requires the absence of external constraints}, {Freedom as psychological freedom focuses solely on the absence of internal psychological barriers}, {The presence of legal restrictions does not negate the internal freedom of an individual without psychological constraints}

2bf52d16-2a88-45e1-83d4-262ea7f4f215.summary: Supplementing with a dual-aspect theory of freedom
2bf52d16-2a88-45e1-83d4-262ea7f4f215.content: {Freedom can be understood as having both internal and external aspects}, {Psychological freedom addresses the internal aspect, focusing on the absence of mental barriers}, {A supplementary assumption is that external freedom involves the absence of social and legal constraints}, {The objection loses its force when considering freedom as requiring both internal and external conditions}

89c3160f-7401-41a5-8ad9-ecff462557fe.summary: Freedom as Psychological and Moral Awareness
89c3160f-7401-41a5-8ad9-ecff462557fe.content: {Freedom is the absence of psychological constraints}, {Psychological constraints involve mental barriers that limit one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act without internal psychological limitations}, {Moral awareness is necessary for moral responsibility}, {For a person to be morally responsible, they must understand the moral implications of their actions}

1a8e4149-65cf-4f5b-98e4-05b24bd90e96.summary: Freedom as Psychological Freedom with Rational Understanding
1a8e4149-65cf-4f5b-98e4-05b24bd90e96.content: {Freedom is the absence of psychological constraints}, {Psychological constraints involve mental barriers that limit one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act without internal psychological limitations}, {Rational understanding of one's actions is necessary for moral responsibility}, {For a person to be morally responsible, they must have a rational understanding of their actions}

27668f9f-c916-4d18-ab3d-6bf33470ea4e.summary: Freedom as Psychological Freedom with Moral and Rational Capacities
27668f9f-c916-4d18-ab3d-6bf33470ea4e.content: {Freedom is the absence of psychological constraints}, {Psychological constraints involve mental barriers that limit one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act without internal psychological limitations}, {Moral capacity is necessary for moral responsibility}, {Rational capacity is necessary for moral responsibility}

7e135118-bf5f-4038-a09b-0aa00ad2adf5.summary: Freedom as Psychological Freedom with Ethical Reflection
7e135118-bf5f-4038-a09b-0aa00ad2adf5.content: {Freedom is the absence of psychological constraints}, {Psychological constraints involve mental barriers that limit one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act without internal psychological limitations}, {Ethical reflection is necessary for moral responsibility}, {For a person to be morally responsible, they must engage in ethical reflection about their actions}

886b8484-1259-4b47-bd0f-1acfd94410cd.summary: Freedom as Psychological Freedom with Moral Understanding and Intent
886b8484-1259-4b47-bd0f-1acfd94410cd.content: {Freedom is the absence of psychological constraints}, {Psychological constraints involve mental barriers that limit one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act without internal psychological limitations}, {Moral understanding is necessary for moral responsibility}, {Moral intent is necessary for moral responsibility}

a47230b9-7fbc-4513-967f-f8666cf65d02.summary: Distinguishing between psychological freedom and moral awareness
a47230b9-7fbc-4513-967f-f8666cf65d02.content: {There is a distinction between psychological freedom and moral awareness}, {Freedom as psychological freedom is a theory about the absence of internal mental barriers, not about moral understanding}, {A person can be psychologically free without being morally aware}, {The intuition that moral responsibility requires more than psychological freedom can be explained by the need for additional moral awareness}

20e38494-bbb7-408d-b361-20dca211e7b4.summary: Rejecting the intuition that moral awareness is necessary for responsibility
20e38494-bbb7-408d-b361-20dca211e7b4.content: {It is false that moral awareness is necessary for moral responsibility}, {Moral responsibility can be attributed based on the absence of psychological constraints alone}, {The appearance that moral awareness is required can be explained by societal norms rather than an inherent requirement of responsibility}

a35883e8-c183-4b5f-9985-a3e66c0be5b2.summary: Supplementing with a requirement for moral understanding
a35883e8-c183-4b5f-9985-a3e66c0be5b2.content: {Moral responsibility requires both psychological freedom and moral understanding}, {Freedom as psychological freedom can be supplemented with the requirement of moral awareness}, {The objection loses its force when moral understanding is added as a necessary condition for responsibility}

9aadde88-f746-4130-bf03-057df820ec1d.content: {Freedom is the absence of psychological constraints}, {Psychological constraints involve mental barriers that limit one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act without internal psychological limitations}, {Freedom requires the capacity for rational deliberation}, {Rational deliberation involves the ability to reflect on and evaluate one's desires and actions}

748cc902-d1e0-4e2c-8d17-5a45cabb0431.content: {Freedom is the absence of psychological constraints}, {Psychological constraints involve mental barriers that limit one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act without internal psychological limitations}, {Freedom requires the capacity for rational deliberation}, {Autonomy involves acting in accordance with one's rational deliberations}

41a1bd26-1d8c-4f69-853a-313913adc001.content: {Freedom is the absence of psychological constraints}, {Psychological constraints involve mental barriers that limit one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act without internal psychological limitations}, {Freedom requires the ability to reflect on one's desires and actions}, {Reflective capacity involves considering the reasons for one's actions}

70b6f188-d3ce-44df-8161-96790731c53b.content: {Freedom is the absence of psychological constraints}, {Psychological constraints involve mental barriers that limit one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act without internal psychological limitations}, {Freedom requires the process of deliberation}, {Deliberation involves weighing different options and their consequences}

c045c4bc-4f3c-4b18-bb93-e15c107df70f.content: {Freedom is the absence of psychological constraints}, {Psychological constraints involve mental barriers that limit one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act without internal psychological limitations}, {Freedom requires rational self-governance}, {Rational self-governance involves making decisions based on reasoned judgment}

512f35e6-0e2e-48aa-bac5-873548870397.summary: Distinguishing between psychological freedom and rational freedom
512f35e6-0e2e-48aa-bac5-873548870397.content: {There is a distinction between psychological freedom and rational freedom}, {Freedom as psychological freedom is a theory about the absence of psychological constraints, not about rational deliberation}, {A person can be psychologically free even if they do not engage in rational deliberation}, {The intuition that freedom requires rational deliberation can be explained as a confusion between psychological freedom and rational freedom}

2e4c762b-6ced-46b7-a19f-7322828d8d05.summary: Rejecting the necessity of rational deliberation for freedom
2e4c762b-6ced-46b7-a19f-7322828d8d05.content: {It is false that rational deliberation is necessary for freedom}, {Freedom can be fully realized in the absence of psychological constraints, regardless of the presence of rational deliberation}, {The scenario of acting impulsively without psychological constraints still constitutes an exercise of freedom}

dafb72ee-4d67-4403-b1ed-cbb34c6fb1ef.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of rational potential
dafb72ee-4d67-4403-b1ed-cbb34c6fb1ef.content: {Freedom involves the potential for rational deliberation, even if not always exercised}, {Psychological freedom can exist alongside the potential for rational deliberation}, {The presence of psychological freedom does not preclude the capacity for rational thought, even if not actively engaged}

7a166284-f650-4e64-9aec-63ab52ab0012.content: {Freedom is the ability to act according to one's own values and reasons}, {Autonomy requires that actions are not manipulated by external forces}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act in accordance with their authentic self}

db137883-7324-479c-acf5-3a8d1961c381.content: {Freedom is the capacity to govern oneself through rational deliberation}, {Rational self-governance requires the ability to reflect on and endorse one's desires}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act based on rational reflection and endorsement of their desires}

cbe398fd-b199-4274-875a-de3cac411e5c.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination by others}, {Non-domination involves not being subject to the arbitrary will of another}, {Liberty is present when individuals are free from the control or interference of others}

8fc4f6d4-6658-4c9c-8d23-ab7bcabfaf9a.content: {Freedom is the alignment of one's actions with one's true self}, {Authenticity requires that actions reflect one's genuine beliefs and desires}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act in a way that is true to their own identity}

ca4ecbb6-3746-41af-9139-116f8c8e9555.content: {Freedom is the realization of one's potential and capabilities}, {Self-realization involves developing and expressing one's inherent abilities}, {Liberty is present when individuals can pursue and achieve their own potential}

e9b826a1-c9d7-490a-ac71-62a881526a20.content: {Freedom is the ability to reflectively endorse one's motivations}, {Reflective endorsement requires critical evaluation of one's desires and motivations}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act based on motivations they have reflectively endorsed}

4152508d-f383-48ac-8a91-b01d21ebc34d.content: {Freedom is the capacity to be morally responsible for one's actions}, {Moral responsibility requires that actions are not coerced or manipulated}, {Liberty is present when individuals can be held accountable for their actions}

99c64eb7-64ec-4620-8b8f-0a63e3a50312.content: {Freedom is the absence of coercion by external forces}, {Coercion involves being forced to act against one's will}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act without being coerced by others}

2b0190ae-cd19-4350-ae0f-259f6baf424b.content: {Freedom is the capacity to make choices among alternatives}, {Capacity for choice requires the presence of genuine options}, {Liberty is present when individuals have the ability to choose from a range of possibilities}

2916f049-3d3a-4dc2-b1c7-a5123a4f9df0.content: {Freedom is the empowerment to pursue one's goals}, {Empowerment involves having the resources and opportunities to achieve one's aims}, {Liberty is present when individuals are empowered to act towards their objectives}

1e19ad76-ef0b-434e-ab5a-869e00c02f87.summary: Distinguishing between internal and external psychological constraints
1e19ad76-ef0b-434e-ab5a-869e00c02f87.content: {There is a distinction between internal psychological constraints and external psychological influences}, {Freedom as psychological freedom is concerned with internal constraints rather than external influences}, {Manipulation is an external influence and does not count as an internal psychological constraint}, {A person manipulated to have no psychological barriers is free in the sense of lacking internal constraints, even if not self-determined due to external manipulation}

73be7313-fc6c-4831-91d7-e4e97cf243eb.summary: Rejecting the intuition that manipulation undermines freedom
73be7313-fc6c-4831-91d7-e4e97cf243eb.content: {It is mistaken to think that manipulation necessarily undermines freedom}, {Freedom as psychological freedom focuses on the absence of internal constraints, not the presence of external influences}, {A person without psychological barriers is free in the relevant sense, regardless of how those barriers were removed}, {The intuition that manipulation undermines freedom confuses external influence with internal constraint}

5db225aa-988a-446f-a027-ed192cab3657.summary: Supplementing with a condition of authenticity
5db225aa-988a-446f-a027-ed192cab3657.content: {Authenticity can be a supplementary condition for self-determination}, {Freedom as psychological freedom can be maintained by adding a requirement for actions to align with authentic desires}, {Manipulation that removes psychological barriers without aligning with authentic desires does not result in true self-determination}, {The absence of psychological constraints is sufficient for freedom when combined with authenticity}

630f229e-e5bc-41bf-a9b2-732416d40d1c.summary: Freedom as Absence of Coercion and Psychological Constraints
630f229e-e5bc-41bf-a9b2-732416d40d1c.content: {Freedom is the absence of psychological constraints}, {Freedom is the absence of coercive threats from others}, {Psychological constraints involve mental barriers that limit one's actions}, {Coercive threats involve external pressures that limit one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act without internal psychological limitations and external coercive threats}

c3ccfa92-5a43-457a-aeb8-8f284bdba017.content: {Freedom involves the absence of psychological constraints}, {Freedom involves the absence of coercive threats from others}, {Freedom involves the ability to make autonomous choices}, {Psychological constraints involve mental barriers that limit one's actions}, {Coercive threats involve external pressures that limit one's actions}, {Autonomous choices are made when individuals can reflect and decide based on their own values and reasons}

35c7f2ce-247b-4269-b8d2-cf938edb0452.content: {Freedom is the absence of psychological constraints}, {Freedom is the absence of coercive threats from others}, {Freedom is the absence of interference from external forces}, {Psychological constraints involve mental barriers that limit one's actions}, {Coercive threats involve external pressures that limit one's actions}, {External forces include any outside influences that restrict one's ability to act}

11ce5b53-7812-4e71-a2e2-673995efc761.summary: Freedom as Positive and Negative Liberty
11ce5b53-7812-4e71-a2e2-673995efc761.content: {Freedom involves the absence of psychological constraints}, {Freedom involves the absence of coercive threats from others}, {Freedom involves the presence of opportunities to pursue one's goals}, {Psychological constraints involve mental barriers that limit one's actions}, {Coercive threats involve external pressures that limit one's actions}, {Opportunities to pursue one's goals are present when individuals have the resources and capabilities to achieve their aims}

d259fb73-23be-42ff-a78a-30a5ba29a2e8.content: {Freedom involves the absence of psychological constraints}, {Freedom involves the absence of coercive threats from others}, {Freedom involves the capacity for self-determination}, {Psychological constraints involve mental barriers that limit one's actions}, {Coercive threats involve external pressures that limit one's actions}, {Self-determination is the ability to govern oneself according to one's own principles and desires}

1f5c4eb9-89c6-4361-b2bb-1ec0f2270787.summary: Distinguishing between internal and external freedom
1f5c4eb9-89c6-4361-b2bb-1ec0f2270787.content: {There is a distinction between internal freedom and external freedom}, {Freedom as psychological freedom is a theory about internal freedom rather than external freedom}, {Coercive threats are instances of external constraints, not internal psychological constraints}, {A person free from psychological constraints is internally free, even if they are externally constrained}, {The intuition that someone under coercion is not fully free can be explained as a confusion between internal and external freedom}

755f11eb-08e1-4d6f-8ba8-09e998985aac.summary: Rejecting the intuition that external constraints negate psychological freedom
755f11eb-08e1-4d6f-8ba8-09e998985aac.content: {It is false that external constraints negate psychological freedom}, {Psychological freedom is about the absence of internal mental barriers, not external threats}, {A person can be psychologically free even if they face external coercion}, {The presence of external threats does not imply the absence of psychological freedom}

3de9ec3e-ba18-4f30-9c1e-7adbcbe28c68.summary: Supplementing with a dual-aspect theory of freedom
3de9ec3e-ba18-4f30-9c1e-7adbcbe28c68.content: {Freedom can be understood as having both psychological and external aspects}, {Psychological freedom is one aspect of a broader conception of freedom}, {External freedom involves the absence of coercive threats and external constraints}, {The full scope of human freedom includes both psychological and external freedom}, {The objection loses its force when freedom is seen as encompassing both aspects}

edf90801-ccbc-4dc4-a716-de422ffabe34.summary: Freedom as Absence of External and Internal Constraints
edf90801-ccbc-4dc4-a716-de422ffabe34.content: {Freedom is the absence of psychological constraints}, {Freedom is the absence of external constraints}, {Psychological constraints involve mental barriers that limit one's actions}, {External constraints involve physical or social barriers that limit one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act without internal psychological limitations and external barriers}

619e88fc-3933-488f-8f4c-86fd1ec0b2ae.summary: Freedom as Capacity for Genuine Choice
619e88fc-3933-488f-8f4c-86fd1ec0b2ae.content: {Freedom involves the capacity to choose between different courses of action}, {Freedom is the absence of psychological constraints}, {Psychological constraints involve mental barriers that limit one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act without internal psychological limitations and have the capacity for genuine choice}

2fda5af2-dc3f-4611-b915-c94f3fa3a6b8.content: {Freedom is compatible with determinism}, {Freedom involves the absence of psychological constraints}, {Psychological constraints involve mental barriers that limit one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act without internal psychological limitations and their actions align with their desires and intentions}

6e24e5f7-96df-490e-9a27-de02457af339.content: {Freedom involves acting according to one's own values and reasons}, {Freedom is the absence of psychological constraints}, {Psychological constraints involve mental barriers that limit one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act without internal psychological limitations and according to their own values}

794dfe00-89f6-42a0-87b9-ceeb10439040.content: {Freedom involves the ability to govern oneself through rational deliberation}, {Freedom is the absence of psychological constraints}, {Psychological constraints involve mental barriers that limit one's actions}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act without internal psychological limitations and through rational self-governance}

c9e6f899-3e54-4939-b4d9-5c7505f1a182.summary: Distinguishing between psychological freedom and free will
c9e6f899-3e54-4939-b4d9-5c7505f1a182.content: {There is a distinction between psychological freedom and free will}, {Freedom as psychological freedom is a theory about the absence of internal mental barriers, not about the metaphysical ability to choose}, {The ability to choose between different courses of action is a separate issue from the absence of psychological constraints}, {A person can be psychologically free even if deterministic factors limit their choices}

7d16445c-9521-4c95-b4ce-e107b81bbe0b.summary: Rejecting the necessity of choice for freedom
7d16445c-9521-4c95-b4ce-e107b81bbe0b.content: {It is false that freedom requires the ability to choose between different courses of action}, {Freedom as psychological freedom focuses on the absence of internal mental barriers, which is sufficient for freedom}, {The intuition that choice is necessary for freedom can be explained by conflating different types of freedom}

913222c9-b487-41b0-9399-891c6e425a55.summary: Supplementing with a compatibilist view of free will
913222c9-b487-41b0-9399-891c6e425a55.content: {Compatibilism is the view that free will is compatible with determinism}, {Freedom as psychological freedom can be supplemented with a compatibilist view of free will}, {Under compatibilism, a person can have free will even if their choices are determined, as long as they act according to their desires without psychological constraints}

b66ff7eb-c8b0-4fe2-8a3d-dbb8f244ac7c.content: {Freedom is having legal rights that are effectively enforced}, {Legal rights involve protections and entitlements under the law}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals are safeguarded by legal frameworks that ensure their freedom and these frameworks are actively upheld}

ebb8a420-0736-4f4d-93c2-309cc2e40b54.summary: Freedom as Legal and Social Rights
ebb8a420-0736-4f4d-93c2-309cc2e40b54.content: {Freedom is having both legal rights and social rights}, {Legal rights involve protections and entitlements under the law}, {Social rights involve societal recognition and respect for individual autonomy}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals are safeguarded by both legal frameworks and social norms that ensure their freedom}

57f04efe-42a4-4021-abae-ce902343151b.summary: Freedom as Legal Rights and Personal Autonomy
57f04efe-42a4-4021-abae-ce902343151b.content: {Freedom is having legal rights and personal autonomy}, {Legal rights involve protections and entitlements under the law}, {Personal autonomy involves the capacity to make one's own choices without coercion}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals are safeguarded by legal frameworks and have the autonomy to make personal decisions}

686a3359-2b94-4aae-b05f-89aa47989473.summary: Freedom as Legal Rights and Non-Interference
686a3359-2b94-4aae-b05f-89aa47989473.content: {Freedom is having legal rights and experiencing non-interference}, {Legal rights involve protections and entitlements under the law}, {Non-interference involves the absence of unjustified constraints on individual actions}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals are safeguarded by legal frameworks and are free from undue interference}

53d2746d-b50d-491e-b88e-ed65dba5fa72.summary: Freedom as Legal Rights and Access to Resources
53d2746d-b50d-491e-b88e-ed65dba5fa72.content: {Freedom is having legal rights and access to necessary resources}, {Legal rights involve protections and entitlements under the law}, {Access to resources involves having the means to exercise one's rights effectively}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals are safeguarded by legal frameworks and have the resources to utilize their rights}

4c20fd96-a24b-403a-a6de-c497f9e12d2c.summary: Freedom as Legal Rights and Political Participation
4c20fd96-a24b-403a-a6de-c497f9e12d2c.content: {Freedom is having legal rights and the ability to participate in political processes}, {Legal rights involve protections and entitlements under the law}, {Political participation involves engaging in democratic processes and decision-making}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals are safeguarded by legal frameworks and can actively participate in political life}

95474004-aaf8-4898-8436-2ddec275d706.summary: Freedom as Legal Rights and Psychological Empowerment
95474004-aaf8-4898-8436-2ddec275d706.content: {Freedom is having legal rights and psychological empowerment}, {Legal rights involve protections and entitlements under the law}, {Psychological empowerment involves having the confidence and mental capacity to exercise one's rights}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals are safeguarded by legal frameworks and are psychologically empowered to act freely}

bd0251c8-b1a4-4bde-b2b2-e1653866b593.summary: Freedom as Legal Rights and Cultural Recognition
bd0251c8-b1a4-4bde-b2b2-e1653866b593.content: {Freedom is having legal rights and cultural recognition}, {Legal rights involve protections and entitlements under the law}, {Cultural recognition involves acknowledgment and respect for one's cultural identity}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals are safeguarded by legal frameworks and their cultural identities are recognized and respected}

a6b28402-bbd7-4440-afe3-39f496355119.summary: Freedom as Legal Rights and Economic Independence
a6b28402-bbd7-4440-afe3-39f496355119.content: {Freedom is having legal rights and economic independence}, {Legal rights involve protections and entitlements under the law}, {Economic independence involves having the financial means to support oneself without reliance on others}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals are safeguarded by legal frameworks and have economic independence}

8c296763-554f-457e-8776-eb325d54c785.summary: Freedom as Legal Rights and Social Equality
8c296763-554f-457e-8776-eb325d54c785.content: {Freedom is having legal rights and social equality}, {Legal rights involve protections and entitlements under the law}, {Social equality involves equal treatment and opportunities for all individuals}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals are safeguarded by legal frameworks and experience social equality}

fb53d367-52be-4624-9b1f-5bd233f05fc4.summary: Distinguishing between legal rights and effective rights
fb53d367-52be-4624-9b1f-5bd233f05fc4.content: {There is a distinction between having legal rights and having effective rights}, {Freedom as legal rights is a theory about the formal recognition of rights rather than their practical enforcement}, {A person with legal rights that are systematically ignored is not experiencing effective freedom}, {The intuition that someone is not free despite having legal rights can be explained by the lack of effective rights}

7851e676-68bb-4a1d-9188-ebced5742573.summary: Rejecting the intuition that legal rights are insufficient for freedom
7851e676-68bb-4a1d-9188-ebced5742573.content: {It is false that legal rights alone are insufficient for freedom}, {Legal rights provide a necessary framework for freedom, even if they are not always perfectly enforced}, {The presence of legal rights creates a standard against which violations can be judged and addressed}

12507b0f-7709-4316-a0a6-89be4c8aece5.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of institutional enforcement
12507b0f-7709-4316-a0a6-89be4c8aece5.content: {Legal rights require institutional enforcement to be meaningful}, {Freedom as legal rights assumes the presence of institutions that uphold and enforce these rights}, {The appearance of a lack of freedom despite legal rights is due to the absence of effective institutional enforcement}

970f6e08-6e85-49ce-a4ac-4a9f37424292.summary: Freedom as Legal Rights with Practical Means
970f6e08-6e85-49ce-a4ac-4a9f37424292.content: {Freedom is having legal rights}, {Legal rights involve protections and entitlements under the law}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals are safeguarded by legal frameworks that ensure their freedom}, {True liberty requires both legal rights and the practical means to exercise those rights}

b8526a42-3148-4323-a66d-b7a265e68b9d.summary: Freedom as Legal Rights with Social Support
b8526a42-3148-4323-a66d-b7a265e68b9d.content: {Freedom is having legal rights}, {Legal rights involve protections and entitlements under the law}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals are safeguarded by legal frameworks that ensure their freedom}, {True liberty requires social support systems that enable individuals to exercise their legal rights}

c4b0bbb3-d026-44e1-9399-14fe1b03f50a.summary: Freedom as Legal Rights with Economic Resources
c4b0bbb3-d026-44e1-9399-14fe1b03f50a.content: {Freedom is having legal rights}, {Legal rights involve protections and entitlements under the law}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals are safeguarded by legal frameworks that ensure their freedom}, {True liberty requires economic resources that allow individuals to exercise their legal rights}

6290cb1f-45ca-4457-a48f-811f48f66b33.summary: Freedom as Legal Rights with Access to Information
6290cb1f-45ca-4457-a48f-811f48f66b33.content: {Freedom is having legal rights}, {Legal rights involve protections and entitlements under the law}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals are safeguarded by legal frameworks that ensure their freedom}, {True liberty requires access to information necessary to exercise legal rights}

df9d98a1-38df-4622-96ea-d5bcca6f2108.summary: Freedom as Legal Rights with Removal of Barriers
df9d98a1-38df-4622-96ea-d5bcca6f2108.content: {Freedom is having legal rights}, {Legal rights involve protections and entitlements under the law}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals are safeguarded by legal frameworks that ensure their freedom}, {True liberty requires the removal of barriers that prevent the exercise of legal rights}

33e57118-f6ae-4d8c-a18b-60ec26e548b6.summary: Freedom as Legal Rights with Empowerment
33e57118-f6ae-4d8c-a18b-60ec26e548b6.content: {Freedom is having legal rights}, {Legal rights involve protections and entitlements under the law}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals are safeguarded by legal frameworks that ensure their freedom}, {True liberty requires empowerment of individuals to utilize their legal rights effectively}

ca6d13ba-6e1d-4432-b691-c2b21a315a30.content: {Freedom is having legal rights}, {Freedom is having positive liberty}, {Legal rights involve protections and entitlements under the law}, {Positive liberty involves the capacity to act upon one's free will and realize one's potential}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals are safeguarded by legal frameworks and possess positive liberty that ensures their freedom}

d9eed892-8838-4c57-97ce-6297095ddc4e.summary: Freedom as Legal Rights and Negative Liberty
d9eed892-8838-4c57-97ce-6297095ddc4e.content: {Freedom is having legal rights}, {Freedom is having negative liberty}, {Legal rights involve protections and entitlements under the law}, {Negative liberty involves the absence of obstacles or constraints imposed by others}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals are safeguarded by legal frameworks and possess negative liberty that ensures their freedom}

2faa02d3-25c7-4186-b629-b5e5438af759.summary: Distinguishing between legal and psychological freedom
2faa02d3-25c7-4186-b629-b5e5438af759.content: {There is a distinction between legal freedom and psychological freedom}, {Freedom as legal rights is a theory about legal freedom rather than psychological freedom}, {A person with legal rights is free in the legal sense even if they are psychologically manipulated}, {The intuition that someone is not free due to psychological manipulation can be explained as confusion between legal freedom and psychological freedom}

8b33a816-b7ec-4c3c-8d4f-070b5e970e39.summary: Rejecting the intuition that legal rights are insufficient for freedom
8b33a816-b7ec-4c3c-8d4f-070b5e970e39.content: {It is false that legal rights are insufficient for capturing the concept of freedom}, {Legal rights provide a necessary framework for freedom by protecting individuals from coercion and ensuring entitlements}, {The presence of legal rights ensures a baseline of freedom, even if other factors like psychological manipulation are present}

a263cd39-947d-417c-a5e0-0d1907028f3c.summary: Supplementing with a broader understanding of freedom
a263cd39-947d-417c-a5e0-0d1907028f3c.content: {Legal rights are a crucial component of freedom but not the only aspect}, {Freedom involves multiple dimensions, including moral, social, and psychological aspects}, {A comprehensive understanding of freedom includes legal rights as a foundational element while acknowledging other dimensions}

bb6dd9ff-6c5d-4899-86d7-23e6bcad7c50.summary: Freedom as Legal Rights with Social Equality
bb6dd9ff-6c5d-4899-86d7-23e6bcad7c50.content: {Freedom is having legal rights}, {Legal rights involve protections and entitlements under the law}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals are safeguarded by legal frameworks that ensure their freedom}, {Social equality is necessary for the effective exercise of legal rights}, {True freedom requires both legal rights and social equality}

2d616957-07df-40e2-bbab-19220a7e3055.content: {Freedom is having the capability to achieve one's goals}, {Capabilities involve the real opportunities to do and be what one values}, {Legal rights are one of many factors that contribute to capabilities}, {Social conditions must support the development of individual capabilities}, {True freedom is the ability to pursue a life one has reason to value}

3f45e240-d9c1-4d96-a743-c6acb3616208.content: {Freedom is the absence of domination by others}, {Domination involves the capacity of others to arbitrarily interfere in one's choices}, {Legal rights are necessary to protect against domination}, {Social equality reduces the risk of domination}, {True freedom requires both legal rights and the absence of social domination}

e6acde18-f101-4456-947e-cf0be0675fb6.content: {Freedom is the capacity for self-determination}, {Autonomy involves making choices based on one's own values and reasons}, {Legal rights support autonomy by providing a framework for decision-making}, {Social equality enhances autonomy by ensuring equal access to opportunities}, {True freedom is the ability to live according to one's own values without undue external constraints}

023e5594-15a3-47b0-9130-d2fd4af87ab8.content: {Freedom is the ability to act on one's true desires}, {Positive liberty involves having the resources and opportunities to fulfill one's potential}, {Legal rights are necessary but not sufficient for positive liberty}, {Social equality provides the conditions for individuals to realize their potential}, {True freedom is the realization of one's authentic self through access to opportunities and resources}

8a7d5c82-b1d3-4517-bc77-9f59324e6b35.summary: Distinguishing between legal and substantive freedom
8a7d5c82-b1d3-4517-bc77-9f59324e6b35.content: {There is a distinction between legal freedom and substantive freedom}, {Freedom as legal rights is a theory about legal freedom rather than substantive freedom}, {Legal rights provide a framework for freedom but do not guarantee the ability to exercise those rights in practice}, {Social inequality affects substantive freedom but does not negate the existence of legal rights}, {The intuition that legal rights are insufficient for freedom can be explained as a confusion between legal and substantive freedom}

cf557773-7e18-4333-9021-ba0cd6f8e0d0.summary: Rejecting the necessity of social equality for legal freedom
cf557773-7e18-4333-9021-ba0cd6f8e0d0.content: {It is false that social equality is necessary for legal freedom}, {Legal freedom is defined by the presence of legal rights, not by the social conditions in which they are exercised}, {A person can be legally free even in a society with social inequality if they possess legal rights}, {The impact of social inequality on the exercise of rights does not negate the existence of legal freedom}

6732d084-7803-46db-9f91-620a0a8db5ca.summary: Supplementing with the assumption of effective legal enforcement
6732d084-7803-46db-9f91-620a0a8db5ca.content: {Effective legal enforcement is a supplementary assumption necessary for the exercise of legal rights}, {Legal rights ensure freedom when they are effectively enforced and accessible to all individuals}, {Social inequality can undermine the exercise of legal rights if enforcement is not effective}, {With effective enforcement, legal rights can ensure freedom even in the presence of social inequality}

2b38efad-28aa-4245-b42e-f7bf8612beb0.content: {Freedom is having legal rights}, {Legal rights involve protections and entitlements under the law}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals are safeguarded by stable legal frameworks that ensure their freedom}, {Legal rights must be protected from arbitrary change to guarantee freedom}

79dd8d4c-7f2b-4112-ada1-9f824430690e.summary: Freedom as Legal Rights with Democratic Oversight
79dd8d4c-7f2b-4112-ada1-9f824430690e.content: {Freedom is having legal rights}, {Legal rights involve protections and entitlements under the law}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals are safeguarded by legal frameworks that ensure their freedom}, {Legal rights must be subject to democratic oversight to prevent arbitrary change}

7900ffce-9c99-440f-8be8-a24e7ef24f5d.summary: Freedom as Legal Rights with Constitutional Safeguards
7900ffce-9c99-440f-8be8-a24e7ef24f5d.content: {Freedom is having legal rights}, {Legal rights involve protections and entitlements under the law}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals are safeguarded by legal frameworks that ensure their freedom}, {Legal rights must be protected by constitutional safeguards to prevent arbitrary change}

9950035a-08a1-4609-a4c1-a0e3273e0eaf.summary: Freedom as Legal Rights with Judicial Review
9950035a-08a1-4609-a4c1-a0e3273e0eaf.content: {Freedom is having legal rights}, {Legal rights involve protections and entitlements under the law}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals are safeguarded by legal frameworks that ensure their freedom}, {Legal rights must be subject to judicial review to prevent arbitrary change}

84209849-ef25-46d0-9c5e-b438bd157f16.summary: Freedom as Legal Rights with International Standards
84209849-ef25-46d0-9c5e-b438bd157f16.content: {Freedom is having legal rights}, {Legal rights involve protections and entitlements under the law}, {Liberty is achieved when individuals are safeguarded by legal frameworks that ensure their freedom}, {Legal rights must align with international standards to prevent arbitrary change}

9156adac-c2a1-4c12-8193-437dd5343c75.summary: Distinguishing between stable and unstable legal rights
9156adac-c2a1-4c12-8193-437dd5343c75.content: {There is a distinction between stable legal rights and unstable legal rights}, {Freedom as legal rights is a theory about stable legal rights rather than unstable ones}, {Legal rights that are subject to arbitrary change do not qualify as stable legal rights}, {A person with unstable legal rights is not free in the relevant sense of having stable legal rights}, {The intuition that someone is not free under arbitrary legal rights can be explained by the lack of stability and predictability}

828f9ca2-52f9-44c3-8250-da56eca91154.summary: Rejecting the intuition that arbitrary change negates freedom
828f9ca2-52f9-44c3-8250-da56eca91154.content: {It is false that arbitrary change in legal rights necessarily negates freedom}, {Freedom can still be present if the legal system provides mechanisms to challenge or rectify arbitrary changes}, {The presence of legal rights, even if subject to change, can still offer a framework for liberty through legal recourse and advocacy}

a3cae25b-4156-4f45-b37f-31e74ddb7825.summary: Supplementing with a requirement for legal stability
a3cae25b-4156-4f45-b37f-31e74ddb7825.content: {Legal rights must include a supplementary requirement for stability to ensure freedom}, {A legal framework that incorporates checks and balances can prevent arbitrary changes}, {The assurance of legal stability is necessary for legal rights to effectively guarantee freedom}

ce086008-2562-4103-93e3-8ec767d95c38.content: {Freedom is the presence of equal opportunity}, {Equal opportunity involves having the same rights and access to pursue one's goals}, {Liberty is present when individuals have equal chances to succeed based on their efforts and choices}

d1d882a2-082f-4b1f-95c9-4c559412c0de.content: {Freedom is the presence of fair distribution of resources}, {Fair distribution involves ensuring that everyone has enough resources to meet basic needs}, {Liberty is present when individuals have sufficient resources to pursue their life plans}

4dffde86-76fa-4950-9dba-81b1e382d12f.content: {Freedom is the absence of discrimination}, {Non-discrimination involves treating individuals without bias based on irrelevant characteristics}, {Liberty is present when individuals are judged and treated based on their merits and actions}

458a3315-6c76-492c-8dcd-24cba200350f.content: {Freedom is the presence of capabilities}, {Capabilities involve having the real ability to achieve desired outcomes}, {Liberty is present when individuals have the necessary means to convert opportunities into achievements}

649cf1f9-fcad-44bc-8845-e16461617b7c.content: {Freedom is the presence of autonomy}, {Autonomy involves the ability to make one's own choices}, {Liberty is present when individuals can pursue their own goals without external interference}

0418af2f-9996-4e87-95bd-713f443c43fa.content: {Freedom is the absence of coercion}, {Coercion involves being forced to act against one's will}, {Liberty is present when individuals can act according to their own decisions without being compelled by others}

610f0859-0e54-40a3-96f2-fa0972a2fe9f.content: {Freedom is the presence of justice}, {Justice involves fair treatment and respect for rights}, {Liberty is present when individuals are treated justly and their rights are upheld}
